34816.name: Breakthrough
34816.description: Breakthrough is an icehouse game designed to be played on a chess board with 2 players, each needing 1 stash. The objective is to be the first player to move one of his pieces to the opposite end of the board.

34817.name: Monopoly: New York Giants Superbowl XLII Champions
34817.description: Themed Monopoly based on the football team, the New York Giants and their victory in Super Bowl XLII in January 2007. The 6 collectible pewter tokens are: Linebacker, Quarterback, Football on a tee, Referee's Whistle, Giants helmet, and a Cleat. 60-minute game play option makes for a shorter/quicker game.

34818.name: IceGolf
34818.description:
IceGolf is a dexterity game for Icehouse Gaming Pyramids.

One to five players can compete with a single Treehouse set, using the pyramids as golf balls, the die as the hole, and the tube as a golf club!

Play a quick hole on a tabletop with the Basic Game.
Use Martian Coasters as hazards in the Advanced Game.
Try your hand at the more challenging head-to-head Matchplay variant.
Or, if you feel too restricted on a tabletop and want to let loose, an entire room may be used to create each hole!

Complete rules can be found at the Icehouse Games Wiki.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

boardgamehonor: 2009 Lys Enfant Finalist
34819.description:
Welcome to the South Pole! Our penguins in Pengoloo are ready to play with you, so roll the dice to find their matching hidden eggs. Be the first to collect six penguins to win. Memory and a little luck will help you succeed in this fun South Pole eggspedition!

In slightly more detail, players roll colored dice, then look for eggs of those colors. The twist is that you can re-find eggs that have already been found to take additional turns. The advanced rule option allows players to steal eggs from each other.
34819.name: Pengoloo
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide

34821.name: Dominew
34821.description:
Dominew is a revolutionary domino game. The multiple of possibilities provides endless challenge. Point are earned by adding adjacent identical numbers.

With clever tactics and sharp logic you earn the most points and win the game.

34822.name: Barbie Butterfly Princess
34822.description:
"... enter this enchanted garden and become Butterfly Princess Barbie! Spin the magic wand spinner and watch the butterflies flutter. Move your Butterfly Princess along the path and collect three butterflies first to win the game!"

Includes colorful board, spinner assembly, four stand-up Barbie figures, rings, and rules.

Players should be Ages 5 and up.

(c)1995 Mattel Item #7200

34823.name: El desafío del desierto PARIS-DAKAR
34823.description:
Published by Factor Games and Iberian Nissan Motor S.A.

The object is to obtain the major possible punctuation in three stages of the game that correspond to three tours of the Paris - Dakar, each of them with more difficulties that the previous one. Ages 6 and up

Content:
- 16 player pieces
- 2 pieces of setback
- 1 dice
- 60 instructions cards
- 102 supplies cards
- 1 board
- instructions

34824.name: Bull Chase
34824.description:
After pitching their tents in the dark, campers awake to find that they have slept in the wrong colored tents! To their horror, they also find they are in a field full of bulls! The campers hurriedly try to reach their own tent to leave for home, but first have to cross the field and avoid the bulls.
The pieces are plastic people and the bulls are detailed plastic with flipper fronts, so they can toss the campers!

34825.name: 4-mation
boardgamepublisher: The United States Playing Card Company
34825.description: "4-MATION The Underhanded Rummy Game Go ahead and be devious! You're allowed in this underhanded rummy-style game to sabotage and revenge! Use the 4-Mation community cards to create sequences and match sets. Get rid of your cards first to win! WATCH OUT! Everyone IS out to get you!"

34826.name: Stora skandiska kriget
34826.description:
Stora skandiska kriget is a traditional hex-and-counter magazine game that came with the Swedish fanzine "Den fjättrade gåsen" #6, February 2004.

The game includes a cardboard map, size A4, an OOB, also A4, and a set of uncut laser printed counters. The magazine itself includes the rules and is of A5 size.

There are two scenarios, named "Vasakriget" & "Operation kuling" with two different countries & thus sets of units, both utilizing the same map. Both scenarios are set in the world of the Swedish post-apocalyptic RPG Mutant 2, of 1980:ies vintage.

34827.description: Isle at war is game of conquest set on a fictitious island of warring feudal kingdoms, players tax their population and use the wealth to raise great armies and build castles. To win a player must conquer the entire island. Isle at war is a print and play game and can be printed out on one page, all that is required to play on top of that is a single 6 sided die.
34827.name: Isle at War

34828.name: OHMU War Machine
34828.description:
A science fiction miniatures wargame with very streamlined rules to enable large scale battles to be played in reasonable periods of time.

The rules allow for a whole range of unit types from basic flak-jacket and assault rifle infantry, up through power-armoured infantry, tracked/wheeled/hover AFVs, WIGE (ground effect) units, enormous OGRE-style nuclear powered cybertanks and all kinds of mech (akin to Battletech, Robotech etc.) units - two, three four and six-legged are all accounted for.

The rules are for 1/300th scale units, enabling players to easily assemble an army from a variety of sources and manufacturers including Battletech figures, Epic WH40K figures, Ground Zero and a plethora of small white-metal figure manufacturers.

Included are outlines of the eight major power-blocs in the future world of OHMU, each with their own particular "flavour" - from the ultra high-tech Pacific Rim Coalition to the more direct approach of the Russian Commonwealth; however all the army lists are very well balanced having been extensively playtested.

Although nominally a 2-player wargame the mechanics do easily permit more players to participate either as sub-commanders on two opposing sides, or even as a three-way (or more if you're ambitious) battle.

A very effective command & control framework is a key element of the game mechanics. Another innovative concept, far ahead of its time, is the inclusion of scenarios that players bid on, attempting to undercut each other's force values. The scenarios (if one opts to use them) themselves provide variety to the battles thus avoiding the typical "line up two equal armies and attack" situation.

96 page softcover A4 rulebook. Black & white illustrations throughout, with 8 colour plates.

(And in case you were wondering, OHMU stands for Oversized Heavy Mechanized Unit...!)

boardgamehonor: 2009 Boardgames Australia Awards Best International Game Nominee
34829.description:
From BoardgameNews.com:

"Ilium is another term for ancient Troy, and players are archaeologists following in the footsteps of Heinrich Schliemann, looking for artifacts in the newly excavated site of that fabled city.

The board and game play might remind you of Portobello Market, the first strategy game of this style from Playroom. The board shows a number of dig sites, with paths of different lengths connecting the sites. To start the game, you place a number of discovery tiles on each site equal to the number of paths leading to it. The tiles show one of five types of artifacts, with 1-5 artifacts on a tile. Each player has his own deck of cards, and the card you draw each turn determines how many archaeologists (1-3) you place on one empty space on any path. When a path fills, the player with the most archaeologists on the path collects one tile from one of the adjacent dig sites – but in each site he may choose only the tile with the fewest artifacts; the player with the second most artifacts takes the tile that the first player didn’t. As the dig sites empty, the more valuable tiles can be claimed.

The game ends after all five tiles with five artifacts on them have been claimed. Each player was dealt a secret card at the start of the game representing one of the types of artifacts, and players must now discard the tile of that type that contains the most artifacts. The player who ends up with the most complete sets wins the game."
34829.name: Ilium

34830.name: Im Bärenwald
34830.description: In a forest clearing the small bears have built a playground. They have created 3 games they play there: "Hi-Hei-Ho", "Bären-Wettlauf" and "Bäumchen pflanzen".

34832.name: Pi-Pa-Poker
34832.description: It is a kind of memory game where the three syllables "Pi" "Pa" "Poker" must be found.

34835.description: The red police motorbikes are roaring, the trucks with the obstacles go through the narrow streets of Manhattan. The police wants to catch 12 escaped convicts again. Not the best single player wins, but the best police team.
34835.name: Police Academy

34836.name: Das große Gartenspiel
34836.description: In this game the players collect packages of seeds and plant them in their garden until this area is full. They should harmonize together because the players get points for this. When a player succeeds in placing 16 to 24 plants in the garden the game is over. Who will become "Super-gardener"?

34837.name: Goofy & Max: Ärgern macht Spaß!
34837.description:
In this game the object is to move your pawns across the finish line as fast as possible. But pay attention - the pawns have two sides with different characters on them and are turned to the other side on each turn of a player.
So it may happen that a pawn moved across the finish line by the first player could then be moved by an opponent to the opponents finish line. The player who brings home the most pawns wins.

34838.name: Rex
34838.description:
Rex was published by "Rex-Verlag Rudolf Schilling" in Frankfurt am Main, Germany in 1900. It can be described as a mixture between Salta from 1899, since the pieces of each player have to cross the board to the other side, and Chess, for the pieces have different value and represent General, Horse, Soldier etc.

Unlike Chess, captured pieces are of a certain value (between 1 and 40!), and pieces all move in the same way (one step along the lines) crossing a grid of diagonally linked points in alternating dark and light rows. To start, pieces can jump from the "encampment" onto each of the points in the first row. Only pieces on dark points can be captured - obviously only by pieces on light points. After crossing the "battlefield", they "jump off" into the opponent`s encampment, where they are safe.
The game ends, if one player cannot do a legal move anymore. The player with less lost points wins the game. But aware: Not only captured pieces score negative, also the pieces still in your own half (now the opponents`) are considered "captured".

There were different editions of the game, a more expensive one with 3-dimensional figures and a cheaper one with flat stones instead.

In 1902 there was a second edition with simpler rules.

34839.name: UNO: Kobe Bryant Special Edition
34839.description:
Uno variation themed on Kobe Bryant, star basketball player for the NBA Los Angeles Lakers team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Three-Pointer" card and rule which allows you to choose a player to keep drawing cards until they can draw a #1, #2, or #3 card.

34840.name: UNO: LeBron James Special Edition
34840.description:
An Uno variation themed on LeBron James, star basketball player for the NBA Cleveland Cavaliers team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Hail to the King" card and rule that forces an opponent to draw cards from you and other players

34841.name: UNO: Reggie Bush Special Edition
34841.description:
An Uno variation based on Reggie Bush, star running back for the NFL New Orleans Saints football team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: exclusive "All Purpose" card and rule celebrating Bush's versatility as a running back, receiver, and kick returner.

34842.name: UNO: Brett Favre NFL Greatest Players Edition
34842.description:
Another Uno variation, this one based on NFL quarterback star Brett Favre. Comes in a case shaped and decorated like Favre's #4 Jersey.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: exclusive "Leap" card and rule celebrating the famous "Lambeau Leap".

34843.name: Wizard's Gambit
34843.description:
"Join the Convocation of Wizards in battle against the ancient enemy - The Fallen! Do you have what it takes to become the next Grand Siege Magus?"

In Wizard’s Gambit, players become wizards who take turns placing Magical Components on Spells in a common Spell Pool in the center of the play area.

When all of the required Magical Components have been placed on a given Spell, the wizard who completed that Spell claims it as their own, creating a Spell Book face up in front of them. Once the Spell is added to their Spell Book, a wizard may immediately apply the effects of the Spell, giving him more power to defeat his competitors.

Wizards can further affect the course of play by casting Incantation cards during their turn, which can provide advantages in playing the game. Additionally, wizards can invoke the highest power, the Wizard’s Gambit, to thwart other wizard competitors and increase their chance of claiming powerful Spells for their own.

Each Spell has a point value, which adds up cumulatively to represent their Spell Book’s score. The first wizard to reach a Spell point total of ten (10) points wins the game and is proclaimed Grand Siege Magus.

Wizard's Gambit is a light-hearted game for the casual gamer and for family play.

34844.name: Lucky Puck
34844.description: Two player Electronic Ice Hockey game where both you and your opponent can control each of the six players on your team in order to try and get the correct position from which you can score a goal.

34845.name: Buchstaben-Beutel
34845.description:
Actually a collection of five word-finding games, players alternately place markers on letters and must e.g. build a sentence containing only words starting with covered letters.
The "board" is actually a piece of leather which can be folded as the bag where game markers will be put in.
All comes in a small wooden block.

34848.description: One of the earliest three-dimensional chess games. Played on a series of stacked boards creating a 5x5x5 grid. Features the standard chess pieces with rules of their movement adapted to three dimensions, as well as a unicorn piece that travels on a different diagonal axis than the bishop.
34848.name: Raumschach

34849.description:
This is an extension Valley of the Mammoths

This extension adds 8 new terrains that are "discovered" during the game

Desert
Fertile lands
Swamp
Thick forest
Lava pit
New Volcano
Glacier




It also adds a Yeti, 1 pit, 4 Neanderthal men and 56 new cards

Expands:

Valley of the Mammoths
34849.name: La Vallée des Mammouths: L'extension

34850.name: Action
34850.description:
From the publishers homepage:

Fun and entertaining cardgame for children and families. ACTION is an advanced Memory game where it matters when you make the pairs/tricks. Each trick contains an ACTION you have to execute when the trick is made.

In ACTION you will play cards on both hand and table. Pair the cards to make tricks. Each trick results in an ACTION - maybe stealing or switching cards and tricks. Courage, patience and a good memory are vital skills in ACTION!

ACTION can be played by 2 to 6 players, so the entire family can join in. It's easy and quick to learn. ACTION recreate the fun in challenging each other in the skills of memory and planning. ACTION is for bigger children and families.

ACTION contains 108 cards (a total of 2x27 pairs.) More players can pursue the same tricks at the same time. Game rules in 11 languages are provided, so you can easily find your new ACTION opponent during your next vacation.

34851.name: Ancestors
34851.description:
This is a Mormon game which teaches about Mormon genealogy and their family sealing practices on a monopoly type board, with a separate board where one collects cards relating to family members, and then tries to collect other cards to unite those family members.

From submitters' memory:

The Gameboard was a dark color, and composed of dark colors, but basic layout was like a monopoly board. At the corners it had side routes which you could choose to go on instead of the main route. These would have slightly longer detours around the corners. You would roll one die and advance that many spaces. On each space were opportunities to earn money, spend money, find ancestors and locate ancestors. If you found an ancestor, you obtained a blue (boys) or pink (girls) card representing that ancestor which you then put on your own board (which you had in front of you) which represented you and all your ancestors. The idea was to collect all these ancestors (such as brother, mother, sister, grandmother, grandfather, etc.) and put their cards in their respective portions of this board. Once you had them all, the next goal was to seal/unite them all together. You did this mainly on those side routes, which was where you could get sealing cards. You would put these cards (one per link between each ancestor) to connect the ancestors together. The first person to connect all their family/ancestors together won the game.

34852.name: Dice Games
34852.description: Dice Games is a book explaining and illustrating instructions on how to play 10 different dice games. The games are relatively basic and are intended for children. The games included are: Pig, Thirty-Six, High Dice, Rotation, Cross Out, Tic-Tac-Toe Dice, Going to Boston, Multiplication, Help Your Neighbor, and Horse.

boardgamecompilation: Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #2
34853.description:
Normal Zooloretto rules enhanced with mission cards.

At the beginning of the game, every player gets one of the five cards coming with this expansion. Each card shows three animal types. This card has to be kept secret.

At the end of the game, the player gets (beginning from the top)


+ 3 points for every full enclosure with this animal
+ 2 points for every full enclosure with this animal
no minus points for this animal in the stable


It is also part of the Rio Grande Games Exp. Pack #2 with several mini expansions.

Expands:

Zooloretto




Home Page & Newsletter:

www.zooloretto.com




(German, english, dutch, hungarian, spanish, swedish)
boardgameversion: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #2 edition
34853.name: Zooloretto: Job Boards

34854.description:
Strike Force One: Expert Game is an expansion for the 2nd edition of the classic introductory wargame, Strike Force One. Beyond the Standard Game, beyond the Advanced Game, this Expert Game includes two new units types (Tank and Pioneer Companies), random events (that might bring replacements, reinforcements, or off-map support into the fray), and new Optional Rules and Scenarios.

And not only is the gameplay enhanced, but also the learning value. Strike Force One brings additional BATTLESSON (TM) material to the players, enhancing their instruction with an Expert Game Replay (including commentary, analysis, and military advice) that will help you to better marshal your forces and win!

Expands:

Strike Force One
34854.name: Strike Force One+: The Expert Game Expansion

34855.description:
This chess variant follows the basic rules of chess, but adapts them to a unique, circular board. (The board layout was patented in the U.S. by the designers.) The pieces are set up identically to normal chess. A ninth diameter (file) is added, but with unplayable spaces in the first two circles (ranks). This prevents the pieces in the first rank from directly attacking each other. The rules also include castling and capturing en passant.

This game is distinctly different from Byzantine Chess and Circular Chess (the latter developed by David Reynolds), using a different board layout, set-up, and rules.
34855.name: Circular Chess

34856.description:
This chess variant was developed by David Reynolds after reading a reference to chess being played on a circular board in medieval times. Imagining how it might have played, he developed such a version.

His board consists of four rings (files) and sixteen radii (ranks) with a large, unplayable center circle. Mr. Reynolds would often adorn the center with the crest of the city of Lincoln, U.K., thus the design is often referred to as a "Lincoln board".

A standard set of chess pieces is used. However, each player gets two ranks of pieces surrounded by two ranks of pawns. The king and queen are placed on the innermost file (ring). Movement mimics standard chess, allowing the rooks and queen to move fully around a ring. Castling and en passant capturing are not allowed.

This variant is distinctly different from the Circular Chess variant designed by Alan and Martin Mattlage, in board layout, starting set-up, and rules.

This variant does use the same board as Byzantine Chess, but there are rule differences.
34856.name: Circular Chess

34857.name: Binary Dice
34857.description:
From the back of the game box:
BINARY DICE are the hottest and most versatile new concept in dice since the cube was invented. A single set of BINARY DICE can replace all those multi-sided dice: with 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20 and 30 sides. Simply use as many BINARY DICE as needed in each case: the two or three lowest in an ordinary family game, or all five for deciding an important outcome to within a resolution of 3%.
Contents: 5 × BINARY DICE, rules for Binary Yatzy and Binary 3 in a Row."

The set consists of just 5 little white square tiles, each of which is blank on one side and bears a number (1, 2, 4, 8 or 16) on the other. The dice can be used to play two games - Binary Yatzy (A Yatzee-like game that has an innovative scoring grid which adds an extra dimension to consider when taking one's score) and Binary 3 in a row (Tic-tac-toe using the binary dice - players cast the first 3 binary dice and then must flip one of them before using the total sum to place their mark, so there is some thought involved).

34859.name: MagnetX
34859.description:
MagnetX brings new twist on the abstract strategy board game genre. It combines both action and strategy on a playing field where magnetic stones are placed.

MagnetX is played with 20 stones; each set of stones is unique to the game. The stones vary in from 3/8" up to 3/4", they are polished, black stones that vary in magnetic strength. The stones are placed on a translucent acrylic board. Each stone is placed flat, or to increase difficulty, on edge such that other stones do not come into contact with any other stones already in play. Stones may be placed so they hang off the edge, or teeter in the middle of a group of stones as long as stone(s) do not fall off or come in contact with each other.

There are basic rules for the beginner and advanced rules that enhance strategy.

34860.name: Shah-Shah
34860.description:
From the box cover - "Fascinating Game of Old Persia"

This game is similar to the Parker Brothers game "Sorry" but with rolling a die to move their markers instead of drawing a card. Players start with their two wooden disk playing pieces in one of the four corners of the board and attempt to be the first to get both of them safely to the middle of the board.

On the board are spaces labeled "safety" (on which pieces are safe from being returned to their home base) and "Shah" (from which the game gets its name) which allows a piece to enter the center of the board (the objective of the game.)

Players may only enter the inner rings of the board through entry spaces of their color.

34861.name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: Sci-Fi/Fantasy
34861.description: A set of 80 additional cards for the game You've Been Sentenced with science-fiction/fantasy themes.

34862.name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: Gourmet Cuisine
34862.description: Additional 80 cards for the game You've Been Sentenced with cooking themes.

34863.description:
Additional 80 card for the game You've Been Sentenced with sports themes.

Expands:

You've Been Sentenced
34863.name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: Sports Highlights

34864.name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: Pop Culture
34864.description: Additional 80 cards for You've Been Sentenced with popular culture themes.

34865.description: YBS! Reader's Digest Add-On DeckMcNeill Designs for Brighter MindsBuild your vocabulary, nonverbaciously!You’ve been Sentenced! Add-On Decks are 80 card expansions that enhance, personalize and modify You’ve been Sentenced! to your particular area of interest. The Reader’s Digest Word Power Challenge adds 400 of their favorite vocabulary enhancing words from their magazine’s treasuredfeature, Word Power page (formerly, It Pays to Improve Your Word Power). Add a deck with your purchase of You’ve been Sentenced! Alternatively, buy decks for friends and family who already play! Seriously Hilarious!
34865.name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: Reader's Digest National Word Power Challenge (A-L)

34866.name: Crossword
34866.description:
From the box:

The roll and tumble criss-cross word game.

A fascinating game to test your speed and skill as you try to make the highest scoring crossword before time runs out.

The roll of the letter cubes brings a new challenge to each game.

Fun to play alone or with others.

Ages 8 and up

34867.name: BRATZ Genie Magic:  As You Wish
34867.description:
The Bratz™ girls are Genies in training. The players must use their newfound knowledge to visit all the fab fashion stores. The first person to get 3 wishes granted is the winner!

Includes:

5 Player Pieces
1 Game Board
1 Die
54 Cards
Features:

Cool Game Play
Become a Magical Bratz™ Genie
Based on World's Most Popular Fashion Doll Line

34868.name: Tenka Goudatsu
34868.description:
This game covers the Sekigahara campaign, with particular attention to castle sieges.

The game map covers the area from Osaka to the eastern castles and the game spans from August to November, 1600. One side takes the forces of Ieyasu Tokugawa and the other the forces of the Toyotomi clan.

It includes a A1-sized map, 140 counters and a 12-page rulebook.

34869.description: SHADOW HUNTERS Expansion Kit adds 10 new characters to the original Shadow Hunters product. 10 new special abilities and new win conditions of "Neutrals" make the gameplay of "SHADOW HUNTERS" more exciting. You can choose from 20 characters in total! You can mix freely this expansion's additional 10 characters and the original 10 characters. One of the original characters (Bob) has been reprinted with changed text.
34869.name: Shadow Hunters Expansion

boardgamehonor: 2011 Lucca Games Best Boardgame for Experts
34871.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In an age of great battles, valiant leaders, and unscrupulous mercenary armies, fortune lies within your grasp.

Ventura is a board game of nobility and conquest for 2-4 players. Set in 14th century Italy, Ventura puts players in control of warring noble houses, each vying for control of the country's growing wealth. Balance your house’s earnings and maintain your hired soldiers to keep your family’s noble standing. Remember, the best armies are also the ones that cost the most!

With more than 120 plastic pieces, 40 Territory tiles, 4 Family Boards, a scoring board, and over 100 cards, Ventura will whisk players into a world of warring mercenaries and noble families, all seeking control of Italy’s burgeoning wealth.
34871.name: Ventura

34872.name: ELECTION! The Election Game
34872.description:
From the publisher's website:

ELECTION! The Election Game is a fun new board game which puts you on the road to the White House! Roll the die and move around the board collecting Money, Lobby, Vote and Politics cards. First, get elected to Congress, then the Senate, and, if you collect enough Votes , move to the inner circle, occupy the White House and WIN THE GAME! But watch out! There are many pitfalls along the way! Opponents can freeze you in place with a FILLIBUSTER! card, or steal your Votes with a REDISTRICTING card! But you can fend off their attacks with SPIN CONTROL! cards! Ten different Politics cards; thousands of scenarios!

ELECTION! The Election Game combines skill, luck and strategy in a simplified and non-partisan game that makes light of the hijinx that characterize American politics and the election process. It is easy enough for anyone to quickly enjoy, but requires enough strategy to make players think and plan ahead.

34873.name: Dodgem
34873.description:
Dodgem is a simple abstract strategy game invented by Colin Vout and described in the book Winning Ways for Your Mathematical Plays. It is played on an n×n board with n-1 cars for each player—two cars each on a 3×3 board is enough for an interesting game, but larger sizes are also possible.

The board is initially set up with n-1 blue cars along the left edge and n-1 red cars along the bottom edge, the bottom left square remaining empty. Turns alternate: player 1 ("Left")'s turn is to move any one of the blue cars one space forwards (right) or sideways (up or down). Player 2 ("Right")'s turn is to move any one of the red cars one space forwards (up) or sideways (left or right).

Cars may not move onto occupied spaces. They may leave the board, but only by a forward move. A car which leaves the board is out of the game.

The winner is the player who first has no legal move on their turn because all their cars are either off the board or blocked in by their opponent.

[From Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dodgem]

34874.name: HACK'N'SLASH
34874.description:
HACK'N'SLASH is a competitive fantasy adventure card game for the entire family. You adventure through the ever changing dungeon with characters of different strengths and abilities, scoring points for conquered monsters and gathering treasures. Not only are you battling wits with Dracaena, but also against your opponents.

Can you be the first to escape the labyrinth with the most treasures and fallen foes?

34875.name: L'auto écolo
34875.description: L'auto écologique is a game about ecological cars and ecology in general. The goal is to go from one end of the board to the other more quickly than your opponents. Each move costs "Oxygen", which supply is limited. To earn "Oxygen" players must answer questions about ecology.

34876.name: World War
34876.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"With the fall of the great nations came the growing of many more. The end of WW3 found the European continent once again blank and ripe for the taking. It is up to you and your band to retake and remake the land."

A game "fit for an almost unlimited number of players", up to the number of hexes on the mapsheet. Each player starts with one settlement and one army somewhere on the continent of Europe. Settlements abstractly provide the means to support existing armies and allow new armies to be built. Combat is resolved by a simple dice contest. The winner is the last player to have surviving units on the map.

34877.name: Jason Donovan Straight From The Heart
34877.description: A game where there are 4 jigsaw puzzles to complete in order to "win the heart of Jason". By answering questions about Jason Donovan and also about the other players, you win pieces, and also collect pieces from the board.

34879.name: Alphabetor
34879.description:
Translation form the French box:

You enjoy playing with letters and doing crossword puzzles? Then you will love ALPHABETOR!

54 letters on 54 cards, including 2 jokers, with wich you can create words by joining cards in more than 50 different games: this is ALPHABETOR.

34880.name: Hexciting Connection
34880.description: The players place tiles on the game board and gets points depending on what hexes the tiles cover. New tiles need to connect nicely to previous tiles. Each turn, a player only has two tiles to choose from, which makes it possible for players to destroy for each other by looking at each others options and make sure none of them is good.

34881.name: Mad Lab
34881.description:
From the box:

Four mad professors locked in a lab cooking up potions, conjuring a trap!

Inside the flask bouncing around, lurks their creation trying to get out.

Everyone's wary, passing the flask. No one is sure when the cork will go pop!

MAD LAB is the manic game where you don't want to be GLOOPED by a LITTLE GREEN MONSTER!

Keep the flask moving, ducking this way and that - any time now it's going to go BLAT!

Three strikes and you're out. Last one alive makes it out of the Mad Lab!

34882.name: Monopoly: Shrek Collector's
34882.description:
This 2007 collector's edition of Monopoly features locations from the popular Shrek animated film trilogy in place of the traditional Atlantic City streets. Instead of advancing to Boardwalk or taking a ride on the Reading, you will now visit Shrek's Swamp or hitch a ride in an Onion Carriage. In addition, the locations are grouped so that like locations are in the same color-group. For example, the orange group (traditionally St. James Place, Tennessee Avenue, and New York Avenue) are now Charming's Dinner Theater, The Poison Apple, and Tower Castle-which in the films were presented as places where villains were found. Special tokens are included for this version-Pinocchio, Gingy, Puss in Boots, Donkey, Fiona, and Shrek. Chance and Community Chest are replaced with Spells and Potions, and Houses and Hotels are recolored teal and purple, and are called Cottages and Castles. Also includes special bank notes which feature the heroes on the face. The bills are as follows:

1's-Pinocchio
5's-The Three Little Pigs & Big Bad Wolf
10's-Gingy
20's-Puss in Boots
50's-Donkey
100's-Fiona
500's-Shrek

34883.name: The Color Train Game
34883.description:
In this memory game players start with their own train board with 8 empty train cars. Players alternate turning over boxcars (tiles) on the main board attempting to find colors to sequentially match the empty cars of their trains. The first player to fill all 8 train cars wins.
Each train board has cars in different color order.

34884.name: Planet der Sinne
boardgamefamily: HABA Planet der Sinne (Sensory Planet) series
34884.description:
Together with the Sensor, the little sensory explorer, the players set off on an exciting journey. Depending on the activity square where Sensor lands, the player has to find out of six filled tins which are the two with the same weight, or recognize which wooden piece has suddenly disappeared. Or he has to intelligently work out and guess which piece of the tactile chain is searched for. Whoever is successful in carrying out these activities collects many marbles on their little planet of senses.

Planet der Sinne (Planet of Senses) is a game collection with 12 different activities to stimulate the senses: seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, and moving. The activities have different degrees of difficulty and the number of activities can be freely determined. Triggering at the same time memory skills, language skills, and quick reactions.

34885.name: Ritter der Zahlenrunde
34885.description: Would you like to become a real Knight of the Round Numbers? A thrilling contest awaits you: go to Queen Kasimira's castle! On the way you have to compete with other knights and work out tricky sums. Wizard Mathicus checks all of your answers. If you can correctly answer a few sums and be first to the castle, with a little luck of the dice, you will be named a Knight of the Round Numbers!

34886.name: Pirates Versus Ninjas
34886.description:
This is a card game based on battles in an epic war between two factions, Ninjas and Pirates. Players choose a side at the beginning of the game, with at least 1 player representing each faction. Players have a hand of 5 cards featuring fighter cards (depicting famous Pirates or Ninjas), weapon cards, ability cards, and ambush cards.

After sides have been selected, players initiate a "draw" round where each player draws two cards and may then take two actions, including playing a fighter from their faction, a weapon on a fighter already in play on their side, an ability on a fighter, or they may discard up to two cards and draw replacements. Play passes to the left.

After all players have drawn and played cards, a "battle" round begins where all fighters enter into a battle for supremacy. The total number of fighters for each player is determined by the lowest number that player controls. After fighters have been selected the first player may choose to activate an ability or play an ambush card from his or her hand affecting the battle. This continues until all players have decided to pass. All players total their attack value for all fighters involved in battle the highest total earns that player a victory point (6 are needed to win). Then all players roll a die to determine casualties. If a die roll matches an opponent's fighter, that fighter is discarded from play and the die roller earns a victory point.

After battle, a draw phase starts again.

34887.description:
Blackmail the printer. Threaten the innkeeper. Bribe the priest. Welcome to Revolution!

Secretly bid against your opponents to gain victory points, control territories (worth victory points at the end of the game) and collect more Gold, Blackmail, and Force tokens for the next round of bidding! Will you try to control the tavern or the fortress? The harbor or the plantation? Knowing where to push for points – and where to back away and let your opponents fight – is the key to victory. Whoever has the most victory points at the end of the game wins. It's a game of bluff, counter-bluff, and surprise!

Bidding tokens have different shapes and colors for easy identification. Colorful cardstock shields keep your bids private, and also provide a handy rules reference during the auction. Brightly-colored wooden blocks allow players to see, at a glance, who controls which colonial-themed territories.

Revolution! is for three or four players. The rules can be taught in minutes, and a complete game takes less than an hour. Each new game lets players find new strategies and tactics.

Get ready for Revolution!
34887.name: Revolution!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 11: Roll for the Galaxy, Big Trouble in Little China, and Monument Valley
Episode 55- Viceroy and On-Line Gaming (CONTEST WINNER!)
Episode 79-- Interviews Galore, some MDM, and John Cusack Top 3 Bum 1
Exploring Games, Episode 2 - The Uncertainty of Philip duBarry
Spiele-Podcast Nr. 80: Revolution! (Pegasus)
The Spiel #89 - Threatening Pinocchio
Wooden Cubes & Iron Soldiers: “Just the Two of Us” Episode 8

34888.name: Prism
34888.description:
In Prism, the object of the game is to try to collect cards representing the six colors of the rainbow. The first player to collect all six wins the round, and is awarded bonus points.

In the deck, there are cards that represent red, orange, yellow, green, blue and violet. Players can only have one of each color in their collection. In addition, there are action cards that allow you to steal colors from other players. Some of these take cards allow you to continue your turn, taking as many color cards as you can, but with a downside- the more cards you play in a turn, the fewer cards you have left in your hand, limiting your options in future turns. Since bonus points are awarded to the winner for the number of cards in their hand, using play again cards also reduces your potential bonus score.

There are a limited number of blocking cards that you can use to prevent an opponent from stealing one of your colors.

There are a number of other cards, such as a the Prism Wild Card, zap cards to permanently destroy an opponent's color card, and cards that allow you to replenish your hand with additional draws from the deck on your turn.

Prism is ideal for Ages 8 and up. The game is normally played in multiple rounds until one player scores a certain number of points, but each round is enjoyable as a game by itself.

34889.name: Labyrintus
34889.description:
Labyrintus is a miniature game that combines the spectacle and craft of a miniature game with the fun and ease of play of a board game. A fast paced game for 2-4 players with a playing time of 30 to 60 minutes. Each player takes control of a team of 4 creatures and attempts to be the first to get through the Labyrinth. But beware, things may not always be what they seem, your progress can be thwarted by other creatures, the shifting Labyrinth and even your own tactical choices.
The game will include the complete 75 piece Labyrinth, 16 individual 28mm miniatures sculpted by Victoria Lamb, rules and special dice. The 16 miniatures make up the four factions that will inhabit the Labyrinth.

It is still in development and is currently being play tested and production options being explored.

34890.description:
Assault on Sevastopol is a two-player game recreating Erich von Manstein’s attempt to clear the Crimean peninsula and seize the key port city of Sevastopol as a prelude to Germany’s 1942 summer offensive in Ukraine – the roads to which would lead to the fateful battle of Stalingrad. The Germans are attempting to clear this enemy bastion on the Black Sea and free up their forces for the great offensive to the north. The Russians are desperately trying to hold out as long as possible, falling back on great defensive terrain and strong fortified positions, hoping to delay the German invaders and extract as high a price as possible from them for the capture of Sevastopol.

But the Germans have prepared for this campaign. With complete air superiority, the Luftwaffe (German Air Force) relentlessly attacks from the skies, while special super-heavy siege artillery is slowly and carefully brought in and assembled expressly for this operation. It’s a hard-fought matter of time, distance, and attrition as you recreate the Assault on Sevastopol.

Scale: Each unit is 1 regiment, brigade, division, or battle group, each hex is 3 kilometers, and each turn is 3 days.

Game Components:

One 4-page, color instructions booklet
40 color, die-cut, two-sided 5/8” mounted game pieces
One 11” x 17” color game map with charts & tables
One 2-page sheet of historical, designer, and developer notes
One 4-page, color BATTLESSON (TM) booklet
One bonus Optional Rule




Re-implements:

Assault on Sevastopol




Buy Microbadge
34890.name: Assault on Sevastopol

34896.name: Go Plates
34896.description: Colorful, excellent artwork. Gospel Cards for families. Plays like "Go Fish" or "Concentration". Simple enough for youngsters, lots of teaching opportunities.

34897.name: Hold to the Rod: Primary Edition
34897.description: Like "Hold to the Rod: Book of Mormon Edition", this game is a simplified version with easier trivia and tasks for a younger audience.

34900.name: Scripture Search & Spell Book of Mormon
34900.description: Everyone get your own set of scriptures and gather around a table with your family, class, or study group. Turn over a reference card, and the race is on! The first person to find the reference, figure out the key word, with the clue given, and spell it out with the letter tiles is the winner!

34901.description:
In 1936, as the Spanish Civil War heated up, representatives of Spanish Republicans began hiring American pilots to fight in the war. The Yankee Squadron, led by Bert Acosta, fought Franco’s White planes. Each pilot was paid $1,500 a month and a bonus of $1,000 for each enemy plane shot down.

In MAS-WWII:MTO, we take that idea and run with it. You can form a squadron at anytime from just before the start of World War II to the end of 1943 and see if you can prosper from the chaos.

We begin by focusing on the Mediterranean Theater of Operations. With access to Commonwealth, French, German, and Italian aircraft, players can get their MAS up and running by fighting in one of the most turbulent theaters of action.


MAS-WWII:MTO is the first product in a series that takes the fun and excitement of Mercenary Air Squadron and transplants into the era of World War II. Ownership of Mercenary Air Squadron is required to fully utilize MAS-WWII:MTO

Expands:

Mercenary Air Squadron
34901.name: Mercenary Air Squadron World War II: Mediterranean Theater of Operations

34902.name: Rock!
34902.description:
Out of the Box writes: "Sharpen your skills with Rock! A fast and furious version of an old favorite. Using the traditional rules of Rock, Paper, Scissors, players flip over cards and race to name the winning card. Each card is different so it takes a sharp eye and quick wit."

Part of their Fun to Go series packaged in small tins, Rock! consists of a deck of 60 cards - 20 each of rock, paper, and scissors. Each player quickly turns over one of their 30 cards, and the first to call out the winner of the two cards wins both of them. If you call out a losing card (or one that's not there) then your opponent wins the two cards. When the deck is gone you count your cards and whoever has the most is the winner.

34904.description:
When the locomotive card is received, it begins the game.

Player picks a locomotive card. It ties to either of player.
It ties to the same color train.

When the locomotive card is lost, the player that has longest train wins.

A lovely illustration is card game by which the feature can play easily.
34904.name: Logo Lok!

34905.description:
"Two teams race to identify drawings done by their own team members. But the artists don’t know what they are drawing—they can only follow the instructions given by another team member. Laughter erupts as players attempt to follow direction and to guess what is being drawn.

With Backseat Drawing, there’s no time to stop and ask directions— the fun never stops!"

Re-implemented by: Backseat Drawing Junior
34905.name: Backseat Drawing
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 33: Pimp Your Games
The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide
TPGC - Episode #42 - Squiggle Connect and Backseat Drawing

34906.name: Nutty Cups
34906.description:
Publishers Description:

"Stack the seven cups with Nutty Guys on the bottoms. Keep track of the nutty characters as the cups are stacked and re-stacked. But can you un-stack the cups to reveal a set with matching characteristics?

This lively game really stacks up! Take the Nutty Challenge!"

34907.name: Hexa-Zoki Puzzles
34907.description:
From the rules:

Choose one of the 14 puzzle layouts to solve. Shuffle the deck and deal to each player the number of cards indicated in the figure for layout you are playing. Set the rest of the deck aside and out of play. Then solve the puzzle by connecting all the cards so that all touching sides match and the final puzzle shape matches the puzzle layout you are playing. First player to solve puzzle wins!

Ages 4 and up

Home Page: http://www.eternitygames.com/index.php?ID=hexa

34908.name: Gospel Explosion: the Acts of the Apostles
34908.description:
From the text of the author's patent:

"The game is played on a game board of the Ancient Mediterranean World. Each player is given several playing pieces representing Apostles, early leaders in the Christian church. He moves these around the board winning converts and establishing churches as quickly as possible. Unlike most games, players do not compete against each other. They cooperate as the early Apostles did to spread Christianity throughout the world. Competition is provided by the game itself, through two sets of cards, many of which inflict persecution or misfortune upon the various churches and Apostles. An intelligent group of players, cooperating with each other, can overcome this opposition and successfully spread Christianity throughout the Roman Empire, thus winning the game."

Gospel Explosion: the Acts of the Apostles has been awarded U.S. Patent Number 4441718.

34909.name: Tetrano
34909.description:
This game is a 3D four in a row (Qubic), but represented on a simpler 4 X 4 board. The board is a 4x4 grid and each player has 4 different size rings of his color. The sizes are such that the rings will nest.

The object is to complete "a line of four" 4 rings of same color to win the game. Three kinds of alignments on a "line of four" are possible: same size of rings across 4 spaces, 4 different progressive sizes across 4 spaces, or 4 concentric rings on the same square.

Interestingly enough with this set you can also play Four Score. To play Four Score, you must play from smallest to largest ring in a particular playing space (or visa versa). The object again is to make a "line" of four.

34910.name: Hydropolis
34910.description:
Hydropolis is an abstract city-building game using the components of the game Waterworks. The "city" starts with one card in the center of the table. Each turn, you play a card from your hand, score points based on its location relative to other cards, add that play's score to your cumulative score, and then draw a card. One by one, the table is filled with a contorted maze of pipes. The game ends when all players pass or when somebody reaches a set amount of points. and the player with the highest running score wins. But if you earn three Golden Wrenches first, you win automatically!

Complete rules and revision history is available at:
http://ceruleansgames.tripod.com/hydropolis.htm

34911.description:
Pentamid is a two-player game played on a Volcano (5X5) board with one partial stash per player. The objective is for a player to be the first to get five of his pieces in a row, horizontally or vertically.

Each player starts with twelve pieces, four each of each of the three sizes. These pieces are arranged in nests off the board (the "reserve").

Rules Link

Game System

Icehouse Pieces
34911.name: Pentamid

34912.description:
Pach-Ice-i is a race-to-the-finish game for two players based mostly on pachisi. The objective is for a player to get all of his pieces to the opponent's starting pad before the opponent gets all of his pieces to the player's starting pad.

Rules Link

Game System

Icehouse Pieces
34912.name: Pach-Ice-i

34913.description:
Par-Trees-i is a game for two or four players using one Treehouse stash, a Volcano board and an ordinary six-sided die. The objective is to be the first player to get all three of his pieces to the center, in decreasing size order.

Rules Link

Game System

Icehouse Pieces
34913.name: Par-Trees-i

34914.description:
Another Uno variation. This features the theme of A Charlie Brown Valentine.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Secret Valentine" card, which lets you look into your opponent's heart (and hand) and gives you an advantage in planning your moves
34914.name: UNO: A Charlie Brown Valentine

34915.name: QUATRO: A Multiplication Game
34915.description:
"Quatro is an exciting new math game designed to develop the child's ability to recognize the products of two numbers. Quatro reinforces the multiplication operation of math."

Players win by correctly placing four chips in a row, or by covering all four corners of the board.

Includes colorful game board, 50 cards, and 26 plastic chips.

Ideal School Supply Company No. 7713

34916.name: Hexors of Might & Magic: A Strategic Hex
34916.description:
Hexors of Might & Magic: A Strategic Hex is a game of tactics, where armies wage continuous battles against each other. It is based on a Heroes of Might & Magic: A Strategic Quest, turn-based computer game, developed and published by New World Computing in 1995. While being familiar with the game is not necessary, the players will find it easier to identify with their armies if they have played the game.

Heroes of Might and Magic tells the story of Lord Morglin Ironfist, who is forced to flee his homeland through a magical portal, because his cousin, Ragnar, had usurped the throne after his uncle, Ragnar's father, killed Ironfist's father, the legitimate owner of the throne. He finds himself along with his few followers in a strange and uncharted land, called Enroth. The land is unruled and Ironfist must fight out his way to the throne of new kingdom.

34917.name: Sodbusters
34917.description:
The thematic setting of the game is the North American prairie as it was first being settled in the late 1800's and early 1900's.

The object of the game is to build the most profitable farming operation. Each player starts with a cash loan and one of 57 available sections of land, and may buy more land on any turn. On each section of land, players may plant one of four crops or raise one of four kinds of livestock.
Each turn represents one of the four seasons. The game consists of 20 turns (five "years" or full crop cycles). Each turn or season is divided into 3 phases which are played simultaneously by all players. In the "Purchase" phase players may buy land and animals and (if in season) plant crops. The "Event" phase consists of drawing cards which introduce events or conditions which may or may not affect players. For example, when a Tornado or Oil Strike event is drawn, a die roll mechanism is used to select specific land sections which are affected. In the "Harvest" phase, players sell any mature crops or livestock at the market price listed on a master Harvest card drawn for that turn.

Players may pay off their initial loan at any time. The amount due (representing combined principal and interest) grows substantially each "year". After the final turn, the player with the most cash left after paying off the loan is the winner. Land and other permanent farming assets may not be sold to raise cash. This simulates the practice of the first generation retiring and handing the farming operation intact to the next generation.

The game mechanism allows for solitaire play, in which the object would be to record a personal best amount of cash at the end. The primary effect of introducing more players is the competition for prime farmland. The length of play is not affected greatly since each phase is played simultaneously by all. Game testing showed a substantial increase in speed of play after players had played 2-3 times. For a game in which most or all players are novices, allow 4 hours.

Although the game includes a substantial amount of luck (farmers cannot control weather or market prices) it cannot be won by luck alone. Successful players will learn how to best farm different types of land (it is not all equal), manage risk, and select appropriate crop or livestock strategies (the various options include a wide range of risk/reward trade offs).

The game could be used in an educational setting either to illustrate the historical settling of the prairies or to demonstrate the basics of investing in any context (managing risk, balancing a portfolio, using leverage, etc.)

34918.name: Reise Durch das Bistum Osnabrück
34918.description:
From the box--

Kurzbeschreibung: Das Spiel zeigt das Bistum Osnabrück mit vielen wichtigen und interessanten Orten. Es will Eindrücke und Wissen vermittein. Gleichzeitig ist das Spiel ein schönes Gemeinschaftserlebnis für Kinder, Jugendgruppen und die gesamte Familie.

There are cards with this kind of phrase on them: Zähle Frauenorden auf, die in unserem Bistum tätig sind. Je 2 Punkte.

And larger cards with pictures and information about the pictures. Player pawns and one green die.

It seems to be a tour of memorable sites in Osnabrück, with a point system.

34919.name: Beyond Chess
34919.description:
Beyond Chess is a chess variant that uses a modular gameboard that actually shifts during play. Rather than playing on an 8×8 grid, the game is played on 64 movable squares.

Players can move pieces as well as game squares, causing an ever changing landscape of movement possibilities. Furthermore, it is possible to entirely isolate an opponent's playing piece, thus rendering it immobile.

34920.name: StarRunners
34920.description:
You control a small fleet of spaceships, as does your opponent. Your task is simple: you must maneuver your fleet across the galaxy to your opponent's star system. Along the way, all of your ships must stop at a difficult-to-reach system called Backwater. It's a friendly race, so you can't actually attack the other player, but there are ways you can try to slow them down. Who will get there first?

Game System

Icehouse Pieces




Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 3rd Competition

34921.description:
WreckTangle is a designed for Icehouse Pyramids. Players form a rectangle with their pyramids and capture pieces on the edge of the rectangle or the interior.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces




Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - 2nd place in 7th Competition
34921.name: WreckTangle

34922.name: Reach
34922.description: Reach is an LDS card game. The game features two identical decks of 80 cards, each featuring a scripture from The Bible, The Book of Mormon, The Doctrine and Covenants, or the Pearl of Great Price. One deck is spread on the table face up and the other is given to "a reader." This player reads the scripture on a card from his/her and then the other players race to find it on the table. After all 80 cards are read, the player who found the most face up cards is the winner.

34923.description: Each player moves 6 pawns on the board. No die is necessary because the pawns moves as far as the number of the field allows. The game is over when one player losses all of their pawns. The winner is the left neighbor of the player who has lost all pawns.
34923.name: Lieber Nachbar

34925.name: Riskant!
34925.description:
The game is similar to the game show "Wheel of Fortune" and contains a rather solid puzzle wall where the answer card is put down.
The winner is the player with the most money.

34926.name: New Faces Game
34926.description:
Based on the popular 1970's UK TV show, this game gave families the chance to audition and star in their own show in the comfort of their own home!
The aim of the game was to get your act through an audition for the "New Faces" TV show, and then move on to the Star Circuit. The winner is the first player to accumulate £20,000, after safely negotiating all three circuits of the board.

34927.name: Bible Trivia
34927.description:
Answer a question correctly on your turn, then roll the die and move along the path. When you land on a Judgment space, draw a card and follow its directions. First player to reach Finish wins.

There are separate question cards for Children and Adults. Each card's questions all relate to one theme rather than coming from different categories.

Not to be confused with the earlier game Bible Trivia also published by Cadaco.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Game Rules Supplement Winner
34928.description:
The first army supplement for the Field of Glory miniatures wargame. This supplement covers the armies of Republican Rome as well as their allies and enemies. There are eighteen separate lists, each with a sample starter army and point cost chart for making your own force.

The book itself is 72 pages printed in full color with photos of miniatures and paintings from various other Osprey books used throughout.

Armies included:
- Mid-Republican Roman
- Late Republican Roman
- Gallic
- Pyrrhic
- Later Carthaginian
- Illyrian
- Ancient Spanish
- Later Macedonian
- Attalid Pergamene
- Numidian or Early Moorish
- Later Seleucid
- Later Ptolemaic
- Pontic
- Spartacus Slave Revolt
- Early Armenian
- Parthian
- Later Jewish
- Bosporan
34928.name: Field of Glory Companion 1: Rise of Rome

34929.name: Van Dale Familiespel
34929.description:
Every player chooses a hidden word, they try to collect the letters which make up this word. In the mean time the other players try to guess the word of the other players. If they guess it correctly they have to think of a new word and start again.
The player who is the first to collect his letters is the winner.

34930.name: Moon Shot
34930.description:
A game about racing to the Moon and back, while avoiding pitfalls that open up in the board during play.

Components:
- 8 wooden pawns in 4 colours (red, green, yellow, blue)
- A 14" square board with a spinner, showing concentric zones players travel through (Launch Pad - Entry - Orbit - Moon Landing - Orbit - Re-entry - Safe Landing on Earth). The board has 40 holes in it, with a separate cardboard disc underneath. The bottom disc has 21 holes and can be rotated incrementally so through-and-through holes open and close in the board as they match up.

Players have two pawns each, spin to see who starts (this is the only function of the spinner in the game), then move one space at a time from Launch Pad through the different zones, then back to Earth. If he lands on a hole in the "Orbit" zone that shows a dot in his colour, he can "shoot the Space Gun" (rotate the bottom disc one space left or right using a finger hole). This will make some new holes open and others close in the board, and any pawns falling through new holes must begin again. The winner is the first player to have both his pawns complete the journey to the Moon and back again.

Box says this game was based on "Outer Space Station #1" by Abel-Klinger, a game publisher in West Germany.

34931.description: Players compete to help Fancy Nancy transform her bedroom from plain to posh! Players bring in her boas, ribbons, tiaras and other fancy accessories....the first player to complete the posh bedroom makeover,wins! Based on the best selling children's picture books by Jane O'Connor. 2 to 4 players. Game Contents: 1 Color Die, 4 Bedroom Game Boards,40 Posh Cards, including: 14 Purple "Let's Get Fancy!" Cards,18 Pink "Accessories!" Cards,8 Blue "Oops!" Cards
34931.name: Fancy Nancy Posh Bedroom Game

34932.description: A children's set collecting game based on the best selling children's picture books by Jane O'Connor. Players pass cards looking to collect the 8 "posh" accessories for Nancy needed to win. 48 cards. 3 to 6 players
34932.name: Fancy Nancy Card Game

34933.description:
This is a preschool level version of Monopoly with some effort at providing educational value. Push Mr Monopoly's head and then move forward as many spaces as he tells you. Involves the usual Monopoly gameplay of building and collecting rent.

Publisher's description: " Join Mr. Monopoly as he makes his way around town! Mr. Monopoly does all the talking to guide you through town-if he tells you to move forward 2 spaces, you know what to do! If you make a mistake, he'll let you know! Play money and building blocks help make counting fun. And building is easy-just add a block when you land on a colored space. No reading required. Game board comes with Mr. Monopoly in a car, track (in 4 pieces), play money, green building blocks, 28 roofs and instructions. Adult assembly required."
34933.name: Monopoly Town

34935.name: Passing the Buck
34935.description:
Four forty piece jigsaw puzzles are muddled together and the pieces shared amongst the players.
Each player has a screen (like a DM screen in RPG's), with a colour picture of the Western themed jigsaw that they must race the other players to complete. Each person's puzzle is different, and so the players must swap pieces by bribery or auction style to win the pieces they need.
Because no-one can see the other players jigsaws, it becomes tense as the race to complete becomes frantic!

34937.name: Monopoly: Michael Graves Wooden Keepsake
34937.description: This is a redesign of the classic game Monopoly by design artist Michael Graves, and distributed exclusively in Target stores. The game is smaller than a typical Monopoly board, and as such, so are the title deeds, chance and community chest cards, and bank notes, The houses and hotels are also redesigned in the Michael Graves style, and come in velvet pouches for storage when not in use. The tokens are based on the designs that Mr. Graves has submitted to Target for different household items (Cup & Saucer, Telephone, Wall Clock, Blender, Tea Kettle, and Toaster). And this all is enclosed in a very attractive wood box. The board folds open on the top like the top of a cigar or jewelery box, with side supports that swing out from the back, and there is a drawer on the side to store the tokens, buildings, cards, deeds, and money. This drawer functions as Money rack when playing the game.

34938.name: Beware of the Dog
34938.description:
From the University Games catalog:

His bark is worse than his bite! Shhhhhh... Beware of the dog, the dog's asleep, don't wake the dog! Players use a cat's paw to try and steal the most bones without waking the angry pooch. A suspenseful skill and action game that will keep the children giggling and the parents shrieking.

34939.name: Vertigo: The Balancing Puzzle
34939.description:
A game whereby the players attempt to balance components to make a mobile structure which is rather Alexander Calder in feel.

Components include:
1. Tube which both holds the game pieces when not in use and which also provides the base and initial pivot point,
2.central support pieces which balance on top of each other
3. stiff wires that are projected from the central support pieces.
4."c" shaped weights to hang off of the wires or each other.
The central supports will only balance if the wires and weights are properly balanced.

The goal is to get all the pieces on to the structure without it collapsing.

On the tube it says, "A dizzying experience awaits he who challenges Vertigo . . . but the reward is a gently floating mobile sculpture.

Steady hands and a keen sense of balance help you to hit upon the right combination of weights and counterweights which complete all levels of the puzzle. Vertigo - the puzzle that thinks it's art."

34940.name: Thomas Count Your Cars Game
34940.description:
From the manufacturer's catalog:

A preschool counting and color matching game! Match the number of boxcars shown on the spinner to the colored cards in hand... then head for the roundhouse and pick up the matching color engine to haul those boxcars into your scoring pile. The player with the most boxcars wins!

For Ages 3 and up.

Includes 36 boxcar cards, game board, spinner, and 4 engine tokens.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
34941.name: Fundomino
34941.description:
Wild Action Dominoes!

Fundomino combines the best of fun and the best of domino. Are you ready for the action?
Place an action tile at the end of the chain and it immediately comes into effect. Who will get to
have another turn, draw extra tiles, reverse the order or gain extra points?
Arrow Symbol = Play Again!
Plus Symbol = Draw!
Star Symbol = Wild!
Be the first to play all your Fundominoes to win. Fundomino is the best domino party game to gather family and friends together for hours of fun!

The game comes with 32 fundominoes, 4 pawns, and a scoring track.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Children's Game Nominee
34942.name: Double Shutter Junior
34942.description:
From the manufacturer:

Double Shutter Junior doubles the family fun.
Roll the dice and add up the dots to shut the tiles of your choice. The tile total must match the dot total in any combination you want. This fun family game helps develop math skills while being fast to learn and easy to play.

Double Shutter Junior comes with a double shutter box that has two rows of 6 tiles each, rather than the 9 that the original version comes with. Includes two dice.

Ages 6 and up

34943.description:
From the manufacturer:

Get ready to shut the Super Box!
Double Shutter is an enticing and irresistible game that combines tactical choices, luck and fun for the whole family.
Roll two dice, add the dots and find the best combination of numbers to shut two rows of nine tiles.
This game is very addictive, always remember to play in moderation!

Comes with one double shutter box with two rows of 9 tiles, and two dice.
Three versions are available: Vintage (Wood), Jr (Wood) and Classic (tin)

Ages 8 and up
34943.name: Double Shutter

34944.name: Ripleys Believe It or Not! Library of Cards
34944.description:
This is a compact library of the strange and fascinating oddities of the world, all authenticated by Ripley. These cards are enjoyable to adults as to children of all ages.

The exciting feature of these cards is the game of Ripley Rummy that can be enjoyed by the whole family. Follows the traditional rules of the popular Rummy card game. Be the first to get rid of all your cards by collecting and playing sets of cards.

34945.name: Goofball Rally
34945.description:
Publishers Description:

"It’s time for Goofball Rally, the fast-paced, color-matching marble race! Place your goofballs on the starting line and get ready to go. On your mark, get set…roll! Launch your goofballs one by one down the winding race tracks. When all of your goofballs have crossed the finish line, hit the red button. The first player to score 20 points is the Goofball Rally Champ! Includes goofball stadium game board, 10 race cards, and 20 goofball racers (in 10 bright colors). For 2 players."

34946.name: C.O.W. (Cybernetic Omni-tasking Workcow)
34946.description:
C.O.W. or Cybernetic Omni-tasking Workcow is a board game that is similar to a 1980's computer game called M.U.L.E.

Players start by purchasing a land of out of a pool. They can also buy workcows to farm the land to produce the resources. During the market phase, players buy or sell the resources to other players or the store to make profit or simply to keep their farm running.

Players must also deal with random events that may effect their production and at the same time, they must be cunning enough to survive the brutal market manipulation by other players.

Ultimately, the first player who reaches a specific wealth wins the game.

34947.name: Dice: The Evolution
34947.description:
From the game's rules:

This is a game designed to be fun. You have dice, you’re going to play with them anyway.
Now you have a goal.

Make dice towers, roll high numbers, spin dice, and evolve.

Players start out with the d4, and fight their way up through the evolutionary chain of dice; d4 -> d6 -> d8 -> d10 -> d12 -> d20

The game is made up of two different sections in each evolution; the quests, and the challenge.

Quests are undertaken in order to obtain bonuses to rolls which can be used in any of the upcoming challenges.
Challenges are undertaken when the player feels they have enough bonuses to defeat the next die in the evolutionary chain of dice.

34948.description:
From the manufacturer's catalog:

A Quacky Strategy Game for Younger Players.

This competitive board game is like a wacky version of checkers. Kids will giggle at the colorful beach board and plucky duck characters. After deciding whether they want to be the duck that surfs or the one that water skis, the two opponents face off, and try to be the first to line up four ducks in a row. Players can move up and down, side to side, and diagonally, but they can't jump themselves or their opponent. A fun strategy game, players have to pay attention to their opponent's moves, as well as their own.

For 2 players, Ages 5 - 7.

Includes 12 plastic duck tokens, and 1 5 x 5 game board.
34948.name: Ducks in a Row

34949.name: Ripley's Believe It or Not!
34949.description:
The Story Card is read aloud. Players choose to Believe It or Not! Those who choose correctly move the number of spaces shown on the card.
The Ripley's Believe It or Not Game takes you through the mysterious halls of Ripley's Museum where you will encounter unique treasures from around the world.
Land on an Exhibit Space and hear a wild tale about the exhibit you are shown. Do you Believe it or Not? Answer correctly and keep the card.

Win!
Collect an Exhibit Card from each room, be the first to exit the museum, and Win!

34950.name: Ripley's Believe It or Not! Game
34950.description: Players travel the world collecting visas from 7 continents by guessing if bizarre, fun "facts" are really from Robert Ripley's incredible Believe It or Not! archives. Once they collect all 7 visas, players try to obtain an exhibit card by answering a photo card correctly, so they can be the first player to open a Ripley's Believe It or Not! Museum and win the game.

34951.description:
Martian Coaster Chaturanga is a game for two or four players using a Treehouse set and a set of Martian Coasters. Players move and capture pieces on the board, with the objective of having the greatest number of points at the end of the game.

Rules Link

Game System

Icehouse Pieces




Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 6th Competition
34951.name: Martian Coaster Chaturanga

34952.name: UNO: Brian Urlacher Special Edition
34952.description:
An Uno variation themed on Brian Urlacher, star football player for the NFL Chicago Bears Football team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "MLB" (i.e. Middle LineBacker) card and rule.

34953.description:
Oktawars is the official prequel of Oktagrid.
In the box you'll find over 60 pawns, towers, sheets, dices, special tokens and a wooden modular board, a quick reference sheet and, obviously, the game rules.

Let's see the story of the game...

Once upon a time, there were eight Mages.
They lived on the Island of An, ruling eight realms, and battling each other in small skirmishes...
A great war seemed unavoidable...

And the game begins.

To avoid the great, final battle, Pedramor the White, Keeper of Peace and Master of Light, begins to create a powerful artifact, a boardgame named Oktagrid: if activated, every attack spell will be immediately countered, depriving all the Mages of their primary offensive weapon.

But, before the activation of the Oktagrid, two Mages are suddenly killed.
Raksha the Red spreads war all over the land, trying to dominate the entire island, and someone steal the artifact from Pedramor's tower.

The Mages begins a desperate fight one against each other, trying to find and activate or destroy the Oktagrid.

Players take place of the six remaining Mages, to try to save - or conquer - the Island of An.
The game has a multiple-level strategy: winning battles is important as taking the control of strategic areas, and even the search for the Oktagrid takes a heavy role, since the activation or the destruction of the artifact is the only way to end the match.

Every Mage has his special abilities and spells: each wizard fights in a personal way, being selfish and destructive, or protecting and aiding his troops, or even focusing in teleporting soldiers or making them walk underwater.

The game has very original mechanics and a unique setting; game rules are easy to learn but challenging to master in the most effective way.
34953.name: Oktawars

34954.name: Kontact
34954.description:
Using their wooden playing pieces (40 each), players race to complete 10 buildings before their opponent. Pieces are placed on the board in contact with a piece of the opposing colour. When enough pieces are in play, those on the board can be stacked atop opposing pieces, or other pieces may be brought into play. A player may complete a building building if the topmost piece is his.

Can be played in teams of 2 or 3 each with an additional set.

34955.name: Start de Persen!
34955.description:
Start the Printers:

You are a chief-editor of a major national newspaper and have to fill all 5 sections of your paper with news. You collect the news by moving over the gameboard and answering trivia. You can also steal news from another newspaper. When you have filled all the sections you have to deliver your paper to the printing-plant.
The game is like Trivial Pursuit with a newspaper theme.
Nice touch is that the dice is 2 times 5, the gameboard is a pentagon and the player pawn is a chair.

Subtitle of the game: Het verrrassende 5 krantenspel.

This game was produced as part of the celebration of 400 years of newspapers. The papers featured in this game are 5 major national newspapers of the netherlands: Volkskrant, NRC Handelsblad, Parool, trouw and Algemeen Dagblad.

34956.name: Top Of The Pops Game
34956.description:
The object of Top of The Pops is to be the most successful manager by achieving 1 million record sales from your pop acts, and thereby winning the gold disc. The number of acts you get onto the charts and how high they reach establishes your sales levels.

Contents:
Playing board spinner
Top Ten chart
Record contract cards
Record release cards
Chart News cards
Sales cards
Pop Act tabs (plus blanks)
Silver discs
Gold disc
Radio Plug cards

34957.name: Gary Lineker's Footballer of the Year
34957.description:
A game based around Gary Lineker, a celebrated footballer from Leicester, England, and his rise through the footballing ranks to become the superstar of football that he did. (Note; he is still famous as a presenter of football on TV)
The object of the game is to play the football matches to the best of your ability and try to attain as much money and as many football awards as possible. The game starts with each player being a fourth division footballer with just £500 in savings and no status.

Game Contents:
1 Playing board
1 Footballer marker
40 playing tokens
4 match score dice (red, yellow, 2 x green)
1 skill dice (white)
1 win or lose dice (black)
5 cup dice
1 pack incident cards
1 points score pad
cheques
1 set rules

34958.name: Six
34958.description: Six is played in only six minutes. 2 to 5 players try to save their cards and collect points. Over three rounds a sand timer will be started and covered. Players roll their dice to save their cards. A player may reveal the sand timer. If there is still time left he loses points, if he was right his neighbour loses points.

34959.name: The United States Air Mail Game
34959.description:
Not to be confused with the card game Wings: The Air Mail Game (also known as Aviation: The Air Mail Game).

The United States Air Mail Game is a board game that features a picture of a blue airplane on the front and a map of the USA on the board with metal airplane for playing pieces.

34960.name: The Garrison Game
34960.description: In this early abstract wargame, 50 soldiers need to move across the board and capture a fortress held down by 3 officers. The board consists of colored diamonds connected by lines, presumably for point-to-point movement. The box front displays the title prominently with several flags and a couple of cannons.

34961.name: Skyscraper
34961.description:
This early Parker Brothers Game might be one of the earliest games (outside of Bingo) to give each player their own board. Everyone is trying to develop their own district with residences, churches, public buildings, and a 5-story skyscraper. The components include painted/colored wood blocks for the buildings!

The designer published the game himself, and then Parker Brothers bought it and reprinted it. It is not known if the two versions differ.

34962.name: Jeu de l'histoire sainte depuis la naissance de Moïse jusqu'à sa mort
34962.description:
This game is literally a work of art.

It's a French game about the life of Moses from circa 1800 where the gameboard is engraved on a copper plate. There are 62 small engraved images, one in each of the spaces of the movement track. The gameboard has a movement track that spirals in toward the center of the board in an oval. The game instructions are in French in the center of the oval.

The board sold for $535 in Feb 2008.

34963.description:
