Someone's gone and broken the TimeLine again.

An agent of the Time Repair Agency, you must create a Timelock to stop the TimeLine from arbitrarily changing. When everything went haywire, an alternate version of yourself was created. If your alter-ego sets their Timelock first, they will take your place in the TimeLine and vice-versa. Once it's done, who is the real you?

Timelock is a 2-player semi-abstract strategy game where players race to match Stacks of pyramids to their Goal... before their Goal changes, that is. Players will need two Treehouse sets (ideally one Rainbow set and one Xeno set), two 6-sided dice, one Treehouse die, and a Volcano board or other 5x5 square board.

Rules Link

Game System

Icehouse Pieces




Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - 3rd place in 7th Competition
34963.name: Timelock

34964.name: Pari
34964.description: Players add cards to mathematical equations in the middle of the table. A player who can complete a correct equation scores points. A player who cannot achieve this will add cards to existing equations to make them more complex and harder to complete for other players. Cards are either number cards (one digit, can be combined to form higher numbers) or operator cards (=, +, -, x, /).

34965.name: UNO: LaDainian Tomlinson Special Edition
34965.description:
An Uno variation themed on LaDainian Tomlinson , star running back for the National Football League San Diego Chargers Team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "MVP" card and rule commemorating Tomlinson's selection as the NFL's Most Valuable Player

34966.name: UNO: Los Angeles Lakers Legends Edition
34966.description:
An Uno variation based on great players from the National Basketball Association (NBA) team, the Los Angeles Lakers. Cards feature Hall of Famers and championship winners including Shaquille O'Neal, Magic Johnson, Jerry West, James Worthy, Kareem Abdul-Jabaar & more.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Has an exclusive "SHOWTIME!" card & rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno.

34967.name: UNO: New York Knicks
34967.description:
An Uno variation themed on the National Basketball Association (NBA) team, the New York Knicks

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Dunk" card and rule commemorating John Starks' 1993 driving, left-handed tomahawk slam.

34968.description:
Timberland is a Treehouse-meets-Volcano game for 2-4 players. Players perform Treehouse actions on shared pieces scattered about a Volcano board until they collect enough points to win. Themewise, think of this as cultivating hardwood trees, and then sending out logging crews to harvest the fully grown trees, thinning out the forest over time.

The rules are available on the IcehouseGames Wiki.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces




Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 7th Competition
34968.name: Timberland

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2009 JoTa Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
34969.description:
Now, Ubongo goes two-player! Each player tries to solve the same puzzle with the same tiles faster than his opponent. The scoring mechanism from the original has also been revised, as there is no time limit to solving the puzzles (which are harder than in the original)

Gameplay: Each player receives 21 puzzle tiles and a stack of puzzle sheets. Both players lay the puzzle tiles down in front of them. Rolling the 20 sided die determines which of the tiles are used in the specific rounds. The players then try to solve every puzzle sheet as quickly as possible by laying the appropriate tiles on it. The faster player to do this yells 'Ubongo!'. He/she moves his pawn one step forward on the scoring track. The first player to win five Ubongo duels wins the game.
34969.name: Ubongo: Duel
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide

34970.name: Le Jeu Joli
34970.description:
La Jeu Joli uses a board with four main areas (starting spots, outer ring, middle ring and center/finish), with other paths which connect the these areas. The game uses the blockade and capturing concepts of Pachisi.

Players may move in either direction on their turn and may move the number indicated by one die or both dice. A player may move from one path to the next and into the finish circle only over his colored path. The first player to get all his markers to the finish circle wins.

34971.name: Kolardo: A Space Age Classic
34971.description:
From the rules: Kolardo will fascinate and entertain all who play, and at the same time will unfold the beautiful and subtle, yet simple language of COLOUR. Produced for ASCIA by Neil John Productions Ltd., New Zealand.

Basic Information: The Kolardo Pack comes with 54 cards representing 9 colours (3 primary, 1 secondary, and 5 tertiary colours), a rule book, and a rule card for advanced play. The basic concept of the game is capturing melds of secondary and tertiary colours by playing and discarding cards to the piles next to the draw stack.

34972.name: Auktion
34972.description:
In this game of auctions and dice the players try to amass the greatest fortune by buying cars in auctions, and then earning money on these by being lucky in their dice rolls.

The game consists of:
- Twenty cars: Eight blue, ten red, and two gold.
- Money: In denominations from 100 to 5000.
- A Gavel: For the auction master.
- Bonds: Six for each player.

The players are given 23.500 in cash and six bonds ranging from 1000 to 6000.

The game consists of 20 rounds where the cars are sold to the players and money are earned or lost.

First the eight blue cars and then the two gold cars are sold:


Auction the cars. The highest bidder takes the car and pays the bank.



Roll dice. Every player roll their two dice.


The players then either pay or get money from bank according to the roll:

Series (N, N+1): The player adds the dice and times this with the added up value of the cars (100 and 200). The sum is paid from the bank to the player.

Even (N, N): The player can sell the N bond to the bank. It is possible to trade with other players for this.

Tax (Anything else): The player pays tax to the bank: Number of cars times times the value of the cars (100 and 200).

Then the ten red cars are given away.


Each player rolls the dice, and the player with the highest roll is given a red car. Players also pay or recieve money as above.


When the last car has been given away, the players add up their cash, subtract their remaining bonds, and add up the value of their cars: 5.000 for blue and red, and 10.000 for gold.

The winner is the player with the largest fortune.

34973.name: Seikkailu Merellä
34973.description:
"Adventure at Sea - The great submarine hunt"

An abstract naval strategy game for 2 players. One player is the submarine commander and controls a mothership-submarine and nine mini-subs; the other is the surface commander and controls a fleet of sixteen destroyers. The board has an asymmetric (roughly 10 by 16) grid on which the vessels move; initial setup is printed on the board and is always the same.

There are several exit points at the edges of the grid. The goal of the submarine commander is to take the mothership off the board through an exit point; the surface commander tries to prevent this and capture the mothership. (For the purpose of the victory condition, the mini-subs and destroyers are expendable.) Both sides can capture the other's vessels by sandwiching an enemy vessel between two of their own. Captured vessels are removed from the game.

The board also has several "military secrets"; by placing any of his vessels on such a space the sub commander forces the surface commander to remove one destroyer (her choice).

The game includes one rules variant.

Similar to:

Hnefatafl

34974.name: Pasapalabra
34974.description:
Based on a TV game show shown on Spanish television, based on the original British format "The Alphabet Game".

Each team has to guess secrets words. The game objective is to obtain the major number of seconds in the different tests and use them in the last test PASPALABRA. This last test is a countdown where each team has to guess a word beginning with every letter of the alphabet and the team wins if they successfully complete the alphabetical track before their accumulated time runs out.

The 5 tests:

1 - From "A" to "Z"
2 - "A cada cual lo suyo"
3 - Caged word
4 - Impossible word"
5 - Pasapalabra

Content:
- 7500 Questions
- 2 Roulettes-time scoreboards, 1 red and 1 blue
- 2 Roulettes-alphabet scoreboards, 1 red and 1 blue
- 550 Cards
- Chronometer
- Rules

34975.name: Zakochany w Warszawie
34975.description: Historical game about Warsaw published by Warsaw City Hall. Game is about tourists sightseeing in the city. One of them gets lost and others are looking for him.

34976.name: The Nanchang Rebellion
boardgamepublisher: Oriental Flagship (BEIJING) International Technology CO., LTD
34976.description:
This game is the first in the Oriental Flagship Company's "Red Remembrances" series. This simple game simulates the August 1, 1927 Nanchang Rebellion, when Communist forces first rebelled against the Kuomintang.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanchang_Uprising
The game uses roughly 40 magnetic counters on a board with a hexagonal grid, a die, and a set of event cards. According to the semi-hidden movement rules, counters only reveal their equipment and capabilities when discovered according to the rules.

34977.description:
A free game by Kevin Zucker and Enrico Acerbi, and a Napoleon’s Last Battles System variant published by Italian wargame magazine "No Turkeys" (and available in PDF at their website).

The game simulates Bonaparte's attack on the numerically superior Coalition forces under Austrian General Josef Alvintzy. Alvintzy defeated the Little Corporal in this prelude to Bonaparte's victory at Arcola in the following days.

The map scale is about 1:30,000 with each hex being 480 meters (or 525 yards) across. Unit sizes are mostly regiments for infantry and cavalry with several artillery batteries combined to form each "demi-brigade" of cannon. Special rules to depict leadership capabilities of individual generals.

Available online (see weblinks below).

GAME SYSTEM: Napoleon's Last Battles (NLB-Series)
- scale = 480m/hex,
- time = 1hour/GT,
- strength = 150-500 men/SP.
34977.name: Caldiero 1796

34979.name: Davy Crockett
34979.description:
Object of this card game is to take trick containing the main character cards depicting RED STICK, GENERAL JACKSON, GEORGE RUSSEL and last but not least DAVY CROCKETT.

Trick taking follows special rules, a complete game ends after 6 rounds, scoring only the cards in the tricks containing the above mentioned characters.

Game hails from the heydays of the company regarding card artwork: 44 cards with brightly coloured pictures are a joy to play...

34980.description:
This is a Rummy Game variant with 34 cards in the pack.

Object of the game is to be the first to dispose of all the cards in hand by laying down a set or sets of 3 or 4 of the same character.
Name giving characters of Punch and Judy can be used as Jokers.

Cards are significantly smaller than usual card games and of a lesser component quality than most of the Pepys card games, albeit the print quality is stunning !
34980.name: Punch and Judy

34981.name: Victory
34981.description:
This is a clever game of setting up collections.

Regarding the time it was published, the theme of the game and last but not least the comic strip caricatures of Churchill, Hitler and some other populars of the time this is one of the rarest and for the collector most expensive game from the Pepys company.

Object of the game is to secure points for merit. This is done by rising in the services (Army, Navy, Air Force and Home Services) in proper sequences, avoiding to include one of the penalty villains of Hitler-ruled Germany.

Clever card drafting and discarding rules coupled with nail-biting decision when to end a round (enhance your set or take the risk to draw a penalty) is even by modern standards a good game.

By the time this game was published the card quality was very high: thick cardboard with linen finish and brightly coloured printing add to the flair of the game.

34982.name: Scouting
34982.description:
11 sets of 4 cards each have to be played to gain as many points as possible by making up various scoring combinations.
This can be done by:
- making up the total of "12"
- playing cards of the same number
- playing runs and/or sequences
- playing the Baden Powell card
- being the last player in the round

Game ends after several rounds until a player has a total score of 30 points.
One of the most demanding games of the Pepys series regarding the rules, and very special because 11 can play without using a second deck of cards !

The educational aspect of the Scouting theme is accompanied by extensive description of the subjects of the cards on the last pages of the rules booklet.

As usual with this publisher printing quality and graphic artwork is outstanding.

34983.name: Girl
34983.description:
A trick-taking card game with cards depicting the original comic strip characters from the "Girl"-comic magazine from the 1950ies.

It consists of 12 heroine cards, 30 trio cards and two girl cards.

Object of the game is to win cards as much as possible, using the girl-cards as jokers.

Gameplay is the same as in the PLANES GAME and the CARS GAME from the same publisher and somewhat special, using the trio-cards in prominent role.

Short-time fun for the whole family with the exceptionally well printed cards in top quality.

34984.name: I Commit
34984.description:
Card game where players score points for assembling three-card "crimes", or playing three-card "arrests" to foil crimes already on the table.

Game consists of 53 cards, and players win by disposing of the cards in their hand, collecting as many counters as possible while doing so. Players can play the following melds of cards:

- commit a crime (criminal + motive + opportunity)
- arrest a criminal (constable + inspector + clue)
- declaring a posse of inspectors (any 3 inspector cards)
- founding a police college (any 6 constable cards)
- exposing a nest of criminals (any 6 criminal cards)

When a player empties their hand, they score points according to the cards remaining in their opponent's hand.

Card graphics must rank in the top 5 of all the games published by Pepys. There were two editions of this game, the latter including redesigned Police Constable cards. The first saw a realistic policeman, in the second, he was replaced by a cartoon policeman, with the number 49 on his collar, possibly in reference to the contemporary radio series "PC 49".

34985.name: Quien Sabé
34985.description:
A lesser known card game from the famous company although the rules state: "Quien Sabé has created the greatest sensation in games since our celebrated game of PIT".

A fast-paced game where every player gets an identical set of cards.

The leading player calls "down", and every participant chooses a card from his set and hides it from the others.
When the leading player calls "up" all cards are revealed simultaneously.
The object for each player now is to capture tricks in hopes that he may secure thereby a number of "count cards": Cards numbered 5, 10, 15 from the cowboy cards and Quien Sabé, the last mentioned being a special card.

Game is won after several rounds when a player has amassed at least 500 points.

34986.name: Speedihound
34986.description:
Game is presumably from the 1950ies and a greyhound racing betting game.

It consists of 6 x 8 suits of greyhound cards and one hare card.
Added is a rubber gameboard, enforced with raw canvas which also depicts the rules of the game.

Place your bets - and then one card after the other is turned up from the shuffled deck until one dog has laid out all his cards. Should the last card be the "disqualified" the dog is exactly that !

Can be played by any number of players as long everyone has counters (or money?) to bet...

34987.name: Transcott
34987.description:
Sub-Title of the game is:" Jeu des Routes du Ciel" which means in English: "Game of the Routes of the Sky".

It depicts the Lockheed "Super Constellation" on the box lid and is a trick taking game with special designed cards, depicting several service personnel from airlines on the time (1950ies).

Object of the game is to collect the cards to travel several air routes around the world.
To achieve this the cards not only depict suit and rank but also stops along the travel line.
The routes are shown on a separate gameboard.

Cards and box have luxury outfit: Thick cardboard cards with top and colourful printing quality, the box with lizzard skin finish and golden borders - nice !

34988.name: Pinocchio
34988.description:
Game consists of 45 cards, divided into 5 sets of 9, each set depicting various scenes from the movie film of the time and additional one of the letters of the characters name (Pinocchio).

Object of the game is to get rid of the cards in hand as fast as possible.
To reach this goal cards have to be laid out in a certain pattern, letter cards "N" acting as special jokers.

First player to get rid of his cards scores according to the cards left in the other players hands.

Game ends after several rounds when a player has scored 250 or more points.

Thick cardboard cards with linen finish and top printing quality add to the fun to play this fast paced, light card game.

34989.name: Captain Cook: Voyage of Discovery
34989.description:
Captain Cook : Voyage of Discovery is a simple roll & move educational game produced by Studio Press and the NSW Parks & Wildlife Service in 1969. The box proclaims:

'Relive the perils of Cook's historic first voyage...watch out for unfriendly natives...unfavourable winds...dangerous reefs and look forwards to exciting discovery unlimited..'

Players win the game by being the first to get their 'Endeavour' from the Portsmouth, England, to Botany Bay in Australia. The players move forward or backwards around the board track according to the cards that are drawn in sequence. No dice are used.

Players in the game are drafted randomly into several different roles of the Endeavour: Bosun, 1st Mate, Joseph Banks, and of course Captain Cook. Cook has a few privileges and winners of the race get to play him in other rounds of the game. Cook moves first and is essentially the dealer.

The game comes with an educational supplement published by the NSW Parks & Wildlife Service. The playing cards also contain illustrations and facts about some of the Flora & Fauna of New South Wales, Australia.

The game also came with 'historic cut out medals' that players were encouraged to pin on themselves in order to add the element of role-play.

34990.name: UNO: Tom Brady NFL Greatest Players
34990.description:
An Uno variation themed on Tom Brady, star quarterback for the National Football League New England Patriots Team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Passer" card and rule which does not correlate to any card/rule in regular Uno.

34991.name: UNO: Hairspray
34991.description:
Themed Uno game based on the the movie musical, "Hairspray"

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Swap Partners" card and rule, which does not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.

34992.name: UNO: Fat Albert
34992.description:
Themed Uno game based on the the classic animated TV Show, "Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids"

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Brown Hornet Superhero" card and rule, which does not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.

34993.name: UNO: Texas
34993.description:
Themed Uno game based on the the state of Texas.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Last Stand" cards and rules (referring to last stand at the Alamo), which allows players to switch hands and does not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.

34994.name: UNO: Arsenal Highbury Legends
34994.description:
Themed Uno game based on the football (soccer) club, Arsenal Highbury.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Red Card" and "Yellow Card" cards and rules (referring to the card penalties given by players for infractions), which do not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.

34995.name: UNO: Derek Jeter Limited
34995.description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of Derek Jeter, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the New York Yankees.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Captain" card and rule (referring to Jeter's position as team captain), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

34996.name: UNO: David Ortiz Limited
34996.description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of David Ortiz, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the Boston Red Sox.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Big Papi" card and rule (referring to Ortiz's famous nickname), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

34997.name: UNO: Chicago White Sox
34997.description:
Another Uno variation. This features the theme of the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the Chicago White Sox

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Manager" card and rule, which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

34998.name: UNO: David Wright Special
34998.description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of David Wright, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the New York Mets.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Hot Corner" card and rule (referring to Wright's position at third base), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

34999.name: Pirate Ship
34999.description: Pirate Ship is a game that tests players balancing and identifying skills. Players have to fit the components without making the ship topple, or do their best to make the opponents topple it!

35000.name: Double Talk
35000.description:
Contents:

Deck of 65 letter cards
4 player boards
2 dice
Instruction booklet




Deal the cards onto the spaces provided on each player's board. On your turn, a dice roll determines in which spaces you may switch cards or draw for a replacement. The first player to form two four-letter words on his board wins the round and scores the points in those words. Play a series of rounds until someone reaches the total required to win the game.

34501.name: Double Vision
34501.description: A reflector-box is put in the middle of the table. All plates are arranged in any order on the 20 spots of the board edge. The turn player pushes two of the plates in the middle of the box to see the down side. If he sees 6 symbols at the upper and the mirror side he can take this plate.

34503.name: Flieg zu mir
34503.description:
The game is a memory game for Young and Old. You will get to know many species of local birds and trees. The players let male and female birds of the same species fly in the same kind of trees. Besides good memory, tactical skill and luck are necessary for the winner.
Each player tries to get as many bird pairs as possible .

34504.name: Raumschiff Galaxis
34504.description: Each player tries to bring 5 freight containers to the space stations with his space ship. The players block each other though, and the destination computer is playing up. Winner is the player who has delivered his freight containers and returned back to the basic field first.

34505.name: Fischzug
34505.description:
Every day courageous sailors go on a dangerous trip to the fishing areas of the world. They throw out their nets and hope of the biggest catch of their lives.
In this game the winner is the player who gets the most points out of his catch before an arranged number of fishing trips are completed.

34507.name: Denkste
34507.description: The window board is placed between the players. The turn player throws the symbol die, takes a marker and throws in into a slit with the same symbol. From now on the turn player has to memorize first how many markers are in every slit. Is his answer correct, He may throw the die once more. Is it wrong. His turn is over. The winner is the player who wins 4 rounds.

34508.name: Iron Road
34508.description:
Iron Road is the original printing of the game that would become TransAmerica.

Iron Road differs from TransAmerica in several ways though, for instance, the board is made up of squares rather than triangles, and the scoring system and game end conditions are altered as well.

Re-implemented by:

TransAmerica

34509.description: Starfire, The Gorm-Khanate War was an expansion to Starfire 2nd Edition (Boxed Set). This expansion introduced new rules, and a new race and empire to the game, the Empire of Gormus. In addition, it provided a campaign based on the war between Gorm and the Khanate of Orion using the campaign expansion Starfire New Empires for Starfire 2nd Edition.
34509.name: Starfire, The Gorm-Khanate War

34512.name: Ei der Kuckuck
34512.description: Each player moves the eggs of his color over the colored field of the board - towards a strange nest. Destination is to lay your own egg as a "kuckoo egg" into the nest of another player as fast as possible. Who manages this first wins the game.

34513.description: During the drying season all kangaroos are very thirsty. It is necessary that they reach the next water hole. The kangaroo pairs, mother and baby, must overcome the obstacles and reach the rescuing water hole. Those who reach the water first, may drink first. The player of the first kangaroo wins.
34513.name: Lass mein Känguruh in Ruh!

34514.name: Arctic
34514.description: Each player slips into the role of an ice bear who jumps from floe to floe. In the meantime the ice bears made a game out of it. They count the floes which they reach without falling into the water. The players take the floes which they leave and add the points of them. When no one can make any move the game is over. The player with the highest added points wins.

34516.description:
The small gnomes are smart friends. They jump from tree bloom to tree bloom, schmooze here and there and rest on a mushroom.
Each player tries to let their gnomes run through the woods so skillfully that their own forest plates are used and put on the table in a 5 x 5 pattern as maximum.
The winner is who returns back to the gnome house first.
34516.name: Wichtel-Rennen

34517.name: Shopping
34517.description: Downwards goes the one lift, upwards the second one. In the new warehouse you can see marvelous things to buy. The skillful user of the lift will soon have full shopping bags first. The player who returns to the entrance hall with full bags first wins the game.

34518.name: Holiday Express
34518.description:
Nice to look at it....the good old steam locomotive! With much noise she moves through the landscape and brings passengers to their vacation areas. We arrange a race and to give every player the chance to travel with the express.
Each player has 3 pawns and 3 secret tickets. The tickets show where the pawns have to travel with the Holiday Express. The winner is the player who reaches his destination with his pawn first.

34519.name: Obstsalat
34519.description:
48 cards are shuffled, and each player gets 6 cards. One card is put face-up on the table. The cards contain up to 6 different fruit. The turn player has to put down one card onto the open file.
When the open card shows: 3 bananas, 3 strawberries and 3 pineapples, the player must have a card with at least 4 bananas or 3 strawberries or 3 pineapples.
The winner is the player who gets rid of his/her cards first.

34520.name: Hopsi
34520.description: Many rabbits hide themselves in the colorful flower meadow. Also foxes are hidden there though ... and secret subsurface ways. You must try to find the 4 rabbits of your own color and bring them home into their stable. The player who has rummaged up his 4 rabbits first wins the game.

34521.description:
The animals get along well together. Sometimes they talk about who is the bigger animal.
In this game before the turn player opens up the next card he has to foresee or to guess: "Is the next open animal bigger or smaller than the animal that is already open on the table?" For a right guess you get chips.
The player who has filled his chip board totally wins the game.
34521.name: Von großen und kleinen Tieren

34522.description:
Each player tries to reach the beehive with his bee first. The honey bees fly from bloom to bloom. They may move in every direction. Does a bee meet another bee, this one must go back to the start and begin anew.
The bee which reaches the flying board of the beehive wins the game.
34522.name: Kleine Biene flieg schnell los!

34523.name: Double
34523.description:
Double is a cute color domino.
The game has 72 cards. Each card is subdivided in 3 colored sectors with a card value from 1 to 7.
The player has to get rid of his cards as fast as possible by putting them to the both ends of the open card line: yellow part aside yellow, red aside red, a.s.o.
The Player who gets rid of his cards first is the winner.

It appears that this game is very similar to, but not the same as On the Double, also by Maureen Hiron.

34524.name: Lord of the Things
34524.description:
"Amusing, easy party & family game. Collect Element stones for the Elements Fire, Water, Earth and Air. But be careful: you will find Dangers like Volcanoes, Floods, Earthquakes and Hurricanes. If you don't escape you are lost! Who will be Lord of the Things?"

Components: four game boards (earth, water, fire, air), 16 danger cards, 84 element stones (21 of each color), 4 bonus cards, and 16 player pieces (4 of each color).

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/lord.htm

34525.name: Network
34525.description:
An abstract strategy game played on a board with sixty squares bearing numbers from 1 to 6.

"A 'spacy' party & family game. Create a whole 'NETWORK' with Satellites, Net-markers, Rockets, clever actions and a little luck... You need a DIE too!"

The object of the game is to be the first player to create a 'network' by placing satellites and your net markers.

Components: gameboard, 6 satellites, 6 rockets, 24 net markers in four different colors.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/network.htm

34527.description:
2 to 4 small dragons always run to a volcano in order to get fresh fire stones for their store cupboard.
On the way there are surprising trade transactions. Which dragon has the most fire stones at the end?
34527.name: Feuerdrache

34528.name: Blütenhupfer-Farbentupfer
34528.description:
Each player takes one of the meadows. Then he takes one butterfly with 2 holes in their wings. Simultaneously all players try to find a position on the board where the color which shines through the hole is the same as on the other wing side.
The player who finds it first wins, and the next round can begin.

34529.name: Saurus
34529.description: The dinos are on their way to modern times. They have to overcome obstacles along the way. Hexagonal plates are put into a cue on the table. They are the playing board. Who has struggled through all events, and has reached the modern times?

34531.name: Wimmelburger
34531.description:
Welcome to Wimmelburger -Restaurant.

Here you can make your hamburger yourself, but there are not only tasty ingredients, but also uneatable ones that can be on that burger.
Before you finish a hamburger by putting the "upper half card" on the open deck you should convince yourself that you don't have any minus cards inside. The player with the most ingredients cards wins.

34533.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

The players compete, as Ramses I and Ramses II, to become the most well known and pious pharaoh of the ages. Using a limited supply of "build points", the players build pyramids, obelisks, statues and temples in and around Egypt. The Ramses II player also has the opportunity to denounce or deface the monuments of his predecessor. After the players have exhausted their build points, they determine when and if each monument is discovered (by die roll for the years 1880, 1912, and 2006). Points are scored based on the piety value of the buildings and the grandeur of buildings discovered in the future, bestowing each player's pharaoh with titles ranging from "The Great" to "The Weak."
34533.name: My Pharaoh

34534.name: Brummi
34534.description: People in the zoo are excited: The food for the animals ran out. All children work together to collect food in baskets and carry it to the zoo by truck (=Brummi). Whoevers basket reaches the zoo first, is the winner.

34535.name: Die Sonnenpyramide
34535.description:
In old Peru in the Inca empire King Atahualpa gave some of his people a brain teaser. Inside his palace he hid 34 animal symbols on a certain floor area.
When all symbols are solved each player counts his gold treasure.

34537.description: Each player tries to hide his dino eggs while at the same time trying to find his opponents dino eggs. The winner is the player who best hides the most eggs.
34537.name: Die Dinos sind los!

34538.name: MiniT
34538.description:
The idea is to win a MiniT (=Mini-Tennis) Tie-Break.
The game has 56 position cards, 20 running cards, 32 forehand cards, 32 backhand cards.

The game starts with the usual serve of a normal Tie-Break.
The played cards are put down on the table so that a pattern of cards is being developed into the size of a tennis court (8 by 5 cards). Player A starts with his serve. Then the players alternate getting 2 serves, starting with player B.
Play continues to 7 points or until a player leads by 2 points once 7 is reached.

34539.name: Kleine Rechenschule
34539.description:
4 basic arithmetic operations are exercised in this game.
Each player gets cards with a math problem. Whoever has solved all his problems first wins the game.

34540.name: Welt der guten Küche
34540.description:
With this quiz game the players will learn everything that they always wanted to know about the world of good cooking. With this game another lifestyle trend arrives now in the world of boardgames. „Which is a class champagne? “, „who is a famous television cook in England? “, „are there also female star cooks?“. These are only some the 600 questions, which were developed together with German Star Cook Johann Lafer.
The map is a genuine porcelain plate of Villeroy & Boch.

34541.name: Die kleinen Biber bauen einen Damm
34541.description: Together all of the beavers try to save the dam from the rising water. They get logs out to the woods in order to repair the beaver dam. Only when the beavers are fast enough will they win against the water.

34542.name: Das Eieruhr-Spiel
34542.description:
Each player tries to get his six markers from the bottom row no. 6 through the sand glass to the opposite row no. 6.
The player who reaches this opposite row first is the winner.

34543.description:
Children's game where they try and create a colored flower.
Three marbles, a bowl and lots of colored petals and the game can begin!
White, red, yellow or blue? Nobody knows what petal the marbles will land on.

Well hidden under the cup three marbles are rolling. For each marble that lands on a colored leaf, you get a petal of the same color.
The first one to collect six colored petals and thus creates a colored flower wins the game.
34543.name: Kullerblume

34544.name: Schischaukel
34544.description: Each player tries to collect as many points as possible by good placements in the 5 downhill ski-races. The winner is the player who has achieved the highest score after the last race.

34545.name: Mein erstes Naturspiel: Kennst Du den Baum?
34545.description: The players try to lay open the cards of a tree species and to get wood stones for this action. When all seven tree species in the row 1-5 lay open the game is over, and the player with the most wood stones wins.

34546.name: Hungriger Hai
34546.description: A hungry shark is on his way to eat fish caught in the nets of the fishermen. The fishermen decide to work together and hunt this shark. The fisherman are strongest when 5 are in the same boat, so they have to plan how they can get 5 together. The Shark is caught when the 5 fishermen and the shark are together on a light blue field, then the fishermen have won. If the shark makes it to his cave then he has won.

34547.name: Alles Banane!
34547.description:
The game is played in 5 rounds. Players take turns flipping over cards. When a banana card is flipped up, the active player gets a big banana. When a monkey is shown, the banana has to be put back. Banana peels mean there is no change. When all cards are face up the round is finished. The player who has the big banana at the end of the round gets a small banana. The player who has the most bananas at the end wins.
The game is entirely luck-driven and targets the very young.

34548.name: Doktor K. jagt 006
34548.description:
A trick-taking card game around Agent 006.
The players try to get as many tricks as possible. In the tricks there may be identity cards which can be traded in for agent equipment cards.
The players with 6 or more equipment cards wins the game.

34549.name: Kobold & Co
34549.description:
The players discover an unknown island where goblins live. At the and of the island visit they get treasures from the goblins which have to be found around the island. The goblins however have fun trying to disturb the players during their search for the treasure.
The player who has found the most treasures is the winner.

34550.description:
During unloading of an airplane all suitcases on the plane have been dropped and opened. The contents of the suitcases got messed up. Everyone has since quickly filled the suitcases again, but what is inside my suitcase now?
The game ends when all passengers have found their suitcases. The player with the highest score wins.
34550.name: Das Kofferkarussell

34551.name: Max & Moritz
34551.description: The players try to play a coup of Max & Moritz. Whoever succeeds in playing a coup may give away a chip. Whoever gets rid of his chips first wins the game.

34552.name: Das längste Wort
34552.description: Are you "wordy"? Then you will have fun with this fast and funny game. The game idea is to build words out of a "handful of characters". Short words or long words. The longest words let you move quickly forward to the finish line.

34553.name: Sonne, Mond und Sterne
34553.description: The trip starts on the moon and leads to a wild odyssey to the sun. With luck and some playing with numbers you are able to send back some space stations and with them skillfully move yourself forward. The winner is the player who reaches the pink star with the 6 on the sunbeam first.

34555.name: Größer als ein Autobus
34555.description:
Three different word games can be played with the material.
As an example the first game:
Playing Passt in jeden Koffer' (="fits in every suitcase") the game leader thinks about a word and puts the matching character cards in wrong order on the table. Each player tries to find the word first to get the attribute card.

34557.name: Lettro
34557.description: With the Lettro - character cards you can play many popular games as Buchstaben-Memo for 2 to 5 players, or Alphabet-Training for 1 and more players,or Buchatebn-Quartett for 2 to4 players, Kreuzwort, ABC-Schnipp-Schnapp and finally Wörter-Poker.

34558.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"Welcome to your new farm! The land has been previously farmed pretty hard and it is your turn to make it profitable again."

Players take turns placing their markers, either on the mapsheet or on a strategy sheet (the latter invokes certain special results, such as increasing victory points for occupied hexes, or requiring markers to be removed from the board, etc.) Once both players have placed all twelve of their markers, the positions are scored to determine the winning farmer.
34558.name: Farmer

34559.name: Zaubertrank
34559.description: Each player plays the role of a magician who has to brew a magic potion. They need ingredients for it. The magicians walk through the forest to search for those ingredients. In some fields they find only one half of a ingredient and have to look for the other half. The winner is the player who accumulates all of the needed ingredients first.

34560.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

An abstract, small-format "shoot-em-up" wargame with asymmetrical forces.

The mapsheet is a narrow corridor of irregularly shaped spaces made from overlapping hexes, some of which are marked as offering special defensive bonuses.

The black forces, which start at the south edge of the map, consist of three armor, three infantry, and three artillery units. The red player controls the northern half of the mapsheet, which holds the victory point hexes. The red forces consist of five infantry units and three artillery units.

All of the units are marked with two numbers. To prevail in combat, a unit must roll a result between these two numbers on 2d6. All units have the same movement rate, one space per turn.
34560.name: War?

34561.name: Ein Kamel, ein Kamel...
34561.description: Each player must try to get rid of his cards as fast as possible. That happens by laying out his cards in a maximum of 4 rows on the table or on the decks of opposing players Whoever lays down all his cards first is the winner and takes the camels.

34562.name: Oh, wie schön ist Panama
34562.description: We travel with Tiger and Bear through Panama, the land of their dreams. You smell bananas there, wherever you are. On their trip they meet a lot of friendly animals, go by raft and have to go across bridges in order to finally come back home happy . In order that no one dies of hunger everyone gets a cooking pot, anyone else goes fishing at the neighbor... Whoever returns back home first wins.

34563.name: Vogelhochzeit
34563.description:
Each player gets a pawn which is moved by a die and cards with pictures of male birds. The cards of the female birds are put face down on the board
The players try to find as many fitting cards with female birds as possible. The winner is the player with the most pairs of birds.

34564.name: Schlaufuchs und Stachelhaut
34564.description:
Hedgehogs are useful animals, but the fox is one of their natural enemies. They find shelter for themselves by rolling themselves together into a bowl.

A highway with cars is a dangerous place for them. On land without bushes and hedges they cannot hide themselves. The players must try to keep the hedgehogs out of danger. The player who finishes his tour around the board and back to the nest with hedgehogs first is the winner.

34566.description: In the Indian village Pocahontas looks for friends Meeko and Flit. After she has found them she walks to Grandma Willow's where she gets help for her adventures. Together with Captain John Smith she walks across the rock and the river to the ship. They have to pass the malicious Governor Ratcliffe. Whoever reaches the ship first with Meeko, Flit and John Smith wins the game.
34566.name: Pocahontas-Abenteuer-Spiel

34567.name: Fünf vor Zwölf
34567.description:
The game idea is to save the earth from suffocation in garbage. The players move over the board hitting fields with question cards and action cards. The right answers provide green chips. 3 chips can be traded in for a puzzle segment of nature that covers the garbage. Wrong answers and bad action cards provide black points which let the clock move towards the 12!
Is the landscape totally filled with nature puzzles the players have won.

34568.name: Brainy
34568.description: The idea of BRAINY is to decode the secret three-line-pattern-code and to get as many chips as possible to win.

34569.name: Weihnachtsmann: zieh dich an
34569.description: Each player tries to provide Santa Claus with a cap, coat, sack, pants and boots and to reach one of the red marked finish fields with one pawn.

34571.name: The Great Word Race
34571.description:
Publishers description:

"Children of all ages will have fun challenging their spelling skills while playing The Great Word Race! You'll never believe spelling can be such a blast. Race your pawn from start to finish by moving it the number of letters in the word you build. Throw six dice with the letters of the alphabet. Add any Letter for Life cards you have collected. If you land on a Pick A Card square, use it! Should you collect Letter for Life cards, double your spaces, or Pick a Card and follow its instructions. Choose your strategy and race for the finish!"

For 2 to 4 players. Ages 6 and up.

34572.name: Beddy-Bye Baby Game
34572.description:
The Darling Dash to Tuck Baby into Bed! It's beddy-bye time and it's up to you to collect a teddy bear,pajamas and bottle and tuck your baby into bed. Before you know it, your precious little bundle of joy will be all snuggled up and fast asleep!

Contents: Game board,48 playing cards,4 tokens with stands,1 rattle die,rules.

34573.name: Tornado Alley
34573.description:
Several storm cells bear down on the town of Doomsville, Oklahoma (population 213). Each contains an F1 tornado that will grow in strength and carve its own path of destruction. Do what you have always wanted to... Take control of one of nature's most dangerous forces: the Tornado! Using your twister, destroy as much of the town of Doomsville and the surrounding countryside as you can - do a better job than the other players and win the game!

To win, you will need to properly control the path of the Tornado and manage its strength so that destroy high value buildings. Some buildings can only be destroyed by extremely strong F5 tornadoes, while others can be wiped out with only an F2. You will manage the strength and path using a pool of "storm points". Each player starts with the same amount, but as you use them to plan your actions, the pools for each tornado will change accordingly.

Doomsville rebuilds itself for each game; meaning that for each game there is a method for randomly building the town and the surrounding countryside. This makes each game play distinctly different and puts the tornadoes into a fight to get the higher value buildings before their opponents.

So what are you waiting for...? Get to wiping Doomsville off the map!

NOTE: This game was inspired a couple of months after a small twister (F0 probably) tore up some trees in my yard in July 2006 and discussing it with my son. Tornadoes are very dangerous and interesting facts and safety information about tornadoes will be included in the game.

34574.name: Thomas' Great Race Game
34574.description:
Thomas has challenged James, Molly and Percy to a great race! Learn numbers as you earn coal to shovel into your engine and power it up and over the hill. Develop sorting, counting and color matching skills as you race to the finish.

Contents: Great race track (2 sections), track connector, 4 racing engines, 24 question cards, 30 coal blocks, game rules.

34575.name: Sea Monsters
34575.description:
Description from products website:

“Set sail for the New World across uncharted waters,where unseen Sea Monsters are lurking below the waves. Navigate through typhoons, get blown off course and even drift out to sea. And just when you think your home free,a Sea Monster may appear out of nowhere to wreck your ship!”

Contents: 8 Sea Monsters/Wave Cards,12 Ships (4 colors),4 port of call cards,8 storm at sea cards, Seafarer's Die (Blue), Sea Monster's Die (Green),rules.

34576.name: Clothespins! Game
34576.description:
Briarpatch website description:

Hang onto your shorts! Clothespins! Is the fast paced,strategy game where players score points by completing clotheslines of matching patterns or items of laundry. But watch out for the birds they may fly off with your boxers!

34579.name: Pip
34579.description:
PIP- The Ultimate Domino Game. A Distinctively different domino game. Challenging fun for the entire family!

There's a challenge with every play! By using our unique Wild Tiles designs and Directional Tiles, we have combined traditional dominoes with a different theme to provide an exciting change of pace. Strategy and luck are also in play with each round as players compete to be the first to play their last remaining tile.

Double 9 domino game plus 11 wild Pips, and four directional tiles which cause skip, reverse, play again, and draw action. 70 Standard Size (1" x 2" x 3/8") tiles in vinyl, snap case, with wooden centerpiece. 2-6 players.

34580.description:
Combat Commander: Battle Pack #2 – Stalingrad is the second themed collection of scenarios for use with the Combat Commander: Europe series of games. The theme of this second Battle Pack shifts to the East Front in late 1942 as German and Soviet forces clash in and around the vaunted city of Stalingrad. CC–Stalingrad features eleven new scenarios printed on cardstock -- one of which is a new style of multi-scenario Campaign Game -- as well as eight new maps and dozens of new counters. Numerous additional rules relevant to the dense urban fighting characteristic of the struggle for Stalingrad are also included:

Factories;
Urban Snipers;
Ongoing Melee;
Rubble, Debris & Craters;
Underground Sewer Movement;
and the Ampulomet Molotov Launcher.

The scenarios included in CC–Stalingrad are:

“Spartakovka Salient” set at Spartakovka, 23 August 1942;
“Sea Devils” set at the Grain Elevator, 18 September 1942;
“Not One Step Back!” set at Dolgyi Gully, 1 October 1942;
“Fortresses of Blood and Iron” set near the Volga River, 1 October 1942;
“Into the Breach” set at the Barrikady's Great Assembly Hall, 17 October 1942;
“Dom 31” set behind the Barrikady, 27 October 1942;
“The Commissar's House” as fought on 13 November 1942;
“Rumanian Defiance” the battle for Obliskaya Airfield, 29 November 1942;
“Lyudnikov's Island” near the Barrikady Fuel Tank Area, 22 December 1942;
“Stalingrad of the North” set at Veliki Luki, 14 January 1943;
and the “Stand and Die” multi-scenario Campaign Game recreating the see-saw battle for Mamayev Kurgan, late September 1942.

From the cover:

Please Note: CC: Stalingrad Battle Pack Nr2 is NOT a standalone game. You will need to own both CC: Europe and CC: Mediterranean in order to play every scenario; 7 of 11 in the Pack can be played without owning CC: Mediterranean.

Additional scenario designs in this second Pack are courtesy of Mark Kalina, Bryan Collars, Kai Jensen and Will Green.

Expands:

Combat Commander: Europe and Combat Commander: Mediterranean (both required)
34580.name: Combat Commander: Battle Pack #2 – Stalingrad

34581.name: Cool Chicken
34581.description:
A board and card game designed to help develop library skills.

Contents:
- gameboard
- game cards
- markers + guides
- poster

34582.name: Know Mosquitoes
34582.description:
From Henderson (2003):

"This game is Monopoly-style game that incorporates knowledge of mosquito biology and control. It consists of 2 dice, 12 game pieces, 140 ‘Question and Answer’ cards, and 32 Life Cycle cards. As players answer questions correctly they move their game piece and attempt another question. An extensive glossary of terms with definitions is included."

Henderson, Julie Price. Annotated Bibliography: Mosquito Educational Tools for Children. Winnipeg: Natural Resources Institute, University of Manitoba, 2003.

34583.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Set Cubed is a curious game of clever connections, challenging a player's ability to identify SETs between the dice in their hand and those already on the board. Players can play up to 3 dice per turn making as many SETs as possible. Create SETs up, down and across the board, the more SETs you create, the higher your score. As the number of dice on the board increase so do the possible SET combinations. Rack up points by using BONUS SQUARES! Roll a WILD dice and unleash the possible number of SETs that can be made during your turn! How many SETs can you make?! The player with the most points wins!
34583.name: Set Cubed

34584.name: Real Fishing
34584.description:
OBJECTIVE:
Catch and bring in the highest total weight of fish.

GAME PLAY:
Draw a boat, choose your fishing "jigs" (rods) and lures, then set out to catch fish. You decide how far to travel (up to your boat's max speed) on each turn, but you have to slow down if you're in the weeds or in a dock zone.

Travel around the water "casting" and "flippin'" fish, and make sure you have the right jig for the type of water you're fishing. If you're "flippin'", you can get right up next to a fish, but if you're casting, you have to stay a few spaces away and roll the die to see if you've caught it. (Takes some initial strategy to make sure you have enough of the right jigs for the area you're planning to fish.)

And those fish are crafty - you might lose a rod or a lure or pull in a mermaid or old tire instead of a fish. And sometimes you have to throw one back.

Get back to your starting dock within 32 turns or start losing fish.

Includes rules for "Recreational" play and "Tournament" play.

GAME COMPONENTS:
1 Lake playing surface (board with small hexes)
6 boat cards
48 lure cards
36 "jig" cards (rod and reel)
12 sets of fish markers, of 5 types (two types have 3 sets, the rest have two)
6 Strategy statistic reference cards
1 six-sided die
6 colored plastic round boat markers
1 score pad
15 plastic re-usable bags

boardgamehonor: 2008 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters' Selection Nominee
2008 Spiel des Jahres Nominee
2008 Spiel des Jahres Winner
2009 Årets Spill Best Family Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2009 Gouden Ludo Nominee
2011 Hungarian Board Game Award Nominee
34585.description:
Keltis is a multi-player game based on Lost Cities, with some rules changes, later published with Knizia's original rules and theme as Lost Cities: The Board Game.

Players play cards to move their playing pieces along stone paths. Cards show one of five different colors/symbols, each corresponding to one path; in addition, each card shows a number (0-10, twice each). In each color, each player can play his cards in either ascending or descending order. As in Lost Cities, it's better to concentrate on a few paths since the final spaces on a path grant high points, but ending early gives negative ones.

The active player plays one card (out of a hand of eight) or discards one, then moves the corresponding playing piece on the path. Many of the spaces have a token that grants some bonus: either immediate points (counted on the scoring track), an extra move on a path, or wishing stones that are needed at game end to avoid negative points.

The game ends when five playing pieces (from any combination of players) have reached the seventh (or higher) space on their respective paths. Now, scoring happens:

Pieces that moved only 1-3 steps earn negative points (-4, -3, -2).
Pieces with 4+ steps earn points (1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 10).
One piece of each player twice the height of other pieces scores double, either positive or negative.
Holding fewer than two wish stones earns negative points (-3 / -4), while a collection of five or more stones yields a bonus of 10 points.




All endgame points are added to any scored during the game. The player with the highest score wins!


Primary differences between Lost Cities: The Board Game and Keltis:

1. In LCBG you play 3 rounds, scoring at the end of all 3 for the monuments you collect. (Normal scoring occurs each round.) In Keltis, you only play 1 round, and score everything each round. This is not just a rule difference, as the scoring is different for the monuments/stones based on the number collected.

2. In Keltis, you may play your cards in either order, high to low, or low to high. In LCBG, you must go low to high.

Note: the rules for LCBG have the Keltis rules as variants, and have the board elements necessary for #1 above. Keltis does not have the rules nor board elements to play LCBG.

There are more differences that are non-substantive. (Art, points in LCBG multiplied by 5, etc.)
34585.name: Keltis
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 035 – Spiel des Jahres predictions and discussion
Episode 16: Keltis
Episodio 14 – Especial verano 2014: Reglas mal explicadas
Garrett's Games 402 - Contest Resolved, Freedom, Expedition Northwest Passage and more!
HLG-EXTRA 5: Spellenspektakel 2016
Podcast #008
Spiele-Podcast Nr. 30: Lost Cities und Keltis (Kosmos)
The Spiel #56 - Spiel des Schpiel 2008

34586.name: Dupe
34586.description:
From the publisher's website:

A quick and skillful strategy game for two where players thread the two-tone cord back and forth through the holes of the hand held board until all adjoining hole options are filled. Maneuvering an opponent's cord end into a blocked position requires rational decision making and observation skills so make sure you're not the one getting strung along!

34587.name: Big Board Raiders
34587.description:
From the publisher's website bigboardraiders.net :

I do not have any affiliation with any investment entity and I am not encouraging anyone to invest in anything. This is intended for your entertainment and learning.

I think we all know young boys or girls who seem like they were hard-wired for finance. When the subject of money is being discussed, they are right there like spounges soaking it up. I know because I was one of them, but my parents didn't take the time to teach me about money. Today lots of parents still don't teach their kids enough about money, and yet our kids will all deal with money most days in their lives and how early they begin to understand money, will directly influence their lifestyle. This game is for parents to encourage those little finance prodigies. The world is changing to where the cash in your hand is the crumbs from the table, while the banquet is inside the corporations. For Grade 5 and up, but best for teens and up.

The “Big Board” is like a nickname for Wall Street, while “Raiders” are the teams of entrepreneurs, lawyers, accountants, brokers and investment bankers who engaged in hostile takeovers of the companies they pursue. In Big Board Raiders, players can gang-up by pooling their capital to promote a cause or stop another player, but alliances don’t last forever and when they end, backstabbing is an inevitable strategy. Communication and deal making are very important enhancements to a player’s game strategy. A few choice words can help your portfolio or have the opposite effect on your opponent’s. It’s all about opportunities, timing and the hustle.

There are two main objectives players engage in while playing Big Board Raiders; the first is to get elected by proxy as a director of a company and the second is to grow your portfolio using the many investment vehicles, so that you will have the capital to make your move to control your company; the company in which you were elected to the board by proxy. There are four trading companies: Yellow, Blue, Red, and Green. Six Subsidiaries, and each of these subsidiaries has a proxy vote that it gives to the players as they land on their subsidiary space on the game board. To win, grow your capital while collection the proxy votes to be elected as a director, then buy enough shares to take over control of that company.

34588.name: Gold Hat Card Game
34588.description: This game is a parody of the Fleet Captain’s Gold Hat Championship at Origins. The game reflects the final four rounds, although players could agree ahead of time to play all seven rounds (or any number of rounds). Each player draws opponents and plays various cards on themselves or the other players in an attempt to reach the gold hat before anyone else. The game is intended for 4-6 players and is extremely tongue-in-cheek, concentrating more on the humorous aspects of the game instead of the serious. It is not the intent of the designers or publishers to insult anyone but only to provide an entertaining distraction between four hour long tournament games.

34589.name: Poppo
34589.description:
From website:

"Peter Poppo™ and his pals come together in this exciting new game specially designed for emerging readers. Kids and adults alike will love popping the poppers to race to spell words from the 100 colorfully illustrated picture cards.

Your child pops the lettered dice in the poppers and matches them with the word or picture on the card. Being able to rearrange and assemble letters into words in a fast paced setting is challenging and fun. Matching, grouping, and sorting are all skills involved in this challenging fast-paced activity game from Poppo Brands™.

Each round takes up to 60 seconds – perfect for young attention spans – so your kids will love to play again and again."

Ages 4 and up

34590.name: Skoki Narciarskie
34590.description:
This board game simulates ski jumping.

Players place their jumper tokens on a ski jumping hill and push them down to let them slide down and eventually "jump". The final score is a combination of the jump length and the "jump style rating" determined by players (they vote using special style scoring cards).

34591.description:
Juego sobre la Batalla del Ebro 1938 de la Guerra Civil Española.
Sistema clásico de hexagonos y fichas a nivel batallon con CRT. Tactico - operacional segun el autor
Incluye 1400 fichas, 4 mapas, rules y libro de escenarios.
Unica realización de la empresa - Vae Victis SCCL.



Game about the battle of the Ebro 1938, in the Spanish Civil War.
Classic wargame with hex and counters. Level Battalion with CRT. Tactic operative scale.
Include 1400 counters, 4 maps and scenery book
34591.name: La Batalla del Ebro, 1938

34593.name: The Doctor Who Miniatures Game
34593.description:
The Doctor Who Miniatures Game allows players to recreate the drama of the Doctor's many adventures on the tabletop using miniature figures and scenery. One player takes the side of good, with the Doctor, his companions and some kind of troops (like UNIT soldiers). The other side is generally some dread alien menace seeking to conquer or destroy (Daleks, Cybermen, etc.)

Although weapons play a part in the game, they seldom are the winning factor for the good side. Instead they often rely on the Doctor to invent a device or discover a critical weakness of the aliens, and thereby save the world.

Rules and scenarios from all eras of Doctor Who are available for download from the author's website for free.

Home Page: http://www.drwhominiatures.co.uk/

The Doctor Who Miniatures Game is not the same game as the Warlords Games version; Doctor Who Miniatures Game (still to be published).

34594.name: Ming
34594.description:
Ming is an original, chess like strategy game. It is played on a board with 7 x 7 fields.
Every player has 7 figures (1 emperor, 1 mandarin, 2 generals, 3 monks) that vary in height. In the course of a game, own and opponents marbles are added to the figures. These define the distance a figure can move and in which way (diagonal or horizontal and vertical).

The game is won in one of three ways:
1) Conquer your opponents emperor;
2) Reach the opponents starting line or
3) Conquer seven marbles of your opponents colour.

34595.name: Paul Wing's Spelling Bee
34595.description:
from Radio Game Show Games: This early effort predates what are generally considered to be the first game shows. Players drew chips from a bag to determine which word on the host's card they had to spell correctly. Paul Wing was an author and NBC staff director. His show was originally heard only in the cities competing in each weekly broadcast, but the program did eventually (and briefly) gain full network status. Cutting costs even in the 1930s, Milton Bradley's materials for this game were identical to the ones used in Vox Pop.

The game was played by choosing a word caller, then going around the room and having people pull numbered disks out of a bag; the number on the disk determined the word you would spell (and some words were notably easier than others, so it was a bit of a game of chance). Correct moves got you a little green counter called a "honey," and wrong moves got you a little red counter called a "stinger" (because it's a bee, get it?)

34597.description:
PLEASE NOTE: This game description is out-of-date and needs to be updated. Please subscribe to my game design blog for latest updates.

Sturm Europa! is a grand strategic simulation, currently in pre-production, that recreates the entire European conflict during the Second World War. Euro-style wooden pieces are used to depict resources, that depending on placement, represent air, land, and sea units. Each player has a privacy screen that creates "fog of war" by keeping resources and units not on the front line hidden. Sturm Europa! will distinguish itself from other games of the genre in these key areas:

Playability: The entire war, Fall 1939 to the bitter end (Spring 1945 or later), can be played in 6-8 hours. No hexes, no counters, and low luck.

Scale: The map board employs area movement over land regions but the low unit density allows players to realize the full impact of mobile warfare and appreciate the daunting size of Mother Russia without slowing game play unnecessarily. A unique front-reserve combat system allows for operational level details like blitzes, assaults, encirclements, feints, static defense, and defense in depth which are normally lost in grand-strategic simulations.

Units: Units are not only rated by movement, but attrition, assault, and blitz strength. Elite units are created by combat experience, events, and tech research - introducing an extra dimension as units are upgraded and downgraded throughout the war, reflecting varying levels of experience, training, leadership, and technology.

Production: Sturm Europa! goes beyond the standard model of linking military production to a GDP estimate. Nations must mobilize to achieve full wartime production but it takes much more to wage war than just massive production lines. Manpower, oil, steel, and even trained pilots are all tracked without ANY bookkeeping through an innovative system of collecting resources as strategy cards are played. Resources are consumed by prolonged offensives so logistics plays just as much a factor as unit strength.

Strategy Cards: Sturm Europa! is a card driven game (i.e. Paths of Glory). Events introduce historical and political events in a realistic fashion while eliminating scripting and "look up" rules. There is a tangible cause-effect relationship to every event and nothing occurs in a seemingly random or ahistorical manner. Players play the cards - the cards don't play the players. Most importantly, the core mechanic of tough gut wrenching decisions which make CDGs so fun is still preserved.

Technology: Players can customize their units to fight the style of war that best suits their strategy. Germany can develop the He 100 long range fighter that greatly improves their chances in the Battle of Britain. The Americans can develop a heavy-medium tank instead of sending Shermans to get chewed up by King Tigers. Tough decisions will have to be made to implement new technologies though. New designs don't just start rolling off the assembly lines without causing a shortage of replacements on the front line while the factories retool and crews retrain...

TENTATIVE COMPONENT LIST:
(2) large 6-panel mounted maps
(156) full color event cards
(450) wooden resource / unit blocks
(160) die-cut counters
(1) 16-page full color rulebook
(3) player screens
(3) player aids

Can be combined with Operation Orient
34597.name: Sturm Europa!

34599.description:
In Toledo players try to forge magnificent swords and bring them into the fortress of the city, the “Alcazar”.
Each player can send his five helpers on the map and on to the roads of Toledo, in order to acquire steel and jewels from dealers. Thus they get swords manufactured at the most famous armorer in the city. Afterwards those swords are to be delivered to Alcazar.
In addition there are two taverns (at which one “refuels” cards) as well as a place where the works of art of the resident painter, El Greco, are available.
There is a lot to discover in Toledo.
34599.name: Toledo
boardgamepodcastepisode: clp043 – cubelove podcast – Martin Wallace Short Review Smackdown
The Spiel #73 - Espadas & Cigarros (Swords & Cigars)
Toledo

34600.name: Who Done It?
34600.description: Players assume the roles of detectives and sit around a 4 person device with 4 phones. Players take turns calling in for clues which are delivered via their personal phone, and some are delivered via all points bulletins over a common speaker. Players record clues on a special playing sheet provided to track individual suspects in mysteries. Mysteries are kept on an "Atari-style" chip that is plugged into the machine. The game comes with one chip of mysteries, and purports to have additional chips available. Like clue with the possibility of individually delivered evidence.

34601.name: Sarete Famosi
34601.description:
In this game you play the role of a man/woman who wants to fulfill a professional career, selecting a type of character and an objective. You start rolling 2 dice in order to move that number of spaces on the board and get random event drawing cards.
Cards can give you money and other types of fulfillment to reach your goal.
The box contains 6 coloured plastic markers for the players, two wooden dices, a block of sheets to write down your characteristics, a deck of event cards and some "goal card".

34602.name: The Prez
34602.description:
From the publisher's website:

Now you can run your own presidential campaign!

Campaign finances, strategic debates and racking up those all important electoral votes could lead you to a stunning victory on the "wild and wacky run for the White House"™!

Choose your home state, begin visiting states to establish campaign headquarters and line up workers until you gain control of a state to receive its electoral votes. Strategically timing debates with other candidates and budgeting your campaign finances while trying to stay out of the spin zone are all part of the fun!

Before the first round is over, you'll know why key states have played important parts in the recent elections and as the last round is played you will have a new appreciation of the total commitment required when striving to gain the electoral votes needed for the U.S. presidency.

Home Page: http://www.theprez.net/

34603.description:
Based on the books by Lauren Child and the television series. Educational and simple board game for 2 to 4 children Ages 3 and up.
Will you be the one to yell "I've Won!" like Lola does? Be the first to reach "I've Won!" in the center of the board after collecting three pink milk cards, but watch out for the tigers who want your pink milk. Comes with game board, 1 die, 4 game pieces with stands and instructions.
34603.name: Lola's Pink Milk Game

34604.description:
The Totaler Krieg! Player's Guide and expansion kit contains a 90 page book with new scenarios, designer & developer notes, strategy and play tips, questions & answers, and 80 new counters to expand the game.

Expands:

Totaler Krieg!
34604.name: Totaler Krieg! Player's Guide & Expansion Kit

34606.name: Asian Travels
boardgamepublisher: Asian Art Museum of San Francisco
boardgameversion: Asian Art Museum of San Francisco Edition
34606.description:
From Old Silk Road: A voyager in the game finds himself on the trade routes which existed at the height of the Tang Dynasty in China (c. 750 AD). He sets out from Chang An, the cosmopolitan Chinese capital. Traveling across northern China and then to Central Asia, with a lucky roll of the die he will arrive at Samarkand, an important trading center. There, glass, fruit and horses may be purchased. At Merv, the traveler must decide whether to follow the overland or sea route. Going by sea, one has the opportunity to buy incense at the port of Hormoz, collect rubies, sapphires and pearls in the kingdom of Anuradhapura (now in Sri Lanka), visit the wondrous temples at Elephanta and Kancipuram and buy spices in Srivijaya (Sumatra). But beware! There are mighty perils on this route. On the overland route, the traveler visits magnificent Buddhist temples in India and beyond, encounter tigers in the jungles of Bengal and purchase luxuries such as kingfisher feathers and rhino horn at Angkor. The final leg of the journey passes through the the bustling port of Guangzhou (Canton) and then off to Japan and Korea where the traveler will be able to visit foreign temples and complete final trading before returning home by way of the Grand Canal.

Each location includes a special paragraph of text describing what happens to the traveler there. Often they include special trading opportunities. Major trading centers have specific products which they sell and also another list which they want to purchase. Commodity holdings are shown by cards which list the differing values of these items at various locations. Includes short history and glossary of terms.

34607.name: Politics Party-Pun
34607.description: This game from 1960 consists of two six-sided dice showing heads and tails of elephants and donkeys. Intended as something to encourage people to vote, the game play is similar to put-and-take.

34608.name: Last Word Game
34608.description: This is John Weber Manufactory's entry into the realm of letter dice games. The game comes with 8 Nu-process letter dice and proudly proclaims the dice are plastic-coated and bear 'official typography'.

34610.name: Häschen in der Grube
34610.description: The rabbits eat delicious vegetables in the garden. In front of the garden fence they discover big carrots. In the middle of the garden there is a hole. Caution! Don't fall down there! First there is a thin chain that is laid around all players' pawns which are placed around that hole on the board. Each turn the player throws the die and moves as many fields to the outside as the die shows. When a rabbit reaches the chain it is pushed forward in an outside direction while opposite rabbits located in the opposite direction are pushed towards the hole and may fall into it when the thrown die shows enough eyes. The winner is the player who has at least one rabbit left at the end.

34611.name: Fleißige Bienen
34611.description: Each player on his turn flies with his magnetic honey bee to any bloom and puts the bee on the pollen in the middle of the bloom. He then lifts the bee up carefully. If he is lucky some pollen will keep sticking to the magnet. Then he may immediately fly back and deposit the pollen into the honeycomb. The winner is the player who fills up 5 honeycombs first.

34612.name: Auto-Scooter
34612.description:
Auto-Scooter at a fair: Each player moves his auto-scooter around the track. He tries to crash into the scooters of the other players and gets "crash points". But has to be careful not caution not to get crashed into from the back.
The winner is the one with the most crash points at the end!

34613.name: Fare Game
34613.description:
Each player drives a taxi cab that they use to pickup passengers from locations determined by dice rolling to a destination determined by a dice rolling.

Payment is determined by the route taken and the distance traveled.

Intersections can provide an advantage or a disadvantage to each player. Intersections can be clear, have lights or be completely blocked, which changes the route chosen by the players.

Players can also get in each others way.

34614.name: Qwikstat Basketball
34614.description: Fast playing stat summary basketball game. You can get individual player stats for all major stat categories for each game. All NBA seasons from 1954/55-2006/07 seasons. ABA seasons 1966/67-1975/76 coming spring 2008. All games available as Adobe pdf files only and delivered by email. Basic game is instructions, charts and any 2 NBA seasons for $9.95 Paypal preferred. My email address and Paypal ID is rgfray@Yahoo.com. For checks, mail to Bob Fray, 202 Ann St., Phoenixville, Pa 19460. $4.00 extra if you want files on cdrom mailed. For brochure requests, email me - many other original sports games available.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Årets Spill Best Family Game Nominee
2010 Guldbrikken Best Family Game Nominee
34615.description:
In New World: A Carcassonne Game, players begin as early settlers of the United States on the east coast of the continent. As in the original Carcassonne game, players lay tiles turn by turn to build towns, roads, and other parts of the countryside. A player can choose to place one of his tokens on the tile he lays for the turn, and if that town, road, etc. is completed, then the player scores points and reclaims his token for later use. Whoever scores the most points wins.

One big twist in New World: A Carcassonne Game compared to the original game is that play starts on the east coast, and as players score points, a pair of surveyors drive exploration inexorably westward. Players who do not complete their features before the surveyors pass them by will find their tokens removed from the board - for no points!
34615.name: New World: A Carcassonne Game

34616.name: Pablo Junior
34616.description:
This is a game where you build 3-D abstract art pieces based on similarities to Pablo Picasso, hence the name. Publisher Fox Spielverlag pitches this as "a stick game with unlimited possibilities." However, there are no "rules" per se. This is more of a "creative expression" product.

Pablo Jr. is actually a 4-part product [1 of 4 boxes is currently represented]. Each "Junior" box contains 25% of the bits contained in Fox Spielverlag's Pablo "big-box" edition.

34617.name: Quiz Spiel
34617.description:
A light quiz game for 2 - 5 players.

Players have to get 20 points (i.e. 20 rightly answered questions) to win.

34618.name: 101 giochi con carta e matita
34618.description:
One of the most complete books about paper and pencil games in the world. It contains 101 games among traditional, less known and totally original ones, all to be played with just paper and pencils. Featuring contributions by renown game designers as Spartaco Albertarelli, Domenico Di Giorgio, Alessandro Gatti, Dan Glimne, Beppi Menozzi, Paolo Mori, Water Obert, Pier Giorgio Paglia, Silvano Sorrentino and Andrés Voicu. Rules, variants, history, anecdotes, problems and strategy/tactics notes are included.

In the '90s, a previous Super Sharp Pencil & Paper Games featuring 50 games (39 in the English and Korean editions) appeared.

In 2008 a reduced version for children, with rewriteable boards, has been published by Editoriale Scienza as "Battaglia navale e altri giochi con carta e matita".

In 2016 another reduced edition with 48 games, aimed to families, appeared as "Giochiamo insieme con carta e matita", by Edizioni Sonda.

34619.description:
HASTINGS 1066 EIN RITTER SPIEL
Release date: March 2008

Duke William of Normandy has crossed the channel to win the English throne. Harold Godwinson has rushed south to meet him. What follows is a classic battle that will change world history.

In Hasting, two players take on the roles of William and Harold. They command their armies and try to herd their enemy into a killing ground. It is the ultimate game of skill.

Ein Ritter Spiel is a dice-less battle game that allows players to be a general without the danger of real warfare.

Ein Ritter Spiel games come in a box with a 21x16 inch hard board map, an order of battle, laminated rules, and wooden counters.

TYPE: Ein Ritter Spiel – Dice-less War game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
