AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 1 hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
34619.name: Hastings 1066: Ein Ritter Spiel

34620.name: Sherlock Holmes: The Fenian Murders
34620.description:
SHERLOCK HOLMES AND THE FENIAN MURDERS

Terrorism was nothing new in 19th century England. Irish Fenian rebels plotted violence in England and abroad. Now Sherlock Holmes has been called in to investigate the death of two women at a country estate. It has all the markings of the Fenians. Players make up the clues that Holmes finds. Truth must be revealed.

This is an Engle Matrix Game so each player champions one of the characters of the story. Each turn they buy the right to make up the next clue discovered. This is not automatic though. The player picks another player to decide what their "to happen" roll is. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a big dice rolling contest. Players try to pin the murder on one another. It never plays the same way twice because people make up different clues each time.

The Fenian Murders uses the same rules as The Case of the Dead Duke. If you like murder mystery then you’ll love this game.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 20x15 inch hard board map, character sheet book, rules book, scenario book, wooden counters, plastic gold coins and 2 dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $40.00

34621.name: Arkham Terror: Experimental Therapy
34621.description:
ARKHAM TERROR: EXPERIMENTAL THERAPY

Patients at Miskatonic State Hospital for the Insane receive state of the art therapy – 1923 state of the art! There is something going on here. The players take on the roles of doctors and patients. Each turn they make up clues that show what is actually going on. After a plot is uncovered they must stop it.

In this Engle Matrix Game players pick a character to champion. Each turn they buy the right to make up what action happens next in the game. Action are not automatic. They pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a dice rolling contest. At first the players uncover(make up) clues that reveal what the evil plot is. One they've created their enemy they work together to save the world... or at least most do. Players can opt to be evil and try and bring the plot to fruition. Since different plots emerge each time the game never plays the same way twice.

Most of the characters are mentally ill but this doesn’t stop them from helping. They were probably saving the world from Lovecraftian monsters before being committed anyway.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 20x15 inch hard board map, character sheet booklet, rules booklet, scenario booklet, wooden counters, plastic gold coins, and 2 dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 13 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $40.00

34622.name: 1000 Vragen Quiz
34622.description: In this game you simply take cards from the pile and ask the question to your neighbour. A simple quiz game with 1000 questions. It is released by two publishers which both have made different questions. However some questions are based on knowledge for which you have to live in the Netherlands.

34623.name: Sherlock Holmes: The Hand of Moriarty
34623.description:
SHERLOCK HOLMES: THE HAND OF MORIARTY
Release date: May 2008

Sherlock Holmes has tracked Moriarty to a reception marking the opening of a museum of Egyptian Antiquities. He is surprised to meet Irene Adler there as well. The rest of the crowd are highly suspicious. That is when the museum’s benefactor is found murdered and a priceless necklace gone missing. The museum is sealed and Holmes is put on the case.

The Hand of Moriarty is a laminated folio game. It includes a 21x16 inch game map, and a separate set of laminated rules and example of play. The game does not include dice or tokens.

TYPE: Beginner Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 8
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: ½ hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High

34624.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
34624.description:
DR JEKYLL AND MR HYDE

Jekyll and Hyde are locked in a never ending struggle for control. It is not only the control of a real monster – Hyde – but also the hidden monster – Jekyll’s addiction to his drug. The players work to uncover Hyde’s wickedness while also exploring Jekyll’s irresistible urge to let Hyde out. It cannot end well.

This is an Engle Matrix Game so players champion one of the characters of Stevenson's original story. Each turn they pick a question from the game board and answer it. This advances the story but no action is automatic! Players pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a dice rolling contest. Bit by bit events add up to a unique story every time.

Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde is a boxed boardgame. It includes a 20x15 inch game map, a rules book and example of play, and action tokens and a die.

TYPE: Beginner Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 8
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: ½ hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $20.00

34625.name: Evil Wizard School: The Final Lesson
34625.description:
EVIL WIZARD SCHOOL

The old wizard is near death. Before he dies he will teach his final lesson, the lesson that shows his deepest magic. Whoever receives this lesson will be the next master. The player’s represent the students and faculty of the school. They will scheme and back stab to be the one who gets that lesson. Everyone wants it. This allows you to find out how far they will go to gain power.

Evil Wizard School is built on the idea that wizards are extremely jealous and treat their students like dung. They don’t teach them so they remain weak longer. It is loosely based on what it is like to be in graduate school.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 21x16 inch hard board map, character cards, laminated rules, wooden counters and plastic gold coins. It does not include dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High

34626.name: Sherlock Holmes: The Case of the Dead Duke
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 016: Down Time and Delay of Game
34626.description:
SHERLOCK HOLMES: THE CASE OF THE DEAD DUKE

Sherlock Holmes has been called in to find out who killed Duke Richard. The Duke was unloved by all and found poisoned in his study. The players make up the clues Holmes finds. Clues point to who did it. Players try to pin the murder on one another. Someone has to be guilty.

This is an Engle Matrix Game so players pick a character in the story to champion. Each turn they buy the right to make what action happens next (Like what clue Holmes finds...) Action are not automatic. They pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing big dice rolling contests. Bit by bit clues add up until one of he players is arrested. Since players never make up the same clues the game plays differently each time.

The Case of the Dead Duke plays out like an episode of the TV show “Law and Order”. First the players find clues then someone is put on trial.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 20x15 inch hard board map of London, character sheet booklet, rules booklet, scenario booklet, wooden counters, plastic gold coins and 2 dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $40.00

34629.name: Dead Man on Campus
34629.description:
From the publisher's website:

HP Lovecraft wrote about the reanimation of corpses when my Flapper Grandmother was doing the Charleston with the boy in the band (Grand Dad). In this intermediate level game you take Lovecraft’s start and make your own story. First you find clues that reveal what is going on. Once the plot is outed you make a choice. Am I good or evil? Good guys try to stop plots, evil ones help them succeed. You never know whose side anyone is on till the end game.

If you like Horror Board Games you’ll love this game!

July 2009

Dead Man on Campus is an Engle Matrix Game that allows you to do real time story telling in a boardgame. Each player champions one of the characters at Miskatonic University in 1923. The game host reads an opening hook about how bodies have gone missing from the graveyard. At this point the players take over telling the tale. Each turn a player buys the right to make the next action in the game. They make up a short scene and pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll and the player rolls. It either happens and is written down by the players or doesn't. If players like they can buy the right to make a counter-argument to the first players action. A dice rolling contest settles what happens. As you see the rules are very simple but they allow a completely unique game every time.

Players quickly learn how to play - it only takes a turn or two and then never need to look at the rules again. It does take creativity though. If you don't like making stuff up then this is not the game for you but if you do like quick paced back and forth creation then you'll love it.

The boxed board game comes with a hard back board that is color and varnished but I must say that these are hand crafted by the game maker so this is more an art product than a slick made in China game. The game uses wooden counters with stickers but as you wish they can be replaced by metal figures. Cthulhu figures work great!

34630.name: Räuberwald
34630.description: The pawn (the player who is courageous enough to cross the robber woods) walks slowly through the forest. When it reaches a field that matches a card that the player has coins are dealt as a reward. The player who has the most valuable coins at the end wins the game.

34631.description:
PARE LOS FACISTS (Stop the Facists) is a simulation on the critical battle also known as the Battle for the La Coruna Road that took place from Jan. 3 to 16th, 1937. In this particular phase of this Nationalist offensive (planned by the German advisers and their Blitzkrieg tech-nique) it was the first time the German Panzers met the Russian T26B tanks. Although their numbers were small both altered their doctrines because of them.

Game Scale:
Each Day Game Turn represents one day of real time.
Each map hexagon represents 500 yds from side to side.
Each unit counter represents a battalion or company.
Tank units represent 4-5 tanks, each air-craft is a squadron, each AT unit is a battery of 4 guns.
34631.name: Pare los Facists!!

34632.name: Delicio
34632.description:
Delicio, the yummy food game

Object of the game:
The first player to fill his or her plate with a balanced meal wins.

How to play:
Spread all the pieces of "food" out on the table, facedown, around the central board. Each player takes a "plate", which has 8 colored squares on it.

Roll the six-sided die to move around the circular central game board and stop on a colored square. Turn over a card corresponding to that color and place it on your plate.

Each colored space corresponds to a food group. Each food card is identified by a color next to the food.

Red: meat and other protein (e.g. beans)
Yellow: breads and cereals
Green: fruits and vegetables
Blue: dairy products

Plates have one red, one blue, two yellow, and three green squares.

34633.name: Førstehjelpsspillet
34633.description:
From the back of the box:
Førstehjelpsspillet er et familiespill som kan spillers med opptil 6 deltakere. Deltakerne skal på tur i Norge, underveis må de løse oppgaver og utføre førstehjelp for å komme videre mot målet. På turen støter de på både behagelige og ubehagelige overraskelser. Riktig besvart førstehjelpsoppgave belønnes med en bit av "Røde Kors-puslespillet" - når en deltaker har puslet et komplett rødt kors må vedkommende inn til vårt hovedkontor i Oslo for å vinne.
...Men det er selvsagt ikke så enkelt...

Th First-Aid Game is a family game for up to 6 players. The players are going on a trip in Norway. During the trip they have to solve tasks and perform first-aid to get to the target. The players will encounter both pleasant and unpleasant surprises. Correctly answered questions rewards you with a piece of the "Red Cross-puzzle." When a player collects all the pieces he or she need to get to our headquarters in Oslo to win.
...But that is of course not that easy...

The game is manufactured by Allservice AS. A company based in Stavanger, Norway that focus on work training
for unemployed and disabled persons.

34634.name: Ping Pong
34634.description: The idea of PING PONG is to find correct words in given categories as fast as possible and to drive away the time monster in the opposite direction. If the time monster eats the opposite caterpillar, you earn yourself a point. Each point pushes your own joker forwards on the score list.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Family/Adult Game 2nd Place
2008 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Gamer's Board Game Nominee
2008 Hra roku Nominee
2008 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2008 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters' Selection Nominee
2008 Spiel der Spiele Hit mit Freunden Recommended
2008 Spiel des Jahres Nominee
2008 Tric Trac Nominee
2009 Games Magazine Best New Family Strategy Game Winner
2009 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Gamers' Board Game Nominee
2009 Hra roku Nominee
2009 JoTa Best Artwork Audience Award
2009 JoTa Best Artwork Nominee
2009 JoTa Best Family Board Game Audience Award
2009 JoTa Best Family Board Game Critic Award
2009 JoTa Best Family Board Game Nominee
2009 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2009 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Nominee
2010 Ludoteca Ideale Official Selection
34635.description:
The "Stone Age" times were hard indeed. In their roles as hunters, collectors, farmers, and tool makers, our ancestors worked with their legs and backs straining against wooden plows in the stony earth. Of course, progress did not stop with the wooden plow. People always searched for better tools and more productive plants to make their work more effective.

In Stone Age, the players live in this time, just as our ancestors did. They collect wood, break stone and wash their gold from the river. They trade freely, expand their village and so achieve new levels of civilization. With a balance of luck and planning, the players compete for food in this pre-historic time.

Players use up to ten tribe members each in three phases. In the first phase, players place their men in regions of the board that they think will benefit them, including the hunt, the trading center, or the quarry. In the second phase, the starting player activates each of his staffed areas in whatever sequence he chooses, followed in turn by the other players. In the third phase, players must have enough food available to feed their populations, or they face losing resources or points.

Rules: http://www.zmangames.com/uploads/4/7/1/7/47170931/en-stone_a...
boardgameversion: German Second edition with SdJ mark
34635.name: Stone Age
boardgameexpansion: Schmuck und Handel (fan expansion for Stone Age)
boardgamepodcastepisode: AP Podcast – Episodio 15: Small World
BGTG 133 - 100 Great Games, part 2 (with Stephen Glenn and Mark Jackson)
BGWS 067 – Dicing for Resources
Boardcast News 4.3.2015 | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Carnagecast 38: Unity Games XIX
CnC Plays Ep 23 - Stone Age
DJ6: 3 jocs per iniciar-se i 3 per aprofundir
Ep 022 – Ringing in 2016 with Board Gaming!
Episode 11 - For Shame!
Episode 23 - Stone Age
Episode 44 – Reviewapalooza Gold West, Steam Works & Star Wars: Force and Destiny Beginner Game
Episode 6 - Stone Age vs Tzolk'in The Mayan Calendar

Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
Episode 73 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 2
La de pirata/zombie cojo, con pata de palo con Felipe IV de piedra y La Cosa
OBG 023: Train Games
Podcast EP06 – Board Game Arena
Show #24: Redux of our Top Ten Games Lists
Show #7: Stone Age and Home-Brewed Expansions
Strange Assembly 202 - Underrated Games
The Boardroom - Episode one!
The Game Pit: Episode 1 - Picking Over the Bones
The One Rated PG-13
The Spiel #56 - Spiel des Schpiel 2008
Top 10 Favorite Board Games of All Time
Wooden Cubes & Iron Soldiers: “Just the Two of Us” Episode 8
[Actus] N°42-A Ascension dans les Trains avec le Petit Prince, un Hobbit, un allemand en vert et un homme de l’Age de Pierre

34636.name: Krunch-A-Commie
34636.description: Quick, simple miniature rules for armor and infantry combat of the 1950's and 1960's.

34637.name: Bucket O' Muzzleblast
34637.description: Quick, simple miniature wargame rules covering the American revolution to the American Civil War.

34638.description:
Advanced Squad Leader System (ASL) compatible with focus on The Battle of the Bulge. The premiere issue of The Time on Target Newsletter of which there were three issues. Unlike the later two issues, this one did not come with any unit counters.

This issue comes with 12 scenarios printed on cardstock covering the fighting in the Ardennes from December 1944 to January 1945.

This is not a complete game, ownership of the ASL Rule Book, Beyond Valor, Yanks, Kampfgruppe Peiper, and boards 5, 11, 12, 16, 18, 19, 24, 32, 39, 41, e, f, and h are required to play the scenarios included.

Expands:

ASL, Beyond Valor, Yanks, Kampfgruppe Peiper I




Scenarios:
TOT 1: Take Ten!
TOT 2: First Attack
TOT 3: The Pride of Lions
TOT 4: Stoumont: The Break-In
TOT 5: Retrograde Out of Stoumont
TOT 6: Bastard Tanks & Shootin' Fools
TOT 7: Tiger 222
TOT 8: Nightmare
TOT 9 Beat Feet to Foy
TOT 10: Winter Wonderland
TOT 11: Bitter Reply
TOT 12: Hill 490
TOT tA: Sweep Along Skyline Drive
34638.name: Time on Target: The Battle of the Bulge – 50th Anniversary
boardgameexpansion: Kampfgruppe Peiper I: ASL Historical Module 2
boardgamefamily: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
34639.description:
ISLAND OF D : THE DUNGEON OF D
A FREE ONE player dungeon-crawling-fun card Game
No bookkeeping, NO DICE, just you, the cards, a token and a dungeon to explore!

1. INTRODUCTION
With the hero's success in destroying the Black Knight's plan in Dawn, it took longer for him to organise his minions. But the time has come at last, the Great War has begun! Backed up by a very strong Dark Magic, he commands a huge army of Greenskins including the fierce Goblorcs, unnatural Beasts, and now the Ice Monsters and even the Undeads have joined his army. The worst part is the Light Sword's new power -- the Black Knight now can heal his minions around him, including himself, in seconds!

Approaching from the west , in a very short time three castles have fallen to his hands, and his armies are swiftly heading to the capital of D. Once again everything seems hopeless and the King of D has called the 18 legendary heroes to gather in the Dungeon of D, deep in the Forest of D to the south, where legend says that centuries ago the Great Wizard of D hid the Amulet of D'eugor. It is believed that only the legendary Amulet of D'eugor can nullify the Light Sword’s power. Unfortunately, the Black Knight knew about this too, so he placed a very strong magical barrier on the entrance to keep anyone from entering.

Luckily, the King has also summoned Daryn and Derek. They can combine their magical abilities to open the barrier for a very short time, allowing just one person to enter the dungeon. But even with their combined power, they can only do this once every three hours. So, one by one the 18 heroes enter the dungeon, hoping to find the Amulet of D'eugor and survive to exit the dungeon. So far no one has returned… and you are hero number 18, the last person to enter the dungeon. Daryn looks into your eyes before you enter the crack in the barrier. "Please, you are our last hope…" You nod a little, then jump in….

2. THE MISSION
Get out of the dungeon alive as rich as you can. And if you are able to, bring the Amulet of D’eugor!!
34639.name: The Dungeon of D

34640.name: Schwerpunkt! Decline and Fall of the German Armour Weapon, East Front 1944-1945
34640.description:
Schwerpunkt! is a tactical game of combat on the East Front in the last two years of World War 2. Units are squad-sized, hexes represent about 100 meters across, and game turns are 60 to 120 seconds of real time. Six small scenarios are provided.

The rules are short and succinct, with no real surprises from the standard igo/ugo practice, with one exception ... players alternate, not in taking their full turns, but in initiating combat until all combat is completed, and then in moving until all eligible units have moved. This tends to slow the game down somewhat, but the benefit is the ability of the players to respond to threats in a more timely manner.

The components include four geomorphic map sheets, each 8.5"x11"; six pages of rules; and 166 uncut counters. The production quality is low as the game, as well as the magazine in which it came (more on that in a moment) is photocopied. Photocopied, remember, using 1977 technology.

The magazine is Volume 1 Number 1, and therefore Issue 1, of Combat!, the International Magazine of Conflict Simulations. It's published by Wellington Wargames, also known as Swedish Games Productions, the brainchild of Fredrik Malmberg, who is himself a bit of a prodigal. He began his wargame producing career in earnest when he was 14 years old (see his design 'Fight for Tobruk!') Only 200 copies of The Combat issue 1 were printed.

34641.name: Artiste
34641.description: With much finger skill all players try together to build a tower, as high as possible. The player who gets rid of his pawns first wins the game.

34642.name: Affengeil
34642.description:
Each player has five lives (bananas).

The first player rolls two dice and say a number. The highest number is always the first. For example: 4 and 5 is 54. The next throws are possible: 31 (lowest), 32, 41, 42, 43, 51, 52, 53, 54, 61, 62, 63, 64, 65, doubles 11, 22, 33, 44, 55, 66 and finally 21 (best throw). Whatever you say, the next player must throw a higher number than you said. You can bluff, and tell a smaller or a higher number. The next player must decide if he believes you or not. If you believe the number, you roll the dice again and gives a higher number. If you say that the player is bluffing, the bluffer must show the dice. If you're right loses the bluffer a banana. If the throw was right, you lose yourself a banana.
When a player said 21, the next player decides if he believes the throw or not. Believing does mean not to look the dice and you lose 1 banana. Are you saying that the thrower is bluffing, then check out the dice. The loser pays 2 bananas.

If during the game you shake the dice and you don’t like the throw, you can shake you again. You may not look that throw and you must give it blind to the other player; and you must say a higher number.
The player can also say "more than enough". If the dice shows a higher number, you can call a low throw. So the next player has the chance to say a higher number without looking at the dice. The poker cup goes quickly around the table, but it could be a bluff.

The winner is the player who’s left with one or more bananas.

34643.description: The idea of the game is to collect as many musicians as possible. All musicians and the director must have found their places in the orchestra. Each player counts how many musicians he has collected. The player with the biggest orchestra wins the game.
34643.name: Mit Pauken und Trompeten

34644.name: Tresorknacker
34644.description: The idea of the game is to guess the combination of the safe with as little tries as possible. After two rounds the winner is the player who cracked the code with the least guess tries.

34645.name: Schatzsuche
34645.description: In order to find hidden treasures in the palace, you must go through many rooms, which are full of strange articles trying to find those treasures. With good memory and some luck the treasures come into sight.

34646.name: Zahlenklau
34646.description: The games' idea is to catch as many number cards as possible. But beware: The number cards may be collected only in the correct order.

34647.description: The small dog gang is on a bone hunt. The player, who collected three bones with his dog first, wins the round.
34647.name: Wuffi komm heim!

34648.name: Froschkönig
34648.description: The player, who finds the most jewels, becomes new Frog King. Whoever watches well and can memorize much, has a good chance finish the game sitting on the kings' throne.

34649.name: The Fish Game
34649.description:
From the rules:

Five dice spotted 2 to 6, with a fish replacing the 1 spot. the fish on the one spot is a Black Crappie.
The object is to catch the most number of fish.

Players have three rolls of the dice. The player rolls all five dice on his or her first roll, trying to produce a 6. If on the first roll the player gets a 6, the player sets that die aside and scores any fish thrown as part of his or her catch. The player then rolls the remaining four dice two additional times, trying to increase his or her catch of fish.

Each turn is played the same. A player must get a 6 before scoring the catch of fish. If a player does not roll a 6 during his or her three rolls per turn, the player cannot score fish on that turn, and passes the dice.

The player catching the most fish after each player has had three turns, is the winner.

Contains: 5 green fish dice
instructions

34650.name: Mein erstes Rechenspiel: Wir rechnen von 1 bis 20
34650.description: With the number cards and the operational sign cards the player puts a math problem on the table and tries to solve it. If he counted correctly, he receives the math card and throws the die again, in order to push the pawn forward. Whoever reaches the treasure chest in this way first, wins.

34652.description:
When developing tensions break out into open conflict, all of America becomes a war zone as the Government and Rebels clash. The crisis is at hand, but armed conflict is only half the battle because modern wars are also fought on a ‘data’ front of public opinion.

CRISIS 2020 offers players fascinating choices between force and finesse – between striking power and subtlety, as they strive to raise new recruits while converting, neutralizing, and eliminating the opposition using cutting edge ‘Cyberwar’ concepts that are employed by armed forces and insurgents all over the world. And it is the preservation and use of political power, in the form of Crisis Cards, which can make or break an operation.

Should you consolidate regional governments to ensure local control? Call out the National Guard to defend a region and improve its ability as a recruiting ground? Send in an FBI Strike Force to deal with the rabble-rousers and cyber-punks? Suspend elections? Issue an Emergency Decree? Or seek Foreign Intervention from the U.N., South America, Canada, Mexico, or NATO?

Time scale: Each Game Turn equals 4 months
Unit scale: Military Divisions and Brigades

Game Components:

One 11" x 17" full color game map
One 8-page, illustrated, color rules book
One scenario listing / game setup sheet
Two player aid sheets
80 Crisis cards
120 full-color, mounted, two-sided die-cut game pieces




Reimplements:

Crisis: 2000




Buy Microbadge
34652.name: Crisis 2020
boardgamepodcastepisode: GrogCast Season 3, Episode Six-oh!

34653.description:
The game is afoot as you leave Holmes’ apartment at 221-B Baker Street and make your way through London and The Country to solve a mysterious case. Travel about by Train or Hansom Cab to visit locations like Scotland Yard, the West End, a Country Village, or return to Baker Street where interesting twists ensue.

Players will find clues, receive telegrams, don disguises, call the local constabulary, deal with inspectors, and name suspects in their pursuit to discover and arrest the villains who are hiding in other player’s card hands.

Are you a mastermind who can find a villain like Professor Moriarty, or will he manage to flee England and escape?

Time scale: Each game equals one case that is chock full of movement, locations, information, suspicion and action.
34653.name: I Say, Holmes!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Fourteen of The Gaming Gang

34654.name: Stop Light:The Amazing Magnetic Maze Game
34654.description:
Stop Light is the amazing magnetic maze game. Magnetic traffic lights change like magic at any of 100 intersections.

There are two ways to play. In the first a card is drawn and the first person to get their car to the location first wins that card. Another card is then drawn and play continues in this fashion until all 18 cards have been collected. The winner is the person with the most cards. The alternate way to play is the Cross Town game. The cards are not used in this one and the winner is first player to cross town by hitting the fewest red lights.

Magnets are placed in the plastic base according to the instructions and then the game board is placed on the base. As the players car moves on the board the magnet in the bubble in the car may flip from red to green depending on the magnetic action caused by the base.

boardgamehonor: 2008 UK Games Expo Best Abstract Game Winner
34655.description:
Up to 6 players try to create the biggest and worthiest flower carpet in this tactical tile laying game. They have 91 flower tiles at their disposal. There are multicolored joker tiles called "Serendips" that allow making more victory points. Playing those tiles and adding the ones of the own color as foresighted as possible is the key to victory.

The rules booklet contains the following languages: D–GB–F–NL–I
34655.name: Serendipity

34656.description:
Advanced Squad Leader System (ASL) compatible.

This scenario pack was designed for tournament play. It comes with 12 scenarios plus teaser scenario C (13 total) and a four page supplement with scenario design background. Some of these scenarios are reprints from old ASLUG publications that have been reworked and updated for this scenario pack.

This is not a complete game, ownership of the ASL Rule Book, as well as some of the ASL modules are required to play.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader




Scenarios:
KE 1: Lion's Share
KE 2: The Dreadnought of Rasyeinyia
KE 3: Disengagement Under Fire
KE 4: Panzers to the Rescue
KE 5: Beyond the Pakfronts
KE 6: Rock Steady
KE 7: Tennis, Anyone?
KE 8: Another Day Another Field
KE 9: Aces Over Eights
KE10: Angel's at the Airfield
KE11: Lt. Elmo's FIre
KE12: Sword Play
34656.name: March Madness '97: Tournament Scenario Pack

34657.description:
Dragon Pass Conventions for Perilous Encounters is a set of expansion rules for Perilous Encounters based on the armies of Dragon Pass. Rules included are:

1. Disorganization, Breakoff from Combat, Drilled Units, Pushbacks, and Interpenetration.
2. Morale.
3. Special Troops: Skirmishers, Drilled Troops, and Mobs.
4. Figure and Unit Costs.
34657.name: Dragon Pass Conventions for Perilous Encounters

34658.description:
Explore the magic of wordplay with Dora and her friends. Play your very first game of scrabble with Dora and her friends. Learn simple words in English and Spanish. Teaches word building and letter recognition. Two different games and two levels of play for both younger and older kids. Features double sided board, double sided cards and auto-corrective tiles.

This edition of Scrabble Junior has a two-sided board, one for English words and one for Spanish words. The rules play similarly to other editions of Scrabble Junior. The goal is to lay down letter tiles one at a time to complete words pre-printed on the board. Letter tiles are played twice per turn, and must be used from the beginning of each word and sequentially toward the end. All tiles are face up once held by a player. Kids learn the strategy of maximizing point values for themselves while preventing points for other players. They also learn its okay if other players do earn points because of the rules that a letter must be played if a space is available to play it on. Players use all the tiles available to cover all of the spaces on the board.
34658.name: Scrabble Junior: Dora the Explorer Edition

boardgamehonor: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Post-Napoleonic to Pre-World War 2 Era Board Wargame Nominee
2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Post-Napoleonic to Pre-World War 2 Era Board Wargame Winner
34659.description:
The game scales are Column-Brigade-Division, with monthly turns. There are Corps HQs for the Nationalists and Army HQs for the Republic. There are one 22" x 17"map, and two ½" counter sheets including Nationalist, Republicans, Italian, French, German, Portuguese and British units. The sequence of play is quite classic: Mutual Administrative Phase (Events, replacements, reinforcements, withdrawals), Nationalist Movement-Combat, Republican Movement-Combat, Victory/Attrition Phase. Supply is checked for both sides at the end of each turn.

The main trouble designing this game was how to simulate the first months of the war and the transition to a more conventional conflict during and after the battles for Madrid (October 1936-March 1937). The main unit during the firsts stages of the war was the "column" formed by a mix of police, army, paramilitary forces, volunteers, etc. The "column" tactics was used during the Moroccan wars, and consisted in separating a force in small independent groups, highly mobile but with few possibilities of supporting each other. These tactics were mostly used by the Nationalists, but also by the Republicans. For the Nationalists, it worked against the militias of the early months of the war but failed against a better organized, armed and commanded army during the battles for Madrid. To simulate this, most early Republican units have two steps: the first would be the "column" or "militia" side, the second the "Ejército Popular" (People’s Army) side. After passing a "Conversion" or "Militarization" phase, the Republican columns are flipped to their EP side. The "Militarization" , that began during the Fall of 1936, was the conversion of the politically enthusiastic but poorly led and trained militia in more orthodox military units. The Nationalist columns are divided between "Army of Africa" columns and the rest. Their colonial units are two-steppers and are withdrawn and substituted by brigades and divisions during 1937. The O.B. of the first months of the war is also a problem. Between July and November 1936 both sides formed dozens of small military and paramilitary units, called "battalions", "columns", "regiments", etc., etc. It is rare to find two authors that have the same OB, and the few that offer an Order of Battle are rather imprecise. Sometimes the same column receives different names. One author names it after their commander, other after their area of operations, and so on... so I had to compare and check which column was cited in most of the sources.
34659.name: The Spanish Civil War 1936-1939
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Twelve of The Gaming Gang

34660.name: AppLEOpoly
34660.description:
AppLEOpoly is a promotional game published by the Leo Burnett Company, Inc to give to their employees on their 54th anniversary. The game is basically a Monopoly clone but with a few differences. For example, the house rule of collecting money when landing on Free Parking is an actual rule in AppLEOpoly. (The space is called "Free Coffee.")

The name comes from Leo Burnett Company's tradition of leaving Apples at the reception desk for visitors. Consequentially, the "Go" space on the board is called "Reception Desk" and is illustrated with a bowl of Apples." Other squares are accounts that the company holds. The "Jail" square is called "Working Weekend."

34661.name: Greater Miamiopoly
34661.description: Greater Miamiopoly is a clone of Monopoly. The real estate squares are all advertisements for Miama businesses, sports teams, and media. This game used to be given away by the Miami Herald as a business present.

boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
34662.description:
From the manufacturer:

Players adopt puppies as they make their way around the board. Woof! Woof! Little kid game play includes barking the number of treats owed when landing on a space, “high pawing” other players, balancing treats on noses. This is a younger version of a property trading game where FUN is the rule and silliness is a must! Flip the deeds over and learn a fun fact about each breed and a puppy training tip too!

For ages 5 to 8.
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34662.name: Puppy-opoly

boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
34663.description:
From the manufacturer:

Players collect ponies as they make their way around the board and “TAP! TAP!’ with their imaginary hooves the number of treats owed when another player lands on their pony. Game play includes “High Hoofing” other players and collecting horseshoes. This is a younger version of a property trading game where it’s SNORTS AND GIGGLES until someone gets sent to the Stable! The deed for each pony contains fun facts about the breed and helpful pony tips too!

2 – 4 players, ages 5 – 8
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34663.name: Pony-opoly

34664.name: W.V.U.-opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34664.description:
From the manufacturer:

If you’re looking for outstanding academics, an active collegiate social life, big time college sports, all wrapped in a beautiful Appalachian setting, West Virginia University is the place for you. WVU is a top choice for scholars, researchers, and athletes. Located in the picturesque mountains of north-central West Virginia, the university is the state’s flagship land-grant college.

We visited Morgantown, West Virginia and asked students and alumni, “What makes this place so great?” We spent time lounging in the Lair, listening to stories about WVU legends, Rhodes scholars, athletic prowess, the best pizza in town, etc. We strolled around campus and watched the sun set on the Monongahela River. We even took a ride on the futuristic PRT. The result of all this intense research? A game so full of WVU, we could hardly get the lid on!

34665.name: Beaveropoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34665.description:
From the manufacturer:

GO BEAVERS!
Buy, sell, and trade Oregon State University! Memorial Union, Valley Library, the Trysting Tree, it’s all for sale as you play Beaver-opoly. You may soon be hanging out at The Beanery or who knows? You may become the newest Benny Beaver!

34666.name: Cowboyopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34666.description:
From the manufacturer:

RIDE’EM COWBOYS! EE-YAH!
Oklahoma State University is up for sale! You could be the proud new owner of Whitehurst Administration Building, Lewis Field, the Chi O Clock, or even Eskimo Joe’s! Whatever happens, it’s gonna be fun for alumni, students and friends of OSU. Who knows? You may soon be the newest member of the Cowboy Marching Band!

34667.name: N.Carolinaopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34667.description:
From the manufacturer:

If God isn't a Tarheel fan, why is the sky Carolina Blue?
Can’t get enough of UNC? We have a game for you! Ever dream of owning Dean Smith Center, Ram’s Head Rathskeller, Franklin Street, or The Old Well? They’re all for sale in Carolinaopoly, a game designed for alumni, students and friends of Carolina. Of course the box is Carolina Blue! It’s your roll! You may soon be the newest member of The Marching Tarheels…or you may be bumming quarters to do your laundry!

34668.name: N.C. Stateopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34668.description:
From the manufacturer:

Back the Pack!
Hey all you N.C. State fans! Ever dream of owning Reynolds Coliseum, Memorial Bell Tower, or Hillsborough Street? Here’s your chance! N.C. State is up for sale in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of N.C. State.

34669.name: Orangeopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34669.description:
From the manufacturer:

We're Orange Together!
Buy, sell and trade Syracuse University! The Quad, the Carrier Dome, Hendricks Chapel and University Avenue are all for up for sale. A game for all alumni, students and fans of Syracuse University!

34670.name: Sooneropoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34670.description:
From the manufacturer:

Boomer Sooner!
Owen Field could be yours for a mere $250! Or maybe you’d rather own North and South Ovals so you can double your rent. Buy, sell and trade University of Oklahoma properties in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of Oklahoma. Boomer Sooner…and own it all!

34671.name: South Carolinaopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
34671.description:
From the manufacturer:

Hey Let's Give a Cheer! Carolina is Here!
Can’t get enough of USC? Here’s the game for you! Buy, sell and trade University of Carolina properties such as The Horseshoe, Williams-Brice Stadium, Cock-a-Boose Railroad, and Carolina Mall. Choose your token and advance to Register and Proceed. Who knows? You may be the next Cocky!

34672.name: U.Dub.Opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34672.description:
From the manufacturer:

Real Dawgs Wear Purple!
Go Huskies! Woof! Woof! Frosh Pond, Harry, Suzzallo Library, and By George are up for sale in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of the University of Washington. Husky Stadium is a mere $270! Bargains like this won’t last long. Choose your token and advance to Register and Proceed. Who knows? You may soon be marching in the Husky Marching Band…or you may be sent home on Academic Probation!

34673.name: UVAopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34673.description:
From the manufacturer:

Wahoo!
O Hill, Beta Bridge and the Rotunda are up for sale! UVA OPOLY allows players to buy, sell and trade the University of Virginia. Did you ever dream of owning Mad Bowl, Edgar Allan Poe’s Room or 7 Society? Choose your token and advance to Register and Proceed. You may soon be hanging out on Rugby Road…or you may be sent home on Academic Probation!

34674.name: Volopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34674.description:
For the manufacturer:

GO VOLS!
Buy, sell and trade the University of Tennessee! Neyland Stadium, Andy Holt Tower, The Hill and Smokey are available at bargain basement prices! For a mere $110 you could become the newest member of the Pride of the Southland Marching Band! If things don’t go your way – you may be sent home on Academic Probation! VOLOPOLY is designed for alumni, students and fans of UT!

34675.name: Wazzuopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34675.description:
From the manufacturer:

Go Cougs!
Will you pay $250 for Martin Stadium? How about $150 for the Cougar Country Drive-in? If so, WAZZUOPOLY is the game for you! Other bargains include Butch, the Palouse, French Administration Building and The Coug. Buy, sell and trade Washington State University in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of WSU.

34676.name: Wisconsinopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
34676.description:
From the manufacturer:

On Wisconsin!
Bucky Badger is for sale for a mere $70! And Camp Randall Stadium for $250!
Buy, sell and trade the University of Wisconsin in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of Wisconsin. You could soon be marching in the UW Marching Band…or hanging out at the Kollege Klub.

34677.name: Räuber und Gendarm
34677.description:
Content:
4 robbers (wooden),
1 policeman,
die,
board

4 robbers heavily loaded with valuable treasures try to creep home through the forest. But the path to the robbers' cave is not easy to travel, because the gendarme are already following them. Will the robbers be able to bring their treasures home safely? Everyone tries to bring its robber with the accumulated valuable treasure to the hiding place first.

34678.name: Der Aktionär
34678.description:
Content:
100 share-cards
8 cash cards

The players try by skillful trading and exchanging to get as many shares of the company as possible.
The more shares you own, the higher is your total value.

34679.name: Nessy
34679.description:
Content:
board,
100 Nessy parts(head, belly, tail)
1 die,

In the course of the game everyone tries to let develop complete Nessys on the board. A Nessy consists of one head, 1 to 5 bulging out center sections and tail. If a player throws a color and has no more Nessy parts, the game is over. The highest number of completed Nessys determines the winner.

34680.name: Riese Grobian
34680.description:
Content:
board, 11 dwarves, 1 Giant, 7 bushes, 1 special die,

4 pairs of dwarves must try to safely get themselves into the cave on the mountain summit with their jewels before the giant Grobian has reached it. If at least 4 dwarves, one from each color, succeed in reaching the jewel cave, the dwarves beat the giant and win.

34681.description:
This is a game intended to teach children about dogs. The rulebook has a general information section on dogs, including what meaning of different behavior in dogs, what an angry/scared dog looks like, and how to teach children about dogs. Sometimes, the rules instruct the players to act dog like (barking, rolling etc.)

The game includes a board with an imaginary village printed on it, 4 playing pieces (dogs) on plastic bases, a deck of cards which represent 24 breeds of dog - some of which are "leaders" - and one 6-sided die. All of the dogs belong to families living in the village, identified by the first letter of a dog's name.

The game is subdivided into 6 different variants:

Game #1: 2-4 players, 10-15 minutes. This is described as a "warm-up" game, the board is not used. Players are "leader" dogs trying to gather their own pack by drawing cards blindly. The player with the most dogs after all non-leader breeds have been drawn wins.

This game also has a solitaire variant.

Game #2: 2-4 players, 30 minutes. Again, the players represent leaders trying to gather a pack. This is accomplished by visiting the 4 houses in the village to pick up dogs, then take them to the dog park.

This game has rule variants to make it a bit more challenging.

Game #3: 2-4 players, 20-30 minutes. Again, the players represent leaders, but this time they already have a pack. The players must return the dogs in their pack to the families, then find a way to their own house.

Game #4: 3 or more players, 10-20 minutes. This time the players must co-operate to gather a pack and take it to the dog park, playing against time (die rolls).

This game also has a solitaire variant.
Game #5: 2-4 players, 20-30 minutes. This is basically a version of the Game of Authors - players are trying to complete series of dogs belonging to the same family.

Game #6: Solitaire, variable playing time. The aim is to rescue dogs from the kennel by pairing up the kennel dogs with free dogs.
34681.name: Top Dog

34683.name: Saygo
34683.description:
Description from Uncles Games:

"Similar to Scrabble, players are creating word puzzles in a crossword fashion, only with Saygo, you do not have a community board. Instead, players builds their own word puzzles in front of them. Letters are worth points (vowels are worth 1 point, consonants 2 points, and super consonants J, K, Qu, X, and Z, are worth 4) the object of the game is to be the first player to reach 500 points. Every player randomly selects eight tiles and places them face down. Simultaneously, players turn them over and begin building the puzzles with as many letters from their individual pile as possible. Once someone has used up all eight tiles, he or she says "Saygo" and all players will select another tile. If nobody can use their tiles it is a stalemate, and everyone selects another tile. Should players find they can not use all of their tiles, they have the option of rearranging their puzzles as often as needed, in attempt to use all letters. The game continues until all tiles are used and the last person to use his/her last tile yells "done". Once the group verifies the accuracy of the winning player's words, the winner collects the remaining letters and adds them to his/her score. Once a player has 500 points (that number can be lowered or raised if desired), the round is finished and players can play again."

34684.name: Märchenland
34684.description:
This is a children's game based on the fairy-tales by the Brothers Grimm.

It comes with a colorful board, 36 story tiles, 4 player pawns and a six-sided die. The rulebook also contains the nine stories found in the game.

Players roll to move their pawns along the track, collecting sets of tiles.

From the box cover:

Märchenland - "Das Spiel mit 9 berühmten Märchen de Gebrüder Grimm"

And on the back of the box:

Die Spieledee
"Es war einmal ein Zauberwald. Dort machten sich lustige kleine Zwerge auf den Weg nach 9 Märchen der Gebrüder Grimm zu suchen. Seit vielen Jahren hält in dem Zauberwald eine Fee die Märchen in ihrem Bann.
Nun gilt es, diese 9 Märchen zu befreien. Manchmal auch mit Unterstützung des Zauberstables. Auf geht's ihr flinken Zwerge und huscht durch Zauberwald!"

34685.name: A Tour Through the British Colonies and Foreign Possessions
34685.description:
A Tour Through The British Colonies and Foreign Possessions is from an original hand coloured lithographic game published in about 1850 by John Betts of London. The game is a whistle-stop tour around the world from London via Africa, India, Japan, the West Indies, the United States of America, Canada, and finally, a race back to London. The first part of the journey includes the choice of two routes. The overland journey visits the city of Alexandria and the sea cruise calls in at Sierra Leone and the Cape.

With 36 stops along the route, the visitor participates in a remarkable, colonial experience of the world.

The game includes a box, mounted color map, reproduction rule book and catalog, The Historical Games Collection catalog, four re-created pawns lightly tipped in colors, and a six sided teetotum (spinner - dice were considered at the time as something used for gambling).

Game play involves spinning, moving your pawn the appropriate number of spaces, and then reading the educational paragraph about the colony or possession you have landed on.

The reproduction edition's rulebook notes: "These rules are copied directly from the originals and reflect the moral and social outlook of early 19th century imperialist peoples. The facts and attitudes are often wrong, intolerant and patronizing and should be read from a historical perspective."

34686.name: The Noble Game of Elephant and Castle or Travelling in Asia
34686.description:
The Noble Game of Elephant and Castle was first published in 1822 as a hand coloured engraving by William Darton of London.

The game is played on a magnificent board depicting an elephant surmounted by a howdah (ornate carriage) with an Indian mahout (driver). The mysteries of the Orient are discovered through a grand tour from the Frozen Ocean in the Arctic wastes of north Russia thence south through Asia into India, China, and Japan. The game was published at the height of the British Empire and outrageously describes the appearance, customs and culture of the region's peoples, comparing their way of life to that of the British.

The game comes in a box with a mounted full color reproduction board, reproduction rules, Catalog of The Historical Games Collection, four "travelers" (pawns) - each lightly tipped with a different color, 16 counters (chips, each with the rose face lightly colored to match pawns), and a teetotum (top with eight sides, numbered 1-8 - dice being items of gambling).

Each player spins and moves their pawn a number of spaces, attempting to progress to 25 by exact count. Each space has a description in the accompanying rule book to be read aloud, describing the scene from an area of Asia. The counters are used to mark off missed turns assigned by the descriptions.

The rules note: "These rules are copied directly form the originals and reflect the moral and social outlook of early 19th century imperialist peoples. The facts and attitudes are often wrong, intolerant and patronizing and should be read from a historical perspective."

34687.description:
From the publisher:

You asked for it (didn't you?), and now it's here (well, almost). Packing with forty professionally printed, and glaringly-glossy pages (including cover) and filled with World at War wisdom, the World at War: Gamer's Guide is on pre-order. You'll find a preview of the upcoming World at War boxed game, World at War: Blood and Bridges. Two new scenarios, Clearing Hell's Highway, and Poor Bloody Infantry. Two battle reports with semi-fictionalized accounts recounts of WaW scenarios (Some of you call these after action reports). A ten page article examining strategy in the World at War series and the specific tactics needed to win all six Eisenbach Gap scenarios. Even variants for night fighting, and a design your own scenarios "how to" article. And much more... including a unit-by-unit analysis of the platoons of Eisenbach Gap...

World at War has been a pleasant, if mild, surprise for Lock ‘n Load Publishing. I designed the game because I wanted to play it. Yes, in the back of my mind, I felt that there might be a market for something depicting the war that never happened, but primarily I created the game because it interests me.

In ten years of writing and designing, that’s the only thing I’ve found that works. I’ve designed and written on spec, and gave those pieces my best shot, but it seems that the games, the writing, that gets my juices flowing are the things other people also enjoy.

I absolutely love playing World at War. I like the combat system, am intrigued by the era, and fascinated by the idea of a series of games that link together to tell a story. So, I’m happy that other people enjoy it too.

I also hope that this guide enhances your enjoyment. We have strived to make a guide that is visually appealing, interesting, and diversified. Inside you’ll find articles on strategy, the percentages of rolling dice in World at War, battle reports (or after action reports as some of you prefer), and unit analysis. What you won’t find are dry as dust articles on the actual forces that lined the West German border or mind-numbing diatribes on Soviet Doctrine. Why? Because that stuff just doesn’t interest me.

There are lots of tables comparing the strength and weakness of an M1 Abrams platoon and a T-72 platoon in the World at War system. And we go through the platoons of Eisenbach Gap, unit-by-unit, and even provide a walk through for winning Blind Sided (a Death of the 1st Panzer scenario.)

All this in a beautifully laid out, two-color 40-page glossy magazine. Yeah, this one's printed. You can hold it in your hands.

Not a stand-alone game.

Expands:


World at War: Eisenbach Gap
World at War: Death of the 1st Panzer
34687.name: World at War: Gamer's Guide
boardgameexpansion: World at War: Death of the 1st Panzer

34688.name: Deep Sea-Opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
34688.description:
From the manufacturer:

Cast off on an excursion that’s fun from the time you leave the dock till you head back to shore! This is a game for those who REALLY reel in the big ones... or those who just dream big.

Buy your properties and then increase the value by adding bodies of water and big fish. As you play, turn over the deeds and learn interesting facts and helpful fishing tips too!

34689.name: Wackelturm
34689.description:
Wackelturm is a game of stacking wooden game pieces. There are yellow sticks and blue round pieces which can be stacked. The components to stack in a turn are decided by dice roll. You have to stack on top of previously placed items (by you and other players) so a tower emerges.
If the tower falls apart in your turn, you lose that round and get a red chip.
The first to have 3 red chips loses the game.

34690.description:
The players accompany the dragon Lung, the dwarven girl Schwefelfell (Sulfurskin), the human boy Ben and a young woman on their journey to the border of the sky - the last place of refuge for dragons.

Players contribute to defeat the evil dragon Nesselbrand (Nettle) in this tactical movement game. How much did you contribute at game end, when the bad dragon is defeated?
34690.name: Drachenreiter

34691.description:
Now five to six players jump in on the new adventures taking place on the island of Catan. The expansion includes new scenarios and opens up roads to even greater wealth or bitter poverty for up to six players.

Belongs to the Catan series.
34691.name: Catan: Traders & Barbarians – 5-6 Player Extension

34692.name: Dino Detektive
34692.description: Each player leads a paleontological excavation team, which consists of a researcher, a female assistant and a dog. Each team researches in different parts of a large excavation after different kinds of dinosaur skeletons. As soon as a researcher team excavated all parts of a dinosaur skeleton, it is exhibited in the museum. The player receives points of prestige, depending to on the size of the dinosaur.

34693.name: Animal 2x2
34693.description: This is a great game for toddlers that will help them learn shapes, animals, as well as colors. The object of the game is to match up three pairs of animals and place them into your rows in the ark. Each row has a different shape and color.

34694.name: Hoplites
34694.description:
A free web-published card game based on GMT's SPQR. Each player uses a deck composed of cards representing ancient military units (infantry, cavalry) and special commands (flank, rally). Cards are drawn from these decks and played on a board representing the battlefield. The board is divided into three zones, the center and two wings. Units on the field may move, missile fire and shock with the enemy.

The game features a variety of historical armies and commanders, as well as fantasy forces.

34695.name: Fortress
34695.description:
A set of rules which can be played on any map showing political subdivisions. The players take turns placing one piece at a time on the mapboard in order to capture territories. Pieces may not be placed into enemy held spaces, and a player may not have more than three pieces in a single space. The diceless combat system requires you to establish a larger force in spaces adjacent to those occupied by the enemy. The game continues until both players pass, at which time the victor is the player who controls the most spaces.

The game was inspired by the 1983 SSI computer game Fortress, which was played on a 6x6 grid and limited to 21 turns.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2008 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
34696.description:
6 dice are rolled and re-rolled, trying to get the correct colours to obtain dragon tiles from the display or to take them from other players. You can re-roll the dice several times but have to set at least one aside each time.
The dragons are initially at risk from capture by other players but on your next turn you can set them into your secure layout. At the end you score points for having dragons of one colour or different dragons but with the same background landscape.

Part of the Schmidt Spiele Easy Play line.
34696.name: Drachen Wurf
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 110 - All About the Easy Play games (with David Arnott)
The Spiel #143 - Come On Down!

34697.name: Africa Raid
34697.description:
Learn the geography and customs of the people in this African adventure by all-terrain vehicle, crossing the different landscapes of the continent and living the most unexpected dangers.

It exalts the competitive spirit and capacity of planning to raise every race.

34698.description: In the spring time as the sun rises and toads go on a journey, traffic becomes dangerous for them. In this game the toads walk on the motorway. We must save them with the help of the mole. There are tunnels under the motorway. If we are able to get all of the toads into a tunnel we win.
34698.name: Der Maulwurf hilft!

34700.name: Warum ist die Banane krumm?
34700.description: 165 cards are mixed. The left neighbour always asks the question. On each card side a question is printed with three wrong answers. That is the joke of the thing, and this means for the players: listen exactly and watch out! With every correct answer there is a banana as reward. If an ape on the board is completely equipped with 6 bananas, the player who has that ape wins.

34701.description:
Thor is a revised version of Wildlife Safari (also known as Loco, Flinke Pinke, and Quandary). As in those versions, there are a number of "stocks" (here, God cards) each with a limited number of identical shares, and players are dealt cards which change the values of specific stocks. On a turn a player plays a value card (with only the last one played counting for each stock) and takes a stock, with a round ending when all the values have been played for a single stock. A number of rounds are played and scores totaled.

Thor differs from the other versions of the game in two respects: it accommodates up to 6 players (by adding an additional stock), and it includes a set of 14 action cards which can be used to affect play.
34701.name: Thor

34702.name: Bedrijvenspel
34702.description:
Monopoly-like game with versions of different cities.

Players roll two dice. A red die and a white one. Players roll and move their pawns along the local different companies in a city. When a player lands on a company, he/she has to buy the property or pay the owner rent. If a player has a set of companies of the same color the rent rises.
Each turn a player has to take a card based on the roll of the red die. The game ends when one player owns all property.

34703.name: Croky showspel
34703.description:
A free promotional game from the chips brand Croky, combining roll-and-move with memory.

Each player plays a different parrot (that stands for one the the tastes).

Publisher nor year is indicated. However if I recall correctly, this game stems from the mid 1980s.

34704.name: Tikkertje
34704.description:
Simple Roll-and-Move childrens game based on the Sesame Street series.
Players attempt to 'tik' (ie tick/touch) the character/color indicated by the drawn card.

34705.name: Sports Dice: Basketball
34705.description:
Small travel basketball game. 3 standard dice (1 white "shooting" die, 2 blue defensive dice), and 2 red offensive dice with roman numerals 2-7. 1 red pawn to mark ball position. 1 dry erase marker to keep score on "board", 1 plastic coated card with image of basketball court.

Rolls of the dice determine court position, turnovers, blocked shots, rebounding, steals, fouls, and scoring.

34706.name: Goodbye....
34706.description:
In this game, players race to move four pawns from their starting positions around the board into their "Home Country." Basic gameplay resembles Pachisi or Sorry!, but there are a couple of twists. First of all, movement is controlled by a deck of standard playing cards (with some extra Aces and Kings) -- most cards move a pawn forward by their face value, but some have special powers (get a pawn out of the starting area, move multiple pawns, trade places, move backwards, etc.). Additionally, while the game can be played as a free-for-all, it is also possible for players to split into partnerships and aid their partners in the race to victory.

The game is subtitled "An International Card Game," featuring rules in eight different languages and decorating its board with the flags of many of the countries where it can be played.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
34707.description:
The Hanging Gardens were one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, but did they actually exist? Nothing remains of the reported splendor of the Gardens, which were built for the eyes of Queen Amyitis.

In The Hanging Gardens, players are landscape architects who attempt to reestablish the beauty and splendor of the original Hanging Gardens. Since there is no exact reference to follow, players create designs according to their own tastes.

During the game, players acquire building cards, which they place in their play areas. Card follows card with magnificent buildings, sparkling fountains, and exotic plants, as the players work to rebuild the legendary Gardens. At game end, the Queen will reward the victory palm to the player whose work on the Gardens most impresses Her Highness.
34707.name: The Hanging Gardens
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Charlie - 2016 Retrospective
The Good, The Board and the Classics: Episode 47 “Classic Games”
The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide

34708.name: World Passport
34708.description:
(Taken from the publisher's site):

The purpose of the game is to place the six pieces of the puzzle on the card so that a continuous path is formed by the clear parts from the starting point to the final point.

Each challenge contains a country map with 5 pieces of information about the country:

Country's flag
Country's currency
A general trivia fact about the country
Capital city
A famous landmark

34709.name: "Stonewall" Jackson's Shenandoah Valley Campaign
34709.description:
This game book consists of a set of divisional level miniature wargame rules and a highly political campaign system. The players all play on the Union side, in the positions of Banks and his divisional commanders.

The campaign system is designed to generate battles, either by player initiative or automated Southern attacks. The players choose each turn to train their troops, administer conquered areas, indulge in 'politicking' in Washington, write or execute orders, request reinforcements or send them to McLellan's army in the Peninsula. If no Union forces contact the Confederate forces, the latter will make contact.

The miniature combat rules are aimed to portray small battles 2-6 brigades on each side) in a short game. They emphasize terrain, reserves, command ability and troop quality.

It includes:
The Gamebook
A campaign map of the Shenandoah Valley
Campaign game unit counters
Campaign game money
Campaign game tables

34710.name: Battle of the Pyramids
34710.description:
(Description taken from their homepage):

The pyramids of Egypt are among the most enduring and mysterious symbols of the ancient Egyptian civilization. The pyramids are considered to be one of the seven wonders of the world. The leaders of this ancient time-the pharaohs were clever strategists who would use all manner of tactics to ensure that their dynasties remained in power.
Two powerful symbols of ancient Egypt; the pyramid and the scarab are combined to create a unique game that will challenge you to think like the pharaohs.
“Battle of the Pyramids” is a strategic game for two players that combine the principles of planning, strategic thinking, memory and surprise.
Not for the faint hearted Battle of the Pyramids challenges you to be the first to have your pyramids reach the other-side unscathed. Conceal the scarabs within your pyramids to impede your opponent’s assault. Plan your strategy and attempt to get your opponent to reveal their pyramids hidden secrets.

Contents:
Game board
18 pyramid pieces (Each made of two pieces)
4 Scarabs
Game rules: English, French, Spanish, Russian, Hebrew and Arabic

34711.name: Voidstriker Ship Recognition Guide #1
34711.description:
Ship descriptions and record sheets, plus campaign rules for Voidstriker.

The Voidstriker Ship Recognition Guide #1 details 16 ships from the Terran Defense Force, the Martian Republican Guard, and the Jovian Alliance Navy. In addition, record sheets are included for all the sample ships in the Voidstriker rulebook, and a simple set of campaign rules allows you to take your place among the stars. By force, if necessary...

Expands:

Voidstriker

34712.name: Elementalis: Chaotica and Cultists
34712.description:
Something has gone horribly wrong. The Great Elemental War has been raging on for over 100 years. The Flux is in tatters, and the Creationists can barely keep it together. As the 5 Elementals sects continue to wage their war, an unholy power has slowly been breaking down it's cage.

The Harmonists and Elitists combined research of their perverse magic has lead to a terrifying discovery. Directly tapping the power of Chaos, they have gained tremendous power. What they didn't realize is that the more they exploited this power, the easier it had becoming for the Gods of Chaotica and their cultists to escape their long forgotten prisons.

The Chaos has been unleashed. The very existence of mankind is now in danger. Can these ancient Gods be stopped, or is their power too much to overcome?

Chaotica and Cultists is a free expansion for Elementalis. This expansion allows the game to handle up to 5 players with two new Mage types to diversify game play.

The Chaotica harness the powers of Chaos to choose a new Major Arcana every turn, while their blind followers, the Cultists, can reroll the Sun die once each roll.

34713.description:
An LPS bonus mini-game for two-players simulating the fighting around El Alamein station from 1 July to 27 July 1942. Each turn represents three days of combat, and each hex is about four miles across.
Low density counter mix, ratio combat results table, supply, leaders, weather, air support, recon screening units, minefields and a special 88 Flak unit make for an interesting mix of mechanics.
34713.name: Desert Duel: First Alamein

34714.name: Hat Stackers Party
34714.description:
From publishers website:

"You are invited to the party! This memory-matching game will engage children with a charming array of colorful and crazy hats. Pick a pair, build a stack and win the game! Hat Stackers Party includes 11 X 17" double-sided folding magnetic game board, 40 chunky foam magnet game pieces, and full-color illustrated instruction booklet with easy-to-follow rules."

34715.name: Syl-la-bles
34715.description: Syl-la-blesis the game that encourages you to think big. Choose a bigger word to get more points, but spell it right or you score zero! "Thesaurus" and "Spelling Bee" cards test your vocabulary and spelling skills. This is a unique game for playing with varied ages, because you set your own point goals--for individuals or the group--before you start the game. Tested by the Canadian Toy Testing Council and recipient of the 2007 Seal of Approval from The National Parenting Center.

34716.name: Play on Words
34716.description: "Be quick because each player only has one minute to “play on words” and win the challenge! Set the timer and, before it sounds, write as many connecting words as possible using only the letters on the eight cubes shown. The more words “played on” and the more letters used, the higher the score. Challenge friends or yourself with the solitaire version. Play On Words includes a built-in electronic timer. "

34717.name: Poker face
34717.description:
24 cards are distributed evenly to all fellow players.
The player with the “start” - card puts these on the table and begins the round, by pulling a card of any fellow player. Afterwards this Turn player is now to pull with a fellow player etc.
If he pulls a point card, he puts it wordless to its other cards. He must show an action card and had to fulfill it immediately. As soon as a player pulls the “stop” - card, the round is terminated, and everyone recounts the points, which he holds straight on the hand.

34718.name: Mighty Landlord
34718.description:
(Translated from the Japanese rulebook)
In this game, the players are owners of inns, and the goal is to get as many staying guests, earning the most money in a set period of time.
But it's not easy preparing rooms for all those people who have come to the festival in town. Among the normal guests like travelers and merchants, there is the King, the General and even assassins and Demon Lord! It's a chaotic mix of everything.
Each guest has their own condition for staying the night and paying the room. Some are content if you serve them tasty food, some look only for good service and some are looking for a good fight…
If you can't please the guest, not only will you not get paid, but you have to pay instead, so you'll have to be careful which guests you accommodate. You can push dangerous guests to your neighbour's door, but if you're not careful, you might get one yourself!
The character the players play all have different areas they are good at and bad at. And they, too, are former adventurers, so they have individual skills to attract or deter guests. The one who uses these skills the best, gets the most content customers and earns the most money during the festival will be declared the winner.

34719.description:
(Translated from the Japanese rule book)
In this game, players cooperate in order to defeat huge monsters. All damage dealt to the monster is directly converted into Victory Points, and the one with the most VPs when the third monster is defeated, is declared the winner.
But it is not an easy task to deal damage to these huge creatures. If you're too far away, you can't deal any damage at all. In order to deal damage, and earn points, you need to get close to the monster, and run the risk of taking damage yourself.
And dealing damage isn't the only thing you must be careful about. The other players are aiming at your back. They might try to push you to the front line. If you're pushed to the front, and the monster gets you, all your points are halved!
Seeing to that the leading player gets nicely defeated, and still having cards left to deal some damage to the monster, will make you the winner.
34719.name: Chicken Warriors

34720.description:
(Translated from the Japanese rulebook):
The goal of this game is to collect the most money for your marriage. But it's not just any money. It's the treasure of the dragon that you (think you) defeated.
As the players enter the dragon's lair and start collecting treasure, the dragon will eventually awaken. The players must then run away from the maddened dragon, while holding onto as much treasure as they can. But if they have a lot of treasure, they'll be slowed down. If the dragon gets them, not only will they get hurt, but they'll also drop the treasures, one after the other! So stack you items carefully, equip and re-equip, trip the other player's legs as much as you can and run for your life.
The player who gets out with the most treasure is declared the winner
34720.name: Chicken Run: Chicken Warriors 2

34721.name: Emanations
34721.description:
Link your stones to gain points.
The object of the game is to gain the most points by forming links between your stones. Players take turns placing a stone. If the stone can be linked to any other friendly stone(s) in one of the eight directions (north, south, east, west, northeast, northwest, southeast, southwest), then a line of friendly pebbles is placed on all spaces along the paths connecting the stones. A connection cannot be made if an enemy stone lies along the path to the friendly stone.

The score corresponds to the number of pebbles owned by each player. The game ends when there are no remaining moves. The player with the most pebbles wins.

34722.name: Gwiazdy Okej!
34722.description:
You don't have to wait till the stars are right! If you want to summon your favorite Mythos creature, make the stars OK yourself!

The players first create their own star diagram on the piece of paper and then play various cards to recreate it on the board.

Good clean fun for the whole Whateley family.

34723.name: Des Kaisers neue Kleider
34723.description: The emperor and its royal household walk proudly in the palace garden. Everyone made the cunning weavers manufacture a marvelous dress for him. By great fear to be considered as too stupid neither the emperor nor its officials dare to throw a view on their shade. There they can recognize that they are naked in reality. Fortunately a small boy, who sits in a tree in the palace garden, and the players don't let themselves deceive by the stupid trick of the weavers. Gradually the boy and the players hold the naked image before the faces of the vain emperor and its attendants. A little to search they must thereby, and the cunning weavers try likewise to donate confusion. Who finds three of the twelve naked images first, exposed the treacherous weavers and wins the game.

34724.name: Cribble
34724.description:
A fascinating game of skill and chance playing two of everyone's favorite card games-cribbage and poker. Where the players decide whether to play out their hand as a cribbage game or slip into high stakes poker.

The object of the game is collect the most chips in a variety of ways. By means of green Cribble cards. By strategic use of the Blue Cribble cards. By avoiding penalty cards and red pegs holes. By pegging around the Cribble track to be the first to reach the last hole and collect the Cribbage pot. And by call Cribble to play high-stakes poker for individual poker pots.

34725.name: Reader's Digest National Word Power Challenge
34725.description:
The box that I received is "Set 1" in the official card game series. It contains three decks of 64 cards each: Over the Rainbow, Speaking Out, and Lost in Space.

Each deck is a themed game of Go Fish containing 16 sets of 4 cards each. However, the cards contain advanced vocabulary words from Reader's Digest Word Power columns. The four facets of each card are: Definition and Part of Speech, Word Origin, Synonyms, Fill in the Blank, the latter of which is an example sentence in which a blank indicates where the word would go.

On your turn, you ask for a card whose [insert facet] is [insert facet's description], e.g. "I would like a card whose synonyms are abandon, abdicate, discard, throw away." If the player has a "Jettison" card, he gives it up. The rest of the rules are Go Fish.

The box includes a supplementary color guide with pictures and further explanations for each word.
