34726.name: Salvanèl (flight from the enchanted wood)
34726.description:
Who is the Salvanèl?
The Salvanèl is a goblin that frequently appears in the legends of Trentino, in northern Italy. Until not many decades ago, in every valley you could find someone who said they had seen the Salvanèl, even though actually encountering him was extremely unlikely.
They described him as a small man, boyish-looking, and always with some red feature on him: a hat, clothes or hair.

This time the Salvanèl, running to and fro, has left his magical tracks everywhere. Anyone who treads on them by mistake is bound to get lost - and after much wandering, finds himself back where he started. Now you are lost in the wood too!
To get back home you must make three good moves to reconstruct a path that will take you out of the wood. But the goblin will also help you, if you meet him!

At the beginning of every turn, the guide picks a colored card. This card has two effects:
1-The Salvanèl immediately moves toward the border indicated by the card, and if he meets a player... He immediately gains an extra turn!
2-The player indicated by the card plays his turn... And if he meets the Salvanèl... He plays again!

In every turn, players can use one of these moves:
1-Spin:choose a tile and rotate it in any direction you like
2-Puff of Wind: move one or more tiles of a horizontal or vertical line
3-Jump: move your token from the tile where it is to another one next to it.

The first player who jumps out of any tile on the side of his colour wins!

34727.description:
This game covers the Battle for Berlin, and is designed by the same game designer of The Battle for Iwo Jima. The game includes one A2-sized map of Berlin, divided into areas in a manner similar to Storm over Arnhem, as well as one A3-sized reproduction of the map. This is similar in nature to the one featured at the back of the rulebook in Storm over Arnhem, and presumably to be used for the same purpose. The game also includes 81 counters.

This game was designed by Works-Zero (www.works-zero.com).
34727.name: Street Fighting in Berlin

34729.description:
This game covers Genghis Khan's invasion of Central Asia against the Khwarazm (Khorezm) Empire from 1219-1221. It appears to be a strategic-level game, unlike the accompanying Temujin's Battles.

The game includes 1 A2-sized map with 81 counters.

This game was designed by Works-Zero (www.works-zero.com).
34729.name: The Story of Genghis' Conquest of the West

34730.description:
Tactical-level game with three scenarios, each with a map.

The game includes 3 different A3-sized maps and 116 counters.

This game was designed by Works-Zero.
34730.name: Temujin's Battles

34731.name: Schnarchkonzert
34731.description: Each player tries to eat full with cards of food points so that it can oversleep the winter in its hiding place. Who gets over the “winter sleep” without starving first, wins.

34732.name: FNG: Unconventional Warfare
34732.description:
It's the world of the Vietnam War seen through different eyes, the eyes of the men of special units that fought a different kind of war. They conducted unorthodox operations, such as reconnaissance, sabotage, prisoner snatches, rescue of downed airmen, ambushing the enemy, and in many cases out guerrilla-ing the guerrillas.

These missions were almost always carried out on the enemy's home turf, with the odds stacked against the interlopers. FNG: Unconventional Warfare is all about these men and the deadly missions they went on.

FNG: Unconventional Warfare (UW for short) UW introduces the "tactical role-playing" side of FNG. UW blends the traditional role playing game with a fast and easy combat system designed for a more personal level. Combining these two aspects allows players to enjoy the cinematic aspect of role-playing while keeping the excitement of a miniatures wargame.

UW has a unique campaign system that generates your Missions and links them together in a simple yet realistic way. UW also features a character advancement system that allows you to "personalize" your troops.

And like all Two Hour Wargames rules they're designed to be played with any figures you already have and in any scale! Play solo, play on the same side, or play head-to-head it�s up to you! So pull out those favorite figures, pop in your favorite 60's CD, and remember... JUST PLAY THE GAME!

34733.description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"RftE attempts to simulate the conflict between rebels revolting and attempting to take control of their nation from a foreign power. In this fantasy banana republic the nation of Britain has held control for the past 115 years. Now the rebels have started to advance from the north towards the major hub of Port Hanley."

This small format game is played on a narrow L-shaped map. Victory goes to the player who controls most of the seven cities on the board after twenty turns. The British units include Royal Marines, Light Infantry, Challenger tanks, and Puma helicopters.
34733.name: Rebels from the Empire

34734.description:
Content:
48 picture cards

As time runs all players try to fit cards in their hands at the same time. It is important to catch the cards as fast as lightning. The winner is the player with the most caught cards.
34734.name: Grabsch

34735.name: Spion im Werk: Das Opel-Spiel
34735.description:
Spion im Werk or Spy in the facory was produced by Adam Opel AG in order to encourage the employees to communicate more with each other. The Goal of the game is to catch a spy, that has sneaked off into the Opel factory in Rüsselsheim, Germany. There are two teams: One plays the spy and the others play a team trying to catch the spy, but the spy has some sneaky skills to avoid being caught by the other team, If he succeeds in stealling a specific amount of secret files from the factory, the spy wins.

The game mechanic is a mixture of roll & move and answering questions.

34736.name: NC-Backgammon
34736.description:
This unique variation on Backgammon called Zarsiz Tavlar in Turkish has no luck to it. It uses a unique system of players alternating turns picking one die facing, and their opponent picking the second, in order to determine moves. The end result is a player is left with a die facing they picked, and the other their opponent picked. Players are allowed to use the die they picked twice, as a roll, several times during the game to act as a rolling doubles.

Full Information on the game can be obtained here:
http://zarsiztavla.gop.edu.tr/index-e.htm

The rules are under how to play.

34737.name: Platz da!
34737.description: Each of the two or 4 players chooses a color and puts his 5 pawns on the start fields of the same color. The point is to bring the own pawns across the board to the opposite finish fields. The player who is there with his 5 pawns wins the game.

34738.name: Quizkoenig
34738.description: A quiz-game from the fifties - the player gets the question card. Either the player who is asked, the questioning player or the referee can answer it.

34739.description:
Pay attention to your own moves - as well as to the move of your co-players. Because only the player who is able to make an error free move at last can win.
The difficulty consists of the fact that no pawn of the same color may stand left, right, above, down or diagonally beside the set cone.
34739.name: Auf Nummer sicher

34740.name: ab, durch die mitte!
34740.description: Ab, durch die Mitte is an easily understandable tactics game for 2 or 4 people, where the point is, to be the first to have their pawns disappear through the hole in the center of the game box.

34742.name: Ich Fahr' Fair
34742.description:
A trivia game based on the traffic safety campaign "Ich Fahr' Fair" (roughly: "I drive considerately"). Players earn puzzle pieces by answering multiple-choice, traffic trivia questions in six categories. Correct answers allow a player to roll again and continue their turn.

Contents; Game board, 6 wooden car pawns, question cards with answers, 6 puzzles with 6 pieces, rules and a dice.
Note; the game is only available in a German language version.

34743.name: Tic Tac Know Bible Game
34743.description:
Basic Tic-Tac-Toe only you must correctly answer a Bible trivia question--which category (out of nine choices) is listed on a movable/variable chart under the tic-tac-toe board--for the space you want to occupy.

Clever board/component setup makes it a convenient game to play.

34744.description:
Love playing the classic mystery-solving game but don't have time to play the original version? This express edition delivers a burst of fun in 20 minutes! Roll the dice, then make a suggestion. Peek at cards or the case file for extra clues. Includes rules for two ways to play, anytime, anywhere!

Part of the Hasbro Express Line.
34744.name: Clue Express

34745.description:
COMPONENTS
20 Ship tiles (4 aircraft carriers, 4 submarines, 4 destroyers, 4 battleships, 4 patrol boats)
8 attack dice

Battleship Express comes with two different games: The Captain’s Game and The Admiral’s Game. The Captain's Game ignore the ships powers on the cards.

Each player receives 5 ship tiles, one of each ship: Battleship, Destroyer, Aircraft Carrier, Submarine, Patrol Boat. Each player places them in front of them in any order to make up their fleet.

On a player's turn they choose one of the ships in their Fleet to attack with and move it to the front of their line. Next the player chooses a ship of an opposing player to attack. The attacking player can only choose one of the first 2 ships in the line to attack. The attacking ship tile shows how many dice to roll. Roll that number of dice and check for hits. Each of the 8 dice is the same. 5 of the sides match the colors of the 5 ships, and the sixth side is a “burst” or “wild”. IF the player does not sink it, the dice are passed to the next player.

Set aside any hits and then re-roll based on the attacking ship’s powers. Once the number of hits equals or exceeds the defense number on the ship that's defending, it is sunk removed from play and the attacking player gets a point. The first player to an agreed number of set points wins. Here’s a breakdown of the individual ship powers:


Battleship: Declare target. Roll all 8 dice a total of 4 times. Bursts do not count as hits.
Destroyer: Declare target. Roll 6 dice a total of 2 times. Bursts count as 2 hits.
Aircraft Carrier: Roll 6 dice THEN declare your target, then roll 1 more time. Bursts count as 1 hit. The Aircraft Carrier can also attack from anywhere in your line, so you don’t have to move it to the front where it is vulnerable.
Submarine: Roll 3 dice a total of one time. A single Burst will sink whatever you are attacking. Submarines can attack any ship at any place in a Fleet.
Patrol Boat: Roll 5 dice a total of 3 times. Bursts count as 1 hit.


Part of the Hasbro Express Line.
34745.name: Battleship Express

boardgamehonor: 2009 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine Game Nominee
34747.description:
Following France’s glorious victory against the combined Austro-Russian armies at Austerlitz the previous December, the Prussians have finally come off the fence and declared war against Napoleon. As both sides maneuver, uncertain of the location or center of gravity of the opposing army, they met in a dramatic double battle on the fields of both Jena and Auerstadt.

Can the heirs of Frederick the Great maintain their composure and cohesion long enough to teach the haughty French a lesson, or will Napoleon and his Marshals ride on to ever greater glory?

With only modest complexity and a focused scope employing low unit density on the map (20 pieces or less) and dramatic, fast playing turns, it is the addition of ‘story-driven’ random event cards and night game turns providing the operational pauses and “friction of war” that gives players a great feel for the parry-and-thrust of a Napoleonic campaign as the armies close for battle. Scale: Each unit is 1 corps, each hex is about 1000 meters, and each turn is roughly 3.5 day hours (or 10 night hours).

Game Components:
• One 8-page, color instructions booklet, with Standard and Optional rules included
• 1-page sheet of Exclusive rules
• 40 color, die-cut 5/8” mounted game pieces
• 12 random event cards
• One 11” x 17” color game map
• One 8.5” x 11” color player aid sheet
34747.name: Jena 20

34748.name: Audacity!
34748.description:
Appeared in the August 1991 issue of Games magazine, page 50.

This two player strategy game is based on trying to cross the board with your pieces to get into a goal area, removing it. The first player to get 3 of his pieces into the goal wins.

The unusual mechanic to this game is that you can move any piece on your turn, yours or your opponent's, any unblocked distance on a line. If you move your pieces, the end space must have a different number of adjacent pieces from the space where it started, while if you move an opposing piece, it must end adjacent to the same number of pieces.

34749.name: War in the Gulf
34749.description:
A simple board game, similar to Sorry! or Parchisi. Movement takes place with a roll of the dice.
The game comes in two phases. First, players progress through "Desert Shield", in which they collect cards that can later be used to defeat threats. Second, they move to "Desert Storm", in which they use their cards to overcome obstacles on the board. When a player reaches the middle of the board, they have won the game and liberated Kuwait.
If you encounter an obstacle that there is no card for, then you must restart Desert Storm. If this happens three times in a row, then Desert Shield must be repeated as well. There are also locations on the board that will send you back to the start.

34750.description:
Dresda is a ‘fast-play’ fantasy battle skirmish system designed for small numbers of troops yet involving more than a little role-playing on the part of the players. Indeed, unlike many conventional wargames with little or no ‘role-playing’ element, in Dresda you are your units' Commander in the field, and you not only have the responsibility of commanding the unit in battle, but also the headaches of paying your troops, buying their equipment and generally trying to improve your (and their) financial position.

Dresda is a scenario driven game, not points based one. This means that careful thought needs to be given to the designing of scenarios by the GM. So, although you can line up your troops on opposite sides of the table and simply advance until you bump into each other in the centre, you'll find this isn't really much fun, and you'll quickly find that your games will be much more enjoyable if you (and/or a good GM) put some effort into designing an interesting or challenging scenario.

Of course, it also helps to create a feeling of unit continuity by treating your unit as a group of individuals rather than disposable 'cannon (or halberd)-fodder'. Name each of them, decide what they like to eat, drink and how they feel about their Mum, and suddenly you can see them as characters in a role-playing game, not just as troops in a ‘one-off’ wargame.

Over a number of games you'll see your unit develop, watch their fortunes wax and wane and individual characters come and go. Eventually you'll find that some of these factors will start to dictate your actions on the battlefield, for instance you may see ‘heroic’ traits develop in one character or cowardly traits in another as the miniatures begin to become characters in their own right, and not just anonymous lumps of painted white metal.

The Aim of the Game

The basic aim of Dresda is to raise a small unit of fighters, fight battles and get rich!

Unfortunately, whilst this basic aim is simple, it isn't necessarily easy. What's more, this is likely to be a more 'hands-on' experience than you may be used to, even in skirmish wargaming. That's because you, the Player, will take on the role of your unit's Commander, and will be represented on the battlefield by a miniature figure!
34750.name: Dresda

34751.name: Fetch the Ink
34751.description:
From the instructions: Fetch the Ink! was devised to give an entertaining insight into printshop routine, which can be pretty hectic at times! In view of the tight delivery deadlines involved there is often a fine line between human error and superhuman achievement.

"Ink is a basic essential for printing, so the winner of the game is the player whose team is the first to reach the coveted ink buckets in the centre of the board."

Each player starts off at the printing press in the colored corresponding corner and strives to reach the matching ink bucket in the middle of the board.

There are two circuits linked by four cross paths and a player must try to reach the colour spectrum via the line of squares in his or her colour.

34752.description:
Clubhouse Golf Dice Game loosely simulates a round of golf through the same scoring system - the lower the number of strokes, the better your score. The game comes with 5 dice: A white Tee die, a light green Fairway (F) die, a blue Water (W) die, a yellow Sand (S) die and a dark green putting (G for Green) die. Except for the putting die, the dice have letters on them indicating the next die to be cast. The putting die has numbers on it.

Each hole, a player starts by rolling the Tee die (the first stroke). Subsequently, the player rolls the next die indicated by the previous die, adding one stroke to their score for each die rolled. However, when the Water die is rolled, the player adds 2 strokes instead. When the Green (G) is rolled, the player rolls the putting die and adds the number rolled to his/her score - the hole then ends for that player and his/her score is the number of strokes played. Players can play 18 holes for a full round of golf. The lowest total score wins.

It's easier to get a hole-in-one in this game than in real golf - roll 'G' on the Tee die, followed by a roll of '0' on the putting die.
34752.name: Clubhouse Golf Dice Game

34753.name: Tacoma Trivia
34753.description: For 2-4 players or teams interested in the trivia of Tacoma Washington. Comes with a colorful board and trivia cards. For Ages 13 and up

34754.name: UNO: Hannah Montana
34754.description: For Hannah Montana fans Ages 7 and up. Customized Uno version that comes with two special cards that change the game play. 112 cards with lots of pictures from the show.

34755.name: Isabella
34755.description: The player who returns to the castle with his two knights and brings the ring of Isabella with him/her wins the game.

34756.name: Zwergen-Rennen
34756.description:
Content:
board, 4 wooden dwarves, 8 jewels, 4 "rope" stones, 1 die

The game idea is for your dwarf to cross over the canyon using the log , then to unload the jewel, run back, pick up the second jewel,balance it across the canyon once again and unload it a second time and finally to run back to the starting place. The whole thing done as fast as possible and without falling down.

34757.name: Highway Mary Kay
34757.description:
This boardgame simulates the life of a Mary Kay sales consultant, as she goes from consultant to National Sales Director and earns the highest possible amount of money.

The game includes the board, 4 markers, 1 die, playing money(Pinks), 200 Recruit Cards, 25 Consultant Cards, 20 Director Cards, 75 Offspring Director Cards.

There are minor obstacles to overcome, and players must recruit and sell, win contests, attend the Seminar, and eventually earn a Mercedes and attain the position of National Sales Director.

34758.name: The Cooking Game
34758.description:
In this set collection game, players make circuits of the kitchen on the playing board, picking up ingredients (cards) from the various collection points (Larder, Garden, Kitchen Cupboard, Cellar and Back Door) in an attempt to be the first to make a finished meal (a main course and either a starter or pudding).

Each main course has 12 items to collect, each starter and pudding has 6, and the various collection points supply different types of items (e.g. bacon and butter from the fridge in the Larder, herbs and vegetables from the Garden, alcohol from the Cellar).

In addition to these, the board has several "lose a turn" spaces (some of which can be avoided by assistance found through answering the Front Door, e.g. a visiting niece who will help with the dishes), as well as two Telephone squares. Using these, players can challenge each other to hand over required items for the meal they are trying to compose.

At the end, points are scored for complete courses, any bonus items collected to go with the meal (e.g. flowers, or After Eight mints), and players may even try to convince the others that combinations of currently unused cards from their hands produce viable (but lower scoring) meals - the other players vote on whether such suggestions are acceptable. Any completely unused cards negatively affect the final scorings.

34759.name: TETO, the cardgame
34759.description:
ENGLISH:
From the rules booklet: "TETO: the cardgame implements the jokish traditional Spanish game into a non-collectible cardgame. We tried to catch the essence of this game without altering its mechanics."The components are two cards, a third card as front page (which is not needed to play), and a rules booklet. Plays similar to "head or tails", but with different
victory scenarios. The game pictures are humorous, they aren't gross, so is suitable for Ages 16 and up.

Although the game is not collectible, there are 4 different sets. Each set is auto playable, and all four play the same, the only difference is in the artwork of the cards. When you buy a game of Teto, you get one random set of the 4 available.



ESPAÑOL:
Del libreto de reglas: "TETO: el juego de cartas es una adaptación del popular juego español "Teto" al mundo de los juegos de cartas no coleccionables. Hemos intentado plasmar lo mejor posible la esencia de este tradicional entretenimiento manteniendo intacta su mecánica."Los componentes son dos cartas, una tercera carta a modo de portada (que no se necesita para jugar) y un librillo de reglas. El juego propone diferentes escenarios de victoria. Las imágenes del juego son humorísticas sin resultar groseras, con lo que Teto es adecuado de 16 años en adelante.

Aunque el juego en sí no es coleccionable, existen 4 modelos diferentes. Cada modelo es autojugable y los cuatro se juegan de forma idéntica, siendo las ilustraciones de las cartas lo único que cambia. Cuando compras un Teto, obtienes un modelo al azar de los 4 disponibles.

34760.name: Quiz mit Pfiff
34760.description: As many quiz-questions as possible have to be answered correctly, in order to reach the finish by correct answers and a good portion of luck. The winner may call himself "Pfiffikus".

34761.name: Fast Game System
34761.description:
A system of simple map, movement, and command rules designed to be used with any skirmish miniatures rules.

The designer says: "FGS is a simple system to be used as a support for skirmish miniature rules. The idea is quite simple: to provide a mechanism to make it possible to move your figures without any ruler while keeping the special 'feeling' of the 3-dimensional terrain."

"FGS is composed of two parts: the Movement System and the Command System; both systems can be used independently: the Movement System can be easily introduced on every existing skirmish rule to allow an easy management of the figures on the 3-dimensional map. The Command System can be used to create non-deterministic sequences of play."

34762.name: Der Zahlen-Markt
34762.description: The idea of the game is to buy as many products as possible with your own money. At the end, the player who has bought the most items wins.

34763.name: THE ROAD TO BERLIN: The Last Act in the East
34763.description:
Work continues on this long-awaited design by Joseph Youst. The current development team is moving to polish this operational simulation of the most intense four months of combat in the history of War.

German Army Groups keep supplies and the Luftwaffe's air power moving to support their subordinate armies holding the threatened bulwark in the East. Soviet Fronts keep supplies and the Red Falcons flooding west with the armies heading toward the target of Stalin's vengeance: BERLIN.

THE ROAD TO BERLIN: The Last Act in the East contains:

three Joseph Youst maps - one 22 x 34 inches, one 22 x 42 inches, one 34 x 44 inches - covering Europe from Courland to Hungary, and from the western border of the Soviet Union to central Germany

1500+ 1/2 inch die-cut back printed counters showing the military forces that took part - Axis divisions plus separate brigades, regiments, and companies - and Soviet corps and their supporting divisions, brigades and regiment forces

VISTULA '45: Germany's Last Offensive - This introductory scenario combines all of the combat interactions in this system in the struggle for the town of Stargard, where the German Army expended its utmost efforts to hold back the enemy. Historically, this fight caused considerable concern in the Kremlin and allowed thousands of civilians to escape to the west. [Note: VISTULA '45: will also be available separately in Folio format.]

Included: charts, rules, dice, boxed (box was ordered in 1994!)

34764.description:
One of the keys to the decision to re-issue 48th Panzer Korps - Battles on The River Chir, is that Designer James Zoldak has gone forward with the companion wargame, 57th PANZER KORPS The Strong Right Hook, that deals with the struggles at Kotelnikovo and between the Rivers Aksay and Mishkova. The German thrust had to breach the Soviet blocking position at Vasilevka before Operation Donnerschlag ("Thunder Clap" -- the planned breakout by the forces in the Stalingrad pocket) could begin.

57th PANZER KORPS The Strong Right Hook presents key military challenges to both sides: The Germans know where they must go... and the Soviets know it too; The Soviets must seek to stop the relieving advance in a contest of mobile forces where the Germans have the edge in skill, but not in numbers.

57th PANZER KORPS - The Strong Right Hook contains:
one 22 by 34 inch map
200 die-cut counters
rules booklet in Counter Attack Folio Format.
34764.name: 57th PANZER KORPS: The Strong Right Hook

34765.name: Genom det svartaste Afrika
boardgamepublisher: Akt. bol. Ernst Frick & Co., Stockholm
34765.description:
Simple roll-and-move game of traveling in Africa. The game consists of a cardboard folder w/an 8-fold game board paper map attached. No tokens or dice are provided.

The game consists of a series of events, triggered by landing on their respective space. The event legends are described in simple rhymes, and tie in with the board illustrations. They can be beneficial as well as bad. Players race to be first to #100.

The game is probably from the late 1920ies or early 30ies, due to spelling and art style. No copyright date is attached.

The art was provided by painter & illustrator Einar Torsslow, and may be considered mildly racist today (the Negroes are depicted with black-face), and there is a reference to cannibals in event #62. The tone is more that of a childrens adventure tale than anything else, though.

The following information is provided on the back of the folder: Akt. bol. Ernst Frick & Co. / Stockholm / Pris 2:75 / Haeggströms lito. 200302

34766.name: UNO: Fraggle Rock
34766.description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the television series, "Fraggle Rock." This version of Uno has a special card/rule which does not correspond to any card in regular Uno, the "Travelling Matt" card, which allows a player to see other players' cards.

34767.name: UNO: Pirates of the Caribbean at World's End
34767.description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the film "Pirates of the Caribbean at World's End." This version of Uno has a special card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Black Pearl" card.

34768.name: UNO: High School Musical 2
34768.description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the Disney Channel musical "High School Musical 2." This version of Uno has an additional card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Sharpay" card, which lets a player sabotage his opponents.

34769.name: UNO: The Nightmare Before Christmas
34769.description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the Disney movie, "The Nightmare Before Christmas." This version of Uno has an additional card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Oogie-Boogie" card.

34770.name: UNO: Hi Hi Puffy Amiyumi
34770.description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the Cartoon Network animated series "Hi Hi Puffy Amiyumi." This version of Uno comes with a special card which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the Rock-'n'-Swap card.

34771.name: UNO: Ratatouille
34771.description: This version of Uno uses the theme of the Disney/Pixar movie: "Ratatouille." Includes a special card not found in regular Uno, the "Recipe For Chaos" card.

34772.name: UNO: Magic Treehouse
34772.description: This is a version of Uno themed on The Magic Treehouse, a series of children's books for young readers. This version of Uno includes a special card not found in regular Uno, the "Fly Away" card, which operates both as Wild card and also allows a player to "Fly Away" and look at another player's hand.

34773.name: UNO: Spider-Man 2
34773.description: This themed version of Uno is based on the movie "Spider-Man 2" (although the card uses comic-book style illustrations as opposed to pictures from the movie itself). This version of Uno includes a special card/rule which does not correlate to any card found in regular Uno, the "Justice" card.

34774.name: UNO: Over the Hedge
34774.description: This themed version of Uno is based on the family film, "Over the Hedge." This version includes a special card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the Verminator's "Trap" card.

34775.name: UNO: Happy Feet
34775.description: This themed version of Uno is based on the family film, "Happy Feet." This version has an additional, special card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "MAMBO!" card.

34776.name: UNO: WWE Legends of Wrestling
34776.description:
This is a themed version of Uno based on the WWE. The cards feature WWE wrestlers including the Junkyard Dog, the Iron Sheik, "Rowdy" Roddy Piper, Bobby "The Brain" Heenan, "The Mouth of The South" Jimmy Hart, and Sgt. Slaughter.

This version of Uno has a special card/rule that does not correlate with any card in the regular version of Uno, the "1-2-3" card.

34777.name: UNO: Boston Red Sox
34777.description: This themed vesion of Uno features the 2004 World Series Champion Boston Red Sox players and team. This version of Uno includes a special card/rule that does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "ESRUC" card and rule commemorating Jason Varitek and Keith Foulke in the ultimate celebratory embrace after winning the championship.

34778.name: UNO: Red Sox 07 World Series Champions
34778.description:
This themed version of Uno features the second World Series championship won by the Boston Red Sox this decade (2007).

This version of Uno includes a special card/rule that does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Sweep" card.

34779.name: UNO: San Antonio Spurs
34779.description: This themed vesion of Uno features the NBA Basketball Team the San Antonio Spurs. This version of Uno includes a special card/rule that does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Dunk" card.

34780.description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the amnimated classic "It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown!" This version has an additional, special card which does not correlate to an card in regular Uno, the "Trick or Treat!" card.
34780.name: UNO: It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown

34781.name: Soda Pop
34781.description: Subtitled "A Primary Pop-O-Matic Game", this is a simple color-matching game for children Ages 4 - 7. Each player has their own "factory" pegboard and a soda bottle peg in a matching color. The pegboard shows columns of bottles in red, yellow, green, or two-color stripes. The player pops the Pop-O-Matic bubble and moves the peg to a space matching that color. The first one to the top of their board wins.

34782.name: Five Little Monkeys Jumping on the Bed Card Game
34782.description:
A card game for 2 or more players Ages 3 and up.

The first player to make the target number number of pairs is the winner. A player can only match one type of pairs throughout the game; either happy monkeys or sad monkeys.

Based on the popular book series by Eileen Christelow.

34783.name: A Hole in Your Pocket
34783.description:
Objective: to be the first player to hold a hand of plus cards that add up to one dollar without having any minus cards.

Players are dealt a hand of five cards. Players draw one card from draw pile. Minus cards may be discarded by discarding a plus card of the same value at the same time. If there are no minus cards in a player's hand, play moves to the next player. Play continues, with the discard pile being shuffled to form a new draw pile, until one player reaches the objective.

34784.name: The Spiderwick Chronicles Creature Capture Card Game
34784.description:
From the manufacturer's catalog:

See who can capture the most creatures! Each creature requires a unique mix of cards. Players must decide when to go to battle and when to save up for a future fight in this fast-paced card game. Features characters from the book series and movie.

34785.name: Murder Mystery Mansion
34785.description:
Murder Mystery Mansion comes with a 3-D mansion card rack and features anime-style artwork.

The first player or team chooses four different cards; a murderer, a weapon, a location and a motif. The cards are placed behind the 3D mansion, so the other player or team can't see them.
The second player or team tries to solve the mystery. He chooses four cards, like the first player, and places them upon the stairs. The first player or team tells the other which cards are right.If the second team or players guess the right murderer, weapon, location and motif before they reach the top of the stairs, then they earn a point.

Now the players or teams change their position. The first player or team which reaches the top of the stairs with the scoremarker win the game.

34786.name: Paddington's Travels
34786.description:
Millions of children have met Michael Bond's famous bear from darkest Peru, in books and television.
Now they can help Paddington on his travels!
The object of the game is to collect photographs and souvenirs of his adventure. The first person to complete their scrapbook and take Paddington back home to Windsor Gardens is the winner.

34787.name: Geomancy
34787.description:
Geomancy is the practice of divination through tossing dirt. Perhaps in the same fashion, we can learn more about the world around us by tossing plastic pyramids. Through playing, the subject learns to communicate with the plastic pyramids within.

Geomancy is an Icehouse game played with one stash per player and a chessboard.

Geomancy is played in three rounds. In the first round, players take turns casting all of their small stones. The second round is all about casting medium stones. Finally, the game is concluded by casting out the large stones. While some players are recasting, other players are reorienting their pyramids. The goal is to cast and orient in a way that you can capture the other players stones. Points are awarded for your stones on the field at the end of the game along with the stones you have captured.

Complete rules can be found at the Icehouse Games Wiki.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

34789.name: Dancing with the Stars Card Game
34789.description:
From the University Games catalog:

Players become judges in this hilarious game. To win, players must correctly win actual dances from the show by playing the correct dancer card with each specific dance. Fun for fans of the show and fans of dancing.

Ages 8 and up

34790.name: Who Said...Follow the Prophets Game
34790.description:
Card game for families/children aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community.

Players try to match up ancient and modern prophets with things they said and facts about them.

34791.name: Choose the Right Match Game
34791.description: This is a matching card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community and asks players to match images and religious facts based on characters and concepts from the Book of Mormon.

34792.name: Righteous! Book of Mormon Edition
34792.description:
Similar to the popular Scene It! DVD games, Righteous! gives Latter-day Saints a fun and interactive way to learn about the people, places, and events in the Book of Mormon. The game spaces are pictures of the prophets and other individuals throughout the Book of Mormon, organized in chronological order. Players or teams roll the number die and the action die. Players first follow one of the actions, including the chance to answer a multi-play DVD question. If they answer correctly, then they move the number of spaces shown on the second die until they get to the "Seal the Deal" portion, where they will go through a special set of questions to win the game. The first player or team to "Seal the Deal" wins! An ideal family night activity.
Contents:

Adjustable Game Board
Righteous! Dice
Four Book of Mormon Character Game Pieces
Stack of Golden Question Cards
Stack of Blessed or Suppressed Cards
Righteous! Book of Mormon Edition DVD

34793.name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexen-Einmaleins
34793.description: Bibi Blocksberg and her 3 witch friends got a detention class: Their lesson: Her multiplication class was not successful. Therefore they need practice. They need to collect chips for the detention first. Winner is the player with the most points.

34794.name: Fishing for Nephites
34794.description: This is a children's/family card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community. Cards have images and information from the Book of Mormon, and the game utilizes a rule set fairly similar to that of a Go-Fish type game.

34795.name: Bishop Rick
34795.description: This is a family/children's card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community. The game uses a rule set somewhat similar to that of an "Old Maid" type card game. The cards include information related to callings/positions people hold in the LDS church.

34796.name: Articles of Faith Card Game
34796.description: This is a trivia/memory card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community. Players receive cards with "Articles of Faith" (statements of religious belief) on them, then compete to see who can recall and recite back the statements, using a die to determine how much of the statement will have to be remembered.

34797.name: Concentrate on LDS Presidents
34797.description: This is a family card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community. It utilizes a concentration/matching ruleset to have players to learn and utilize facts about LDS church leaders in order to make matches.

34798.name: The Old Shell Game
34798.description: The object of The Old Shell Game is to be the first player to get his/her shell with the hidden pea to the opposite side of the board. Four player games can be played as individuals or as partners. Each player receives 3 shells and only one pea. The players secretly shuffle their shells, and places them on the three squares of their color. Players take turns. Two dice are rolled, and one shell is moved the number of one dice and another shell is moved the number of the other dice. A challenge occurs if one player's shell lands on the same space as an opponent's shell. The challenged player must lift up his shell, and if the shell contains the pea, then the challenger loses. The challenged player loses if no pea is uncovered. The following points are added to each player's score: 20 points for reaching the finish with your shell that has the pea; 10 points for a successful challenge; and 5 points for successfully defending a challenge. Several rounds are played until a player or team reaches a score of 100 points.

34800.name: Lustiges Begriffe-Raten
34800.description: This game is a really funny and creative quiz game which children like to play. Out of 440 funny sentences creative children develop a lot more brain teasers.

34802.name: Finger weg von meiner Kohle!
34802.description:
Do you have so little pocket change that you can't get through the month? Do you want to stop to this! With this game you quickly learn how you can add to your pocket money so that you have more money at the end of the month. But be careful: Everywhere there are dangerous opportunities to spend that extra money again. You have to be steady to overcome those temptations. Then you will become "pocket money king"!
Similar to Das Taschengeld Spiel

34803.name: Spiel-Hölle
34803.description: At a round course of the board there are 6 gambling halls where you can play two or 3 different games of luck.

34804.name: Sticky Wicket
34804.description: Sticky Wicket! The Sticky Wicket Cricket board game in a slim-line portable flip top case for Cricketers, Coaches, Cricket Fans and Umpires worldwide. Whenever rain stops play, do not despair just open up your umbrella and the Sticky Wicket Cricket board game and carry on playing on this perfectly packaged portable game in a slim-line case. If you have got a cricketer or a cricket fan in your life, regardless of which County or Country they support, this slim-line Cricket board game might be the perfect celebration gift or you could, of course, just keep it for yourself. This is a Quikky dice rolling game with simple rules for 2 players of any age from Ages 9 and up and each player plays a full innings both batting or bowling - test match style, county style, limited over or Twenty20.

34805.name: Clip-on
34805.description: The idea is to build words out of the deck of characters or to snatch them away from other players and to win with the longest chain of words.

34806.name: Mirror Game
34806.description:
(from the back of the box)

An exciting game which is also both amusing and instructive. The game commences by turning up a pattern card. Each player then attempts to form a mirror image of the pattern using 2 bricks and a mirror. The first to succeed wins the pattern card. The player collecting [the] most pattern cards wins the game. Using the mirror can be tricky, and an understanding of the symmetry of a pattern is an advantage in the game.

34807.name: Puchar Europy
34807.description:
Original Polish board game about Football Cup of Europe. Includes 32 teams which won National Championships in 1983/4 season. They are divided in three groups of power.

In the game are six original dice. They are used to draw a result of matches. Teams from the most powerful group use the best brown (0,1,3,3,4,4) and red (0,1,2,2,4,5) dice. The second group uses yellow (0,1,2,2,4,4) and green (0,1,1,2,3,5) dice. The worst group uses blue (0,1,1,2,3,4) and black (0,0,1,1,3,5) dice.

Board shows a football field. Puchar Europy based on Road to Wembley.

34808.description:
The cards are thoroughly shuffled and a dealer deals each player 4 cards. Remaining cards are placed in the centre of the table. The object in Piggy is to collect all four cards the same. The first player decides on a card they don;t want and pass it to the player on their left. Play continues, with players deciding on whether to draw a new card from the deck or pass one of their own. Once a player has collected their set of 4, they stick out their tongue! As other players notice, they follow suit. The last person to notice receives a letter token P, I, G, G, or Y. The winner is the last person in, with the least number of letters.
Shorter versions can be played by just playing to P, I, G or deciding on how many rounds to play before starting.
34808.name: Piggy

34810.name: The Recess Dungeon Game
34810.description:
The Recess Dungeon Game is a competitive dungeon crawl where players run Heroes through a dark maze looking for the Dragon and the Dragon's Treasure. The first Player to exit his or her Hero from the Dungeon with the Dragon's Treasure is the winner.

Features rules for doors, traps, magic treasure, monsters, Hero to Hero combat, and more.

Game requires one player to take on the role of the Referee. Simple game with high replayability. Adaptable to any setting fictional or other. Games are short and brutal with high Hero mortality.
Referee may participate in game by running a special Hero called the Villain.

34811.name: Pylon
34811.description:
The game is played in two phases: a placement phase, in which all the pyramids are placed onto the board, followed by a stacking phase, in which pyramids are collected into stacks.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces




Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Winner in 6th Competition

34812.description:
Intersect is a placement and capture game, with each player having two stashes of 15 Icehouse pyramids and four sets of four cards numbered 1-4 (regular playing cards will suffice, with the aces standing in for 1). Players sit adjacent to your opponent, facing at a right angle, rather than opposite their opponent.

Complete rules can be found at IcehouseGames.COM

Game System

Icehouse Pieces
34812.name: Intersect

34813.description:
Quintazone is a game somewhat like Carcassonne played with an Aquarius deck and Icehouse pieces. The game ends when all Element cards have been placed. All Goal cards are then revealed, and every pyramid scores points for its owner: its size (1, 2, or 3) multiplied by the size (number of cards) of its Zone, doubled if the element of the Zone matches the player's Goal card. The player with the most total points wins.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces
34813.name: Quintazone

34814.name: Poder Galáctico
34814.description:
You don't have it easy at all, since your adversaries are going to treat to prevent you winning the game, but you have to try to be the first one establishing your bases on five planets of foreign control, it means, out of your planetary system of origin.

Bloody game of planetary strategy to the old usage.

CONTENT:
- Instructions
- Board
- 20 red balls
- 20 yellow balls
- 20 blue balls
- 20 green balls
- 4 big balls of every previous color
- 4 stands
- 1 plastic box
- 20 cartons of power
- 50 cards
- 4 spacecrafts

Amuse yourself conquering the galaxy, alliances and perfidies will be on play.

34815.name: Word Storm
34815.description: Players simultaneously draw and play random letter tiles vertically and horizontally to build a crossword. When a player creates one or more words with all the tiles, they call out Word Storm. All players then grab 4 more tiles and continue playing until the tiles run out and one player uses up all of his or her letter tiles. Players score points based on their words and are penalized for the letters they don’t use.
